Runs from N-S Pass at 5.2N, 4E on the NE to Chosen Way at on the SW. Separates mountains to NW from forest to the SE. Go north, go south, or bring your 500+ jump skill. Otherwise youre not getting through. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: The Chosen Way
location.description: This is a way around the south edge of The Sawtooth. Its convoluted, and runs through a series of passes, but it gets you from the forest up or the plateau down. From the forest start up the pass at . -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Giant Fijord Ford
location.description:
It doesnt show on the map, but theres long fijord cutting in from the west sea here. This is one place to cross it, there may be many others. This is on the route from Stonehold to Plateau. -- Doc Feelgood
Not a Fijord...its Lake Lithanen and the river that flows west to the ocean according to the original Asherons Call map. -- Sparky 2/14/00

location.name: Forsythia Tower
location.description: An empty tower near Plateau with forsythias planted in front of it. Nothing else of note. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tumerok Fortress Portal (Overlord Quest)
location.description:
Home of the Tumerok Overlord and his uber chest. High lockpick is almost essential here. This dungeon portal is in the tower of the huge, heavily populated Tumerok Fortress. Level 20+, tieable, but not summonable. You can sneak around the back and tie to the portal without having to go in the fort. You can then portal recall inside. If you wish to save your tie, you can pick the entry door on the South side, the resistance is 650. There is also a key for this door, and keys for all the other doors in the dungeon. See the writeup at Maggie the Jackcats site for more details. After running around the dungeon a bit, you come to an octagonal room with blue gemstones. In the south wall near 2 blue gemstone pillars there is a secret passage to the final diff 700 locked door to the Overlords chamber. The Overlord is guarded by Virindi Preceptors and a few Tumeroks. He has a lightning Overlords quest sword that is no drop, and a no drop key to his chest. -- Doc Feelgood -- Anon -- Zimbalt/Hirachi -- Taarna Blood SC
He drops a key (1 week timer) for his chest which has 20-60 sing-quality items in it (good chance at something decent). Ive done this quest many times throughout the years, it does not require lockpick. There is a long quest for the keys, but they are not required either. The route is much longer without lockpick, but its doable. -- Driden of Frostfell 11/5/2003
Come and see the happy Tumerok Champions, as they jump on your head from above. Come see the Augmented Tumeroks, and Ascendants, who are always delighted to show off their magic. Come and have your toes nibbled by half a dozen Wasteland Rats. Come and unlock those locked doors and the Overlords Chest. Come and visit the imprisoned monsters and a bizarre floor full of mushrooms. Surrounded by about a dozen ever-friendly Virindi Preceptors is a Tumerok Overlord, who will be happy to slap you about a bit after youve been turned into a quivering wreck of weakness, frailty and slowness by his hooded companions.-- Goldhart

location.name: Huge Tumerok Fort
location.description:
Its big, Jim! Eight towers and over 30 tumeroks and drudges inside, about equal numbers guarding the walls on the outside. At least one High Tumerok. Approach from the east ridge line, west ridge side is full of shadows and gromnies. Front Door is on the south, and very hard to pick. If youve got an army looking for something to do, bring it here. -- Doc Feelgood
Inside it is easy to get overpowered by the Tumerok Officers, Gladiators, and High Tumeroks. There are also three Gold Wasps that do their best to get in your way. Checkout the tower with the dungon portal, which has some spooky lights. 4/7/2000

location.name: Mite Bunker
location.description:
One of those bunker-looking things. Must have been 50 mites inside of all types. -- Helios
Nothing selectable here besides the mites.. :O -- Mengar -LC 10/12/2000

location.name: Skeleton Ambush
location.description:
Looks like the entrance to Thasali Dungeon (a short way north), but its not. Its an entrance with no portal, but full of eight or so skeletons which spawn only after you come in. Look for a portal on your radar, if theres no portal, its this ambush place. -- Doc Feelgood
I walked in and the whole floor stood up!! Two skels, two skel warriors, and a skel captian. Chest seems to have less than the Captain. -- Tesslah 4/29/2000

location.name: Lifestone and Merchant
location.description: Lifestone and merchant. Servicing the Drudge and Skeleton towers. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Arch Mage Tower
location.description: Tower with Archmage, Lifestone and portal to Heartland, a farm just west of Fort Witshire. Tower is patrolled by some high level skellies and armodillos. -- Igor

location.name: Tumerok Fort
location.description: Entrance is to the South. It is full (Read: ton, Lots, Many,) Tumeroks including Prest, Scouts, Fighters, and Yes, Gladerors. -- Willow

location.name: Mushroom Valley
location.description: Follow the valley next to Fort Tethiana south and you get here. The valley starts to grow giant mushrooms here, and the golems change from Granite to Iron. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Liche Ambush
location.description: An innocent looking farm house in a glen, surrounded by Granite Golems and a Gold Phantos Wasp. They dont show up on radar until you get next to the door, but there are two Liches inside, also a chest. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Seacoast Tower
location.description: A lonely seacoast tower with a large braisure in at the top. Also two liches inside and a gromnie waiting at the base. No chests, no portals or other objects inside. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tumerok Post
location.description:
On the south edge of a featureless and relatively quiet plan near Fort Tethiana. No level restrictions, no distinguishing features in the landscape around it, a couple limestone golems lollygagging around the entrance. I did not get inside. -- Doc Feelgood
The upper level is mostly Tumeroks -- scouts, warriors, gladiators, perhaps an officer. I didnt get below the 1st level. -- Doc Feelgood 5/1/2000

location.name: Lost Wish Range
location.description:
A semi-circular knife cut in Dereth. This picturesque escarpment runs west from the seacoast at . It cuts off any overland travel north from Arwic, and east from Collier Mines. The northeast side is the high side and the views are spectacular. -- Doc Feelgood
This is actually the Lost Wish Range, its official name from Turbine. A better name to be sure. -- Sparky 3/1/2000
better name for sure? not if youre its discoverer! Im El Badasso, Docs scout. -- Doc Feelgood 4/12/2000
El Badasso is the impassible escarpment *in* the Lost Wish Mountains. -- Doc Feelgood 4/18/2000

location.name: Cliff Break
location.description: The seacoast here is bordered by cliffs, with lots of Water Wisps on them enjoying the sea breeze. This is a break in the cliffs that will let you get to the beach. In the distance SE you can see an island. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tower and 1/2 wall
location.description: Tower and half wall located near Tumerok Mine. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone just northeast of Qalabar. There is a peddler and a healer here as well. Decent hunting (mattekars, lugians, golems) nearby. -- Orbin

location.name: Mountain Cavern Portal
location.description: This is entrance to Lost city of Frore, the portal is located on top of a mountain peek. The only way to get to it is to bring Gelidite Standing Stone Translation to Mairisa bint Fuda in Plateau Village. She will then open portal and give you a treasure chest key.

location.name: Al-Arqas Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Al-Jalima Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Arwic Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Baishi Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Cragstone Meeting Hall
location.description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
Drops out at 26.0N, 48.1E -- Willow 2/17/00 Moved to 26.0N, 49.1E from 25.9N, 47.1E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Glenden Wood Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Hebian-To Meeting Hall
location.description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
Use the meeting hall entrance to your advantage! Get a golem, gromnie, shark, whatever to chase you. Run in front of the steps to the meeting hall and then quickly dart around the corner. If done right, the monster will run up the steps to the meeting hall and get stuck. You are then free to cast spells and fire missiles at the helpless creature all you want. Be careful not to fire when they are running away from your position, because you will overshoot them. Best place to fire is between the pillar and the wall of the hall. Havent tried to get one in the actual portal room yet. I think they might not be able to actually go into the portal room at all! -- Regis 4/22/2000
Good staging spot for mud/water golem hunting, but watch for shadow children. They and wasps *will* follow you into the portal room! -- Ognam 11/15/2000 In town now, moved to 39.3S, 83.3E from 38.9S, 86.6E -- 5/13/2004

location.name: Holtburg Meeting Hall
location.description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
This is a great place to buff for low lvls on DT. As it is better mana recovery then the stonehenge at Holt -- Ironimo 7/22/2003 Moved to 42.2N, 33.9E from 41.5N, 35.2E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Khayyaban Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 48.2S, 24.4E from 47.6S, 26.4E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Lin Meeting Hall
location.description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
A local allegiance uses this place as their 24 hour meeting hall. This doesnt mean that the place is closed off, it just means that you should expect a crowd there -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
on what server is there a crowd?usually empty when I go in there. -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000 Moved to 54.8S,73.2E from 54.5S, 71.9E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Lytelthorpe Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Mayoi Meeting Hall
location.description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
Moved to 61.4S, 81.8E from 61.6S, 83.4E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Nanto Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Qalaba'r Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Rithwic Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 10.9N, 58.2E from 10.3N, 57.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Samsur Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 2.8S,19.7E from 5.0S, 18.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Shoushi Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 33.3S, 73.0E from 33.7S, 71.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Tou-Tou Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Tufa Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Uziz Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Yanshi Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Yaraq Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: Zaikhal Meeting Hall
location.description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

location.name: The Obsidian Bridge
location.description:
That huge Obsidian Bridge, the old coords entered put it somewhere near Plateau Village. Between Holrburg and Cragstone, you know the rest....or should! -- Krltplps
Even though I should, I dont, tell me more? -- Yulof 3/15/2000
The Obsidian span was only recently rediscovered after the powerful magics that hid it from sight were dispelled. Current theory holds that the Span was rendered invisible by the Emperyans in a futile attempt to hold back the Olthoi invasion, since Olthoi are known to fear open water. -- Necron 3/24/2000

location.name: Amperehelion Vault
location.description: This is where you get the Major Sparking Stone. Lightning Elementals and Sable Gromnies-- Geomancer

location.name: Jahannan Vault
location.description: You can get the Major Smoldering Stone at end of this dungeon. You may encounter Fire Elementals, Mountain Rats, and Zefirs.

location.name: Bridge
location.description: This is the Cragstone side of the new bridge - gets you to Arwic and back. Nice design very 1960s :-) -- Ostancragstone side begins at 34.6N,40.4E -- Ragnarok II 4/17/2000

location.name: Bridge
location.description: Arwac side of Bridge. -- Ostan

location.name: Coldeve Festival Stone
location.description: Your run of the Mill Festival Stone located just east of the most southern Town of Kara. -- Stern

location.name: Igloo
location.description:
Aluvian stone (ice) and book that needs translation. Several Ice Golems and Etherial Wisps guard the igloo. Random mattekar and monouga spawns nearby. On the run from Holtburg I must have slain 50 or so wood golems and not a single mote. -- Elric Kinslayer
Location of Minor Shivering Stone. Guarded by Ethereal Wisps and Ice Golems. -- Ignatius Loyola 3/9/2000
No Ice Golems in sight, but the Ethereal Wisps were there. These Wisps may be level 5, but they tend to use drain health. Be careful. My gfx card is maxd out on settings and I run in 1280x1024. When I walked inside, the smoke and steam caused my PC to lag. No monsters in sight. Relatively easy, but the run here can take forever.... -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
YOu do not need to fight the wisp to get the gem and book. Simply run by or shoot at ice golems to draw them away from igloo. Then kill the ice golem and walk right past the wisps. The wisp wont attack you unless they are attacked or are near when you attack the ice golems. -- porkmaster 4/26/2000
You Dont even need to fight the golems just run right into the igloo and you will not have to fight anything the golems cant get you from there, and after awhile they see you as no threat and they go back to resting -- DV 6/21/2000

location.name: Mountainous Fortress
location.description: Populated with Shadows and Zefirs. Hamud ibn Rafik, the father of Devana bint Hamudi resides at the bottom of this dungeon behind a locked door. A key from Devana is needed to see him.

location.name: Slaughter House
location.description:
Near the exit of the Slaughter House portal in South Direlands. This is the Slaughter House. A large Tumerok fort with a single tower. High Tumerok in the tower, three or four priests on the grounds, numerous others, lots and lots of cows and auroch cattle inside, too. Lurkers and stalkers outside to the north and reenforcement tumeroks in the low walled building to the south. Approach from the east. Gate is locked, get a key from one of the Tumeroks in the tower next to the Slaughter House portal, or pick it... takes good, but not superb, pickskill (base 100 plus buffs and lock weakens). Good hunting if you can handle the spawn pace. Fort Tethana is a reasonable run due east. -- Doc Feelgood
Due to some strange spawning bug in the March update this area is now BLANKETED with gold wasps. There is a wasp right next to where the portal drop you so be prepare to fight or flight as soon as your feet hit the ground. Fort Teth is just a short run to the East if you can make it pass the gang of gold wasp guarding the area. -- Kexin 2/21/2000

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: -- TwistSternseher

location.name: Lifestone
location.description:
-- TwistSternseher
This is the East Yaraq Lifestone. Also a couple of shops here. -- Tantheos 3/26/2000

location.name: Serac Vault
location.description:
Huge place, when you first enter you are in a small room and hall, from here you must jump down to 3 lich lords(I left). No exit so portal out, die, or fight lich lords. Looks to be part of the March Quest, since I had never seen it before, and the huge room which you must jump into is snowwing so I presume it is the snow portion of the quest. -- Kamaitachi
Dont jump down. Jump across to the ledge. If you look hard, you will see it over on your right when facing the first pit. -- Heysun 2/24/2000
Not just lich lords. Many revenants and dark revenants around as well, all casting level IV+ debuffs and indirect attacks. Exit portal is guarded by at least 4 creatures, at least one of which is a Dark Revenant. -- Hiro 2/25/2000
Home of the Major Shivering Stone. -- Hazridi 3/10/2000
Beware of the spawn rate also. Just at the entrance there can be up to 4-6 Lich Lords and 2 Revenents. I accidentally went here and had some friends try to get me out. I lev 26 War, Monarch Lvl 30 Archer, Lev 33 Mage and lev 43, War. We couldnt kill them fast enough. All but the 43rd Warrior died, and only because he had lifestone recall. At the end we all made a mad dash to try to find an exit. At 1 time i had no less than 15 Lich Lords and Revs on my radar. *shiver* Last time i enter a dungeon b4 i have inof about it. Careful and GL -- Vylarn H-gain 3/16/2000
For those of you who got the Major Stone before the patch (like i did. =D ) your lucky. Now make sure you are buffed up and ready for some serious fightin! Now you arent put in the hall but youre dropped right in the pit to start. fun Fun. :) -- Xzeno 4/7/2000
Good place to camp dark revenants for thighbones.. only other choice is nexus as far as I know and more people came there :) -- mengar 6/13/2000
OK.. Heres a shortcut but you need at least a 270 jump skill. Enter the dungeon and clear the 1st room. Right in front of you when you enter is a passage with a torch above it and a large rock just in front of it to the right. Jump on top of the rock, use shift+jump to jump on top of the torch, turn 180 degrees and jump up to the ledge, follow the ledge back towards the torch, you will come to a pit. Jump diagonal to your left to the large ledge, there is a door there that leads to the end and the Major Stone. Good Luck. -- Crunchyfrog 9/14/2000
I did it with 250 jump, not 270 -- Fullcrum 11/4/2000
I did it with a 223 jump skill. -- Dezran Rogue 7/18/2001
Quite easy to complete. 80% of the time its got macroers or someone hunting the Revenants in there, and if you use the jump shortcut, you can complete this quest without firing one arrow, spell, or swinging the sword. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Right next to the stone you can find the Elaborated Scroll wich later translates at Cragstone translator to the Imperial Missive. David ibn Jensen -- David ibn Jense 1/20/2002
Entrance and Exit are quiet. Portals can be tied to and Recalled, but not summoned. The foyer is hot, covered by three Lich Lords and a Revenant. The only exit portal is at the far end of the dungeon near the Stinging Stone Room. Following a right hand rule will take you through some heavy fighting to a jump into a large, long room. At the far end of the room is the hall leads to the second floor, and ultimately to the Major Stining Stone. Following left hand rule will take you to a quieter section of the dungeon on the first level, and some dead end routes to the second floor. Dungeon is fast spawn with Lich Lords, Revenants and Dark Revenents. -- Doc Feelgood 10/7/2002
Correction: Shivering Stone, not Stinging Stone. -- Doc Feelgood 10/7/2002

location.name: Undead Ambush
location.description:
A House southwest of Yanshi full of undead which only show up on the radar when you enter. -- Finn Djhala
Nice spot for newbie Life mages to drain some good exp. -- Avaton 4/30/2001

location.name: A Lifestone
location.description: A lifestone close to the Plateau portal, but not on the plateau itself. -- Jakob Olafsun

location.name: Escalator Slope
location.description: This is a path up the mountain to reach the Qalabar Portal at . Great views from the top of the mountain. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Incunubula Vault
location.description:
This is part of Marchs Quest. It is where you find the Major Searing Stone for use in the new Pyreal Weapons. It is filled with Olthoi Soldiers. No workers at all. Watch out for the acid, as it burned me for 96 a few times! The stone is near the Surface Portal at the end of the dungeon behind a few Soldiers. Good luck! -- Noah
I found this by accident on 2/17/00 if you question this claim then ask aliera -- Atal 2/21/2000
The portal cannot be tied to. The foyer and the outside are both richly populated, so come prepared for non-stop trouble. -- Doc Feelgood 5/22/2000
This is really not that hard with the right group and acid & pierce protects. I did it with a group of 15 people levels 30-70. Only two were life mages. If you can survive the Olthoi Hordes Nest solo or with one other person, you should be ok here.-- -- Flowing Dragon 10/18/2000
TIt is suggested to tie at swamp temple in the dires and then run to Incubala Vault. Also there is a very nice perch spot for you archers out there, u need at least 250 jump to get on the perch and it is located near the middle of the Vault. I went there by myself but since im an acher with 210 melee D they kicked my ass bad, so i suggest u go wwith a group of between 2-5 to get thru the olthoi onto the perch spot. -- Darks Lord 1/16/2001
One note about the archer perch...heavily camped, and bickering goes on there quite a bit. I would have to say in order of population, this is tougher than OHN by far, especially when you go into the large rooms, Olthoi come out from 8 directions. Great fun though...if you live. -- Punisher Zod 1/24/2001
The perches were removed, as per the August 2001 patch. Tread carefully. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Good. Now if they just took life magic and bows out we might actually have a game going here. -- Sega slayer 12/27/2001

location.name: Impious Temple Portal
location.description:
Inside of the Four Towers. Restricted to lvl20+. May be part of the March quest (as it is new to the Towers). Four Towers Entrance portal still broken (restricted to lvl 5-15) as of this entry. -- Dunc
Contains no less then 5 Undead priests, who are level 41. Also found here a broken staff No idea as to its use -- Daffyd 2/26/2000
Broken staff is part of Impious Staff quest. -- Sol-Noir 3/5/2000
See the 4 towers dungeon notes I entered for more details -- Vincent Price 3/31/2000
Mostly Skeletons throughout much of the dungeon. Early parts of the dungeon are divided into 4 main sectors, 3 of the sectors containing a Skeleton Warrior behind a door with a key youll need later in the dungeon, and one section having a Skeleton Captain. Undead protect the wonderous Naqibs Journal giving you a total of 100 pages at the bruden of some 120! (or some other really low weight, better than buying a book.) You encounter the Undead Priests in the hall and room preceeding the doors you need to use your 4 keys (gathered earlier in the dungeon.) Bring lightning protection. Broken Staff itself is givable, the item has a timer on it so you cant pick it up again quickly (or maybe you can only pick it up once.) Final product is Gharundim. -- Garfield3d 6/24/2000
The comment about Dizah ibn Nadqabs journal not only has the name wrong, it is just plain WRONG. 11 pages, all full, nothing at all wondrous about it. YOu and your buddies can take turns reading it while you wait for the high priest to respawn. 7/30/2000

location.name: Portal Holder
location.description:
Just the hull of a lifestone -- Boccobii
This isnt a broken lifestone hull. This is actually an Empyrean Portal holder of the type such as has Mage Academy and others. -- Senshin -MT 9/14/2000

location.name: 13 Statue Heads
location.description: On the shore of the inland sea ... 13 easter-island heads facing the water. Some upright, some akimbo. No obvious purpose. -- Blayd

location.name: 17 Pillars
location.description: 17 pillars aligned E-W stretch into the inland sea. No obvious purpose. -- Blayd

location.name: Abandoned Building
location.description:
Abandoned Building south of Holtburg at the road to Glenden Wood, 2 drudge sneakers inside. -- Finn Djhala
Be careful herre - If you go into the building and attack the sneakers, all of the drudges in the surrounding area come over to help em out :) -- Jol 2/23/2000
Try it if you want your radar to light up. Must have been 15 spots of light appear from nowhere. -- Joker al-Mekar 5/30/2000
Ideal for restoring vitae the SAFE way, get in, kill drudges inside, and wait by (one)open door for reinforcements to be killed one by one. -- Hagen II 11/22/2000

location.name: Abandoned Building
location.description: Abandoned Building near Holtburg, only one banderling scout here -- Finn Djhala

location.name: Swamp Temple
location.description: Need Carved Key in bunker to east to get past first set of doors.

location.name: Mage Tower To Heartland
location.description: Exits at 22.6N, 37.2E By Farm

location.name: Flower Area
location.description:
othing here but tons of Sandstone Golems and a great screenshot are. Huge towering flowers as far as the eye can see, in every direction. Looking for a great way to show that long forgotten special someone that you care more about them than about about Asherons call, try a flower screenshot! -- Cunnerman
Monsters have changed a bit, and the flower area now extends at least as far east as 30S, 61.5W. -- Doc Feelgood 4/8/2003
...and as far west as just beyond the Essence of Verdancy at 30.5S 75W -- Doc Feelgood 4/11/2003

location.name: Crater Pass
location.description:
A pass into the Crater, avoiding all the Zefs in the Crater Pathway. Stock up on Fire Resistance though, there are NUMEROUS Flares and Flammas gaurding it... -- Rhaziq
Not all THAT many, Id say 3 Flammas and 5 Flares when I ran through. If you have a respectable rn skill, they wont wake up in time anyway. -- CyndalT 5/7/2002

location.name: Black Rat Cave
location.description: One of these bunkers, filled with black rats. -- Finn Djhala

location.name: Fire Cave
location.description:
Cave with many Flames and Flares, contains the Minor Smoldering Stone, the Gharundim elemntal sourcestone. Spawns once an hour. -- Aris
Parchment w/msg from Asheron spawns right after stone - msg is in high Empyrean and must be translated -- Cordt 2/27/2000
Life mages have this one made. Just drain the Flares safely from above. There were about 5. As soon as you hit one, he darts around very fast. If you are not in front of the entrance, you should be ok. -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
To clear up some possible confusion, there are three columns of fire that pulsate in front of the entrance. There are no Flammas here. Good idea to visit the Swamp Cave after leaving here. It is not too far away. Just be prepared... -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000

location.name: South Direlands Portal
location.description: Level 12+, Exits at 84.2S, 34.4W -- Gothmog

location.name: Desert Ridge Border
location.description: Exits at -- Gothmog

location.name: Castle Lifestone
location.description: This is a castle with a lifestone and two town portals -- scourgelord

location.name: Zefir Cave
location.description: Several Azael Zefirs are found here guarding a Runed Chest.

location.name: Swamp Cave
location.description:
The Minor Stinging Stone for the Atlan weapons. Guarded by Mosswarts Shamans and lots of Swamp Rats. South of Yanshi, west of Sawato, as per the rumor. -- Junko
I dont know if it was like this when Junko was there, but I have never seen such a dense population of any monsters anywhere other than here. You attack a Mosswart, about 75 more come to help their bro. Rats are not as bad. Be buffed, stay alive, prepare for a lot of lag. Radar had more orange than black - seriously! I used one Mosswart as a ladder to jump on top of the bunker. This took melee out of the picture. Drained the Shaman and rats one at a time. Took about 20 minutes to clear the place out. -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
Good idea to visit the Fire Cave after leaving here. It is not too far away and is much easier than here. -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
This is a one-room bunker. About 15 Desert Rats are packed inside, and the Minor Stinging Stone is on the ground at the back. If you want a small fight, you can wall work the rats from up top and well behind the entrance without exciting the mosswarts, then do a run in and grab. (June patch) -- Doc Feelgood 6/10/2000
All I can say is easy Quest there was nothing here maybe someone already killed them but that cant be true, cause 10min after i arrived the stone appeared and also a note???? Thats a secret. REGULATORS!!!!!!!! -- NikoliTheSavoir 8/10/2000
You dont even need to fight all the mosswarts inside. Just drian all the rats, then run in and attack the shaman from INSIDE and when all the other mosswarts come they cant get into the bunker. You can safely portal out or wait for them to leave then run off :) -- Nexic 11/10/2000

location.name: Artifex Vault
location.description: Get Stone Tool for Atlan here.

location.name: Tower Lifestone
location.description: By a tower. A peddler also located here. -- Veldah

location.name: Empty Tower
location.description: Empty tower out in the middle of nowhere. -- Ravic

location.name: Rat Nest
location.description:
Bunker-like building full of black rats -- Finn Djhala
Now its three Mountain rats, and a Silver rat in a underground Tomb. -- Zen Tek Ken 6/21/2003

location.name: Zefir Ruins
location.description:
Just southeast of the Shoushi portal to Eastham. The area contains a tower with three to four Zombies and a couple of small dungeons populated by Zefirs and Black Rats. White and Snowy Mattekars, a Spikey Dillo, and a Laigas Lugian stand guard to the east of the buildings. Wood Golems can be found a little further to the southeast. -- Minas Tirith
This spot appears to broken. :( The only monsters that spawn there now, as of 01/14/02, appear to be a Liagus Lugian + Amploth, one Barker Mossie in the western most bunker, and a random spawn farther to the west still on the little hill of Wood Golems and Jade Gromnie. Reedsharks may occasionally spawn next to the lugians guarding the tower. -- Dazar Tae--DT 1/14/2002

location.name: Arwic Festival Stone
location.description: Arwic Festival Stone -- Dunc

location.name: Direlands Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone near a small Blacksmiths hut in the middle of the Direlands. -- Chiun Zen

location.name: Shadow Tower
location.description:
This is an emperyian power station-style building. This place has Pandemonium and Sinister Shadows, half the shadows spawn inside, half outside. Inside is a note-
Im not afraid to say it: Black Ferah is a fool. Assaulting a tomb to steal a relic? Even if this Anadil struck down one of the blessed Hopeslayers Thorns, the creature is dead. Despoiling its tomb does nothing to further our cause and right the ancient wrongs committed against us. And dont you sense the meddling of those cloaked creatures? Why do we waste our time on this pointless raid? Worse yet, we only retrieved a portion of the creatures staff and lost many our breathen in the process. If Black Ferah wants the piece, tell her to come get it, if she can tear herself away from her constant vigil by where the Hopeslayer fell. We are keeping it at the temporary staging ground at 82.3S, 35.2W Signed as unknown. -- Rufen -- Doc Feelgood -- Chrono Crest

location.name: Direlands Old Dead Camp
location.description: Old camp spot with three firepits in a triangle shape, a corpse, and some bone piles in the center. Just a landmark, no items type of corpse. Looks like it is just there to add to the Dires atmosphere. Actually one of the few spots in the Dires where you could safely take a break. Near a Lifestone and Blacksmiths Hut. -- Chiun Zen

location.name: Mountain Cabin
location.description: Just a small cabin inhabited by a Bronze Armoredillo. -- Protector SurgeThis Cabin has been upgraded since and has a Runed Chest guarded by a Hoary Armoredillo. -- 12/18/2003

location.name: Beach Pass
location.description: This beach route is the shortest way from Arwic to the lands north of El Badasso, all inland routes are blocked by cliffs. The southern entrance is at . Beach Pass is rich with wild life: shore armadillos, mud and water golems, mites, and one band of Olthoi. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: North end of Beach Pass
location.description: This is the north end of Beach Pass. From here you can reach the highlands north of El Badasso. Just north of here is golem country -- lots and lots of wood golems and little else. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: South end of Beach Pass
location.description: This is the south end of Beach Pass. From here you can reach the highlands between Arwic and El Badasso. West of here are mites, golems, banderlings and the Mountain Shortcut area. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Fumarole Plain
location.description: A high mountain area with fumaroles in it -- steamy, smokey holes in the ground ala Yellowstone. The fumaroles dont do anything... yet. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Mite Ambush
location.description: A dungeon portal entrance rock, but with no portal in it. It does, however, have lots of mites in it. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Drudge Plain
location.description: This area north east of Holtburg, beyond the river, seems to be thick with drudges and little else. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone next to small tower on the land isthmus west of Qalabar. -- Ming Lee

location.name: Mount Naipenset Caverns
location.description:
North Direlands dungeon restricted to lvl 15 and upper. Lots of granite, copper and iron golems. Beware, access to that place can be dangerous ! there are often gold wasps, silver rats and other nasty creatures at the entrance and waiting for you to take one of the two exit portal... Nearby lifestone at , near Mountain Halls. -- Shimroar
Two main sections of the dungeon. Upper parts has lots of granite golems, while the lower part is all iron and copper. LOTS of people now. Many people come in with acid weapons to hunt the irons and copper and cant take the golems. Watch out. They often lead a group of golems right to you when you are healing or something. Great place when no one is there... but always crowded nowadays :( -- Soze 4/14/2000
I meant some people cant take the granites -- Soze 4/14/2000 The golems have all been replaced with Gold Golems. This is stop #19 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

location.name: Direlands portal to South Direlands
location.description: This portal leads to South Direlands (), same destination as the Mayoi Portal to South Direlands. Restricted to lvl 12 and upper. -- Shimroar

location.name: South Direlands to North Direlands
location.description: This portal from south direlands leads to North Direlands (24.4N, 53.8W). Restricted to level 12 and upper. -- Shimroar

location.name: Underground Temple
location.description:
Underground temple, with a Greater Mu-miyah in it (at least when I was there [Twice]). -- Dunc
Confirmed as of 10/08/2000. -- Luci X 10/11/2000

location.name: Zephir Spawn
location.description:
Theres a spawn of 7 Olthoi (3 Soldiers, 4 Workers). Plenty of rocks to jump on for those mages and archers. -- Crazy Mad Faust
The rocks here are linked to the Olthoi. The three Olthoi sights in the northeast all have this same rock formation. -- Doc Feelgood 3/9/2000
No longer, now only zefirs spawn here...another olthoi spawn gone unfortunately -- Aeternus 4/22/2000
Use to be a Olthoi Spawn spot but now 7 Zofrit Zefir (lvl 28) spawn around the rocks. 3/6/2001
heh thats what you wise fuy archers and mages geet for being lazy and hiding on rocks to fight. AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!! -- Sega Slayer 12/27/2001

location.name: Ruined Causeway
location.description: Two rows of ancient pillars marking a ford across to a small island. Some of the pillars still glow at their tops. -- Xian Liu

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: This lifestone is part of a small village (name unknown) which has a few cows, a farmer and a wandering Bowyer who sells Armor-Piercing Arrows and Quarrels as well as fletching supplies. -- Trinidy

location.name: Tumerok Castle
location.description: Appears to be the map point of interest. Many, many tumeroks here, including a high tumerok. Beware of them jumping from the walls and landing on your head. Ouch! -- Xian Liu

location.name: Twin Towers
location.description: Twin Towers on the road between the Bandit Castle and Neydisa Castle. Lever at the top of the South Tower opens the entry door of the North Tower. Some Tumeroks in the North Tower, and Green Wasps, Rats in the South Tower. -- Dunc

location.name: Undead Pillar
location.description:
Pillars with an undead. Nearby spawn a shield. -- Xin
The Undead that spawns here guards a shield that is lying on the ground. The Undead isnt very hard to kill and gives rather good exp. I kill him every time I run from Samsur to Binar. -- Avaton 4/28/2001

location.name: Fort Witshire Broken Lifestone
location.description: Broken lifestone at Fort Witshire between Glenden Wood and Cragstone -- Finn Djhala

location.name: Glenden Wood Lifestone
location.description: One of three lifestones in Glenden Wood -- Finn Djhala

location.name: Glenden Wood Lifestone
location.description: One of three lifestones in Glenden Wood -- Finn Djhala

location.name: Edelbar Lifestone
location.description:
Lifestone at the abandoned village Edelbar -- Finn Djhala
A new macro site now too. Guess the meeting halls got old. :) -- Minas Tirith 7/17/2000

location.name: Lesser Mu-Miyah Tower
location.description: 6 Lesser Mu-Miyah, 3 outside, 2 downstairs inside, 1 upstairs inside. 1 locked chest at top of tower, sub-par treasure -- Balo

location.name: Shipwreck
location.description:
Remains of a shipwreck that have washed up on the shore...including the Undead pirate crew!
o) Standard loot in chests. -- Chiun Zen
This spawn has been changed. It now has Undead Captain, Undead Sailors, Undead Mate, Skeletal Swashbuckler, Skeletal Mate -- Zen Tek Ken 6/27/2003

location.name: Blackmire Swamp
location.description:
Quite a few Mosswarts and Swamp Grmnies nearby. -- Devyn
Best to jump up to the top of the lifestone before using it, quite a few monster generators within attack distance of the lifestone. Closest stone for gathering the Minor Stinging Stone -- Tametomo 4/9/2000
This life stone is also ideal for some level 6-12 hunt around here. Undead and Zombies are sweet target, plus the golems. -- Immacolata 5/18/2001

location.name: Felscuda's House
location.description:
An employee of Lady Folthid who will pay quite a bit of money for blank parchment - I think it was 150p, but Im not sure. -- Devyn
She doesnt pay for the paper, she just tells you how to get into the cellar. -- Hawat 3/18/2000

location.name: Crater
location.description: Crater left by a Spire

location.name: Leafdawning Fairgrounds
location.description:
These fairgrounds near the Leafdawning Festival Stone have a race track, targets for combat competition, plus a Roaming Bowyer and Farmer. -- H. Dunadan
Bowyer sells armor-piercing arrows/quarrels in addition to standard arrows/quarrels. -- Zyban 7/19/2000

location.name: Khayyaban Shadow Spire Crater
location.description:
Some kind of eldritch UFO has landed just outside Khayyaban. Its over ten stories tall, and it has carved a huge crater. It hums, it scintillates, its a huge Vegas style billboard for something... but what that is I dont know yet. -- Doc Feelgood
The Shadow Spire has disappeared. The blackened crater is still present and there are some coloured particles in the air at the bottom of the crater. -- Maglor Daefalas 8/13/2000

location.name: Yanshi Festival Grounds
location.description: a sprint track, hurdles. Several straw and oak drudges to try to best your competitor with. A Farmer and a Wandering Bowyer are here as well. -Grasp -- Silver Citadel

location.name: Sawato Shadow Spire Crater
location.description: Blackened Crater still there spire gone. Lots of mossy and serths in and around crater. Typical swamp spawns. -- Dark Man - Sol 10/10/2000

location.name: Crater Lifestone
location.description: How it could go this long witout being added is beyond me. I dont know how many mages wouldnt be able to go about living without being tied to this LS. -- Sargonas

location.name: Qalabar to Hilltop
location.description: Portal to Hilltop 32.8N, 34.7E. On the beach, next to the Desert Ridge Portal and just downhill from a lifestone. This area could be an interesting place for portal people

location.name: Desert Gateway
location.description:
A group of stones that sort of look like a gateway on the road between Samsur and Tufa. Also there are two chests here guard by some Spiny Arms. Pretty weal loot, but if your on this road, you may as well stop... -- Dunc
I wonder if this is the Amoredillo Lair that the scribe in Samsur sells directions to? The note mentions you need to go Southwest towards Yaraq, and that the lair has nice treasure (I found a dagger). -- Immacolata 3/21/2001

location.name: Skeleton Mausoleum
location.description: 8 or more Skeleton Champions a Skeleton Hero, and a Primeval Skeleton. There a sik chest on a platform and a Runed Chest inside a building.

location.name: Drudge Tower
location.description: This tower has been Updated and now has from what I counted. 1 Peerless Drudge, 1 Drudge Cabalist, 1 Drudge Mystic, 3 Unconquered Drudge, 3 Drudge Bloodletter. Has a Sturdy Steel Chest to at the top -- Shimroar -- Zen Tek Ken 8/24/2003

location.name: Mummies cave
location.description: A small cave with greater Mu-Miyah and Gold wasps. A secret passage leads to an empty room under the cave. -- ShimroarUndead Soldiers, Skeletal Mates, Skeletal Shaswbucklers, and an Undead Captain. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Tufa Lifestone
location.description: Another lifestone near Tufa. -- Shimroar

location.name: Empyrean Foundry Lifestone
location.description: Near the Empyrean Foundry. -- Korrig Vamier

location.name: Samsur Lifestone
location.description:
Another lifestone near Samsur. -- Shimroar
This life stone is up on a hill (as are many things around Samsur)on the South side of the road to Tufa. In the area are apt to be skeletons, spiney armadillos, outcast monouga, all types of shreath and others. This makes it an excellent hunting area for the level 7-12 adventruer. Be warned, at times the radar can look like a pumpkin patch and most of these critters like to gather in groups of three. -- Dei Ray 3/13/2000 Moved into town 3.0S,19.3E from 4.3S, 15.9E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

location.name: Lake Nothing
location.description: This is a lake. A few drudges in the area, and some shreths, all low level. Found during my travels to the north. -- Gonthar

location.name: Shoushi Outpost Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone at SE Shoushi Outpost -- Pantera Firestorm -- P. Firestorm

location.name: South Direland Portal
location.description: Portal to South Direland, exit at 84.2S, 34.4W -- Rufen

location.name: River Ford
location.description: Lite River Ford, directing you to the Festival Stone. -- Dunc

location.name: Festival Stone
location.description: Festival Stone. -- Dunc

location.name: Tree Shrine
location.description: Cool building with a tree inside, lighting it up. Looks like a Tree Shrine. -- Dunc

location.name: Mountain Ridge to Glendon Wood
location.description:
-- Shen Chi
Exits at 28.9N, 26.3E -- Tyger 6/12/2000

location.name: Accursed Halls
location.description:
Location of (IMO) the easiest to use PK alter. 1 young banderling and 2 captains are all you have to go through to get to the alter. To get there to the portal give the drink to the madman near bashi, and he will portal you to an enclosed area with a *direlands* shreth (actually halfway difficult if you arent expecting it). Then another portal and youre at the staging area. The dungeon has a vendor where you spawn in, and I found the PK alter in 5 minutes despite my poor navigation skills. The dungeon is *very* well designed, has a real nice feel to it. Go for the architecture if nothing else. -- machina
For the Drunken Madman, you have to give him sake to make the portal open... as well, the Vorous shreth is not always there, in fact there is usually no enemies when you get to the dires, inside the Walled Portals -- Daffyd 3/20/2000
If there are critters inside they came over the ladders outside. Usually drawn in by the wussy life mages who stodd in the wrong place. They usually bail out of one of the portals when they make this mistake. -- Gurth 5/1/2000
May not be a decent way of getting xp (us warriors hate it), but the walls are very populated with archers, as well as life mages draining, cheap and fast way to get xp. -- Skorn 5/21/2000
Entrance is safe, foyer is safe. Portals cannot be tied to. Design is early school with a very lived in feel. The gen rate is liesurly
the winding corridors lead to rooms, and the rooms have monsters in them. Good wall working opportunities. -- Doc Feelgood 3/21/2001

location.name: Direlands Floating Tower
location.description:
A Strange tower of some sort. I pressed the target key and there is a door inside but the tower floats above ground. There is no way to jump into it. :o( I hope someone figures out what this thing is. -- Vortigan
I entered the tower from the floating city it is in the last level and on top of a structure in the city. The only exit (portal) from the tower drops you in the Dires on the sw coast of the inner sea -- Pericles 7/12/2001
I entered the tower from the floating city it is in the last level and on top of a structure in the city. The only exit (portal) from the tower drops you in the Dires on the sw coast of the inner sea -- Pericles 7/12/2001

location.name: Samsur Festival Stone
location.description: North of the road between Samsur and Tufa on top of a hill. -- Dei Ray

location.name: Beachside (Granite Outpost)
location.description: Portal to Beachside () in with the two merchants at the Granite Outpost. -- Chiun Zen

location.name: Adventurer's Haven Lifeston
location.description: Couldnt find this in the list. Is actually _IN_ the hall, not above ground. -- ChyEld

location.name: Lifestone (Middle Direlands)
location.description: A lifestone just about in the middle of the Dires. -- Chiun Zen

location.name: The Cauldrons of Green Flame
location.description: A square section of foundation with Empyrean tiles and four large cauldrons boiling with green flame. -- Chiun Zen

location.name: Swamp Temple (Dires)
location.description:
Sclavus bunker with a dungeon in E Dires. Level 15+ -- Alun Magus
The key to this place (a hideous key) can be found in the other Swamp Temple, the one not in the Dires. The highest level creature here is level 40, with sprinklings of lower fare, and swamp grommies. Some chests which seemed empty, except one which spawned several 1000p valued items. -- Goldhart 4/25/2000
Sturdy iron key opens chest at bottom -- Shoto Fle-Alch 5/7/2000
The key to get in here is a Grotesque one, and as noted above, is in the swamp temple near Sawato. Creatures in here are nearly all Sclavi--Se, Aste, Essa, and lots of Sata in the bottom. Bring your Superior Helm, because they throw Defenselessness 3 and Vulnerability 3 like theyre going out of style--expect your melee and missile defense to be 20 points lower from the time you walk in the door. They also like acid 3, frost 3, and shock 3. They drop wands, staves, and orbs like theyre going out of style, so if you need vassal magic gear, this is a good place to go. Also used as a staging area for the Incunbala Vault, which is north and west of here. -- Aliciana 5/27/2000
The outside is infested, the foyer is clear. This is a large early era dungeon with rambling corridors, large halls, and modest monster density and gen rates. -- Doc Feelgood 6/26/2000

location.name: Lugian Camp
location.description: Lugian camp with some 2 obeloth, 3-5 amplioth, and some 4 - 8 lagius Lugians, there is a tower as a nice log out or mule place but old lifestone which was near tower was destroyed in March patch, so nearest lifestone is in valley with 2 merchants. -- Silverion DD

location.name: Lifestone, Peddler and Tower
location.description: Tower is a nice log out or mule place but old lifestone which was near tower was destroyed in March patch, so nearest lifestone is in valley with 2 merchants. Tower can be used for lower lv archers and mages to pull lugians from a nearby lugian camp or to hit 3 spawn spots in range, spawning all from lugians, hunter shereths, mosswarts and banderling riders. -- Silverion DD

location.name: Tower
location.description: Fourth tower in the chain, overlooking the road from Khayyaban to Al-Arqas. -- Ibn Schachabo

location.name: Twin Standing Stones
location.description: Two upright slabs of rock. Useful as a reference point or landmark, but that is all. -- Ibn Schachabo

location.name: Small Black Hill Portal
location.description: Exits at tower on Small Black Hill (62.1S, 50.4W) -- Sis. Immacolata

location.name: Lin/Nanto Festival Stone
location.description: Festival Stone between Nanto and Lin, right off the path on a mountain, cant miss it. Beware of Zefirs... -- Fyrecrypts

location.name: Undead Hideout
location.description: This is located in the Northern Mtns. in a kind of bowl or cove. There were several zombies and a single lich guarding a chest that was located in the middle of some pillars. Also near were some Banderlings. Found a piece of armor and some gems in chest. Mouth of cove is located at 55.1N, 4.0W. -- Derwood McGriz

location.name: Fairy Ring
location.description: A strange stone claw structure (like a lifestone without the center stone)with a ring of mushrooms. Had a Ghost wisp in it and a dark wisp near it. -- Liu Kui

location.name: North Syliph
location.description: Exits at 12.7N, 11.8E -- Shoto Fle-Alch

location.name: Syliph Tower
location.description:
Dillos and Bandis -- Shoto Fle-Alch
Not sure if this is a new dungeon from april update. Anyone know? 4/5/2000
No, this dungeon has been here for a while. -- Psy 4/7/2000
The dungeon has a narrow foot print, but is deep and winding. Navigating can be tricky if youre in a hurry, but backtracking doesnt take long. -- Doc Feelgood 6/17/2000
Not much in here but banderlings and then only youngs and scouts. There is a weapons smith down there that has a basic stock of weapons. No real point at the end of the dungeon. Just a one way portal out. -- Ryth-al-Rothgar 1/17/2001

location.name: South Dalt
location.description: Exits at 14.1N, 12.7E -- Shoto Fle-Alch

location.name: South Gemm
location.description: Exits at 15.7N, 14.2E -- Shoto Fle-Alch

location.name: Nexus
location.description:
Entrance and exit are hot with local Dires Fauna, and, in fact, this is a good portal pop hunting place. Foyer is quiet -- no action until you jump across the pit. Revs, Dark Revs up top in a cluster of small rooms (nice wall working) and Shadow family on level below. -- Doc Feelgood 5/19/2002
Beyond the Revenant Rooms, the dungeon fills with Shadows. It becomes quite symmetric and leads you down though a series of three pits that you must jump into to continue. The bottom of each pit is lightning trapped and guarded by a half-dozen or so shadows ranging from Lts to Umbris. The BDT room is filled with Nexus fragments -- which dont seem to drop anything very often, if ever. There is a portal to the surface after a long climb on the far side of the Fragment Room. Spawn rate in the lower levels is slow. -- Doc Feelgood 10/7/2002

location.name: Signature Gully
location.description: This NE - SW gully has dark drainage lines in the bottom surrounded by lighter colored hills. From the air it looks like a signature. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Enchanter's Hideaway
location.description:
Secluded hut in desert cliffs. Watch for 2 lvl 43 Iron Golems at gate, and bring lockpicking. Give a skeleton Skull to woman for a book on the history of the Silifi of the Crimson Stars. First part of the axe quest, Id think. :) -- Lorelai
Also, bring the Broken Haft from Leikothas Crypt to receive the Repaired Haft, the next step of the SoCS quest. If your haft breaks later on attaching the spine, go back here to have it repaired again. :) -- Lorelai 4/14/2000
Does anyone know if there is a key around anywhere for this place? -- Thi (MT) 10/2/2000
There is no key but you DONT need lockpicking to get in. Try examining the building a bit more closely...the golems are on a 15 minute spawn cycle so you have time. =) -- Khrome-Khoran 1/17/2001
Um I don’t know what you are talking about, but you DO need a lock picker. After I killed the irons I searched that whole building top and bottom no lever, switch or hole. It is easy to pick tho, and my lock pick is only 125 -- Eclipsa (FF) 6/2/2002

location.name: Bellig Mesa to Gemm Mesa
location.description:
After exiting the Bellig Tower dungeon you end up on top of a mesa. This portals you to the next Mesa SW called Gemm. Only way to Slyph dungeon. -- Jalpa
Exits at . -- Xiao Leung 7/8/2000

location.name: Gemm Mesa to Dalt Mesa
location.description: Portal from Gemm mesa to Dalt Mesa. Part of the route to Slyph dungeon. BE aware of grommies waiting at the portal exit. Exits at -- Jalpa

location.name: Lifestone
location.description:
Next to an empty house. -- Fatima
This place is a trap - lots of Vet Reedsharks, Shreths, and other nasties that like to hide on the radar here. Theyre right next to the lifestone. Dont use it. -- Baroku 4/24/2000

location.name: Mosswart Tower
location.description: A tower with about 15 Barkers, Mudlurks, one Shaman and a chief. Good loot!!, Assortment of elder and younger reedsharks nearby -- Michelle La-pui

location.name: Fort Tet Playground
location.description:
If youre going to make it around the Ft. Tet area, this is the place to start checking if you have what it takes. This flat area is Ft. Tets petting zoo -- filled with all your favorite direlands denizens: tumeroks, gromnies, copper golems, and monoguas having a wild time to name a few. Shadows and wasps come and go, as do lots and lots of heros. There are archer rocks near the north and south edges, and the Ft. Tet mage shop is near the archer rock on the north edge. -- Doc Feelgood
If you made it this far you are already at Ft.T. 4/13/2000

location.name: Skeleton Swamp Temple
location.description: Skeleton Captain, a few Warriors, no interesting loot on captain. In the southeast end of the swamp. Looks cool, strange translucent thing on the floor inside. Worth going for the looks of the place. -- Deaths Warrant

location.name: Drudge Cave
location.description: Small cave with Drudges and their food. 3-5 Skulkers/Slinkers/Sneakers. -- Ibn Schachabo

location.name: Two Statues
location.description:
Two Statues in the hills SW of Qalabar. Nothing really here (yet). Only a couple druges and Red Wasps near. It really looks like somewhere a portal would be... -- Dunc
Nothing here yet. Higher level monsters though, level 15 -20. 12/13/01 -- Ronnabs GF 12/13/2001

location.name: Cave
location.description: Layout is light and airy, an early-era design, fun to wander around in. Lockpick is needed to explore it fully. Populated with Augmented and Ascendant Tumerok, Augmented Drudge, and Wasteland Rats. Tieable, summonable, no level restrictions. Portal is inside a fort surrounded by Augmented and Ascendant Tumeroks. At the end is a locked door which can be picked or is opened with the High Tumeroks Key obtained in the fort at 34.5S, 49.8W. Inside is a chest that contains a Heavy Tumerok Key. This Key opens the front door to the fort at 50.7S, 81.8W -- Slim Shady -- Doc Feelgood -- Polecat -- Nodoka

location.name: Three Stone Monoliths
location.description: Three Stone Monoliths in a line that is east-west on top of a snow covered hill. There are no markings on the monoliths. -- Chiun Zen

location.name: Deep South Dires Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone south of a merchant/mage tent. Southern Dires Coast -- Ito Menya (FF)

location.name: Renegade Bunker
location.description: A bunker full of Renegade Tumeroks and Lugians. 2 chests at the bottom with poor loot. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Signature Hills (Valley of Death)
location.description:
These hills are badlands. They are not high, but the slopes are steep. The trails through are torturous with many dead ends -- valley trails and crest trails can both end abruptly. Plan your routes through here carefully. The signatures extend from roughly 30S on the north to 45S on the south and 54W on the east to 71W on the west. -- Doc Feelgood
Now known as the Valley of Death as of the Jan 2003 patch, this entire area is filled with the most god-awfully overpowered monsters in the game. Drudge Seraphs, Bile Grievvers, and Tusker Obliterators are just a few of the high-octane, high-HP critters infesting this area
also sighted is the fabled Tremendous Monouga with 2 million HP. This is THE playground of the elite: come with a large group of level 80+ characters and watch the massive XP roll in like never before. -- Confucius of FF 1/27/2003
Also known as Skull Valley, another appropriate choice. -- Doc Feelgood 1/28/2003

location.name: Valley Crypt
location.description:
A secluded underground crypt in the Dire valleys. From what I could glean at a distance, it contains many Mu-miyahs (Lesser, Greater, and even lvl 42 Horrible), and a chest or two. I couldnt get inside for a closer look because a group of Panumbris chased me off... :/ -- Lorelai
As reported, but in fact there are two underground bunkers, think the horrible Mu-miyah is level 40. They cast feeble magic, and the entire lot can be cleared in five minutes. Chests are all empty, possibly bugged like all the others. Another worthless place that doesnt belong in the Dires. Most of the critters are around level 11. This place should have been filled with level 40s and up, otherwise why put it in the Dires? -- Goldhart 5/2/2000
This is where the other half of the Staff of the Nomads now lies. Its in an unlocked chest in the larger of the two bunkers, guarded by lots of high level Mu-Miyahs: Guardians, Imperials, Nomads, and two Royals. -- Confucius of FF 4/10/2003

location.name: Virindi Fort
location.description:
Coords are approximate. Various nasties near entrance portal (usually Iron golems). 3 Tusker Slaves spawn in entry room of dungeon. Of course, lots of virindi farther in. Didnt go very far as I was alone. Portal in entrance room leads back to the surface portal. -- Arioc
Its 4 tuskers in the entrance room. In the final room some mediocre (around 5k items) floor spawn. when u make the jump be prepared to take about 20 dmg and get swarmed by a dozen puppets..not really worth the trouble tho -- Heart Failure 4/28/2000
One of the doors going further in, up the stairs can be opened by the switch upstairs, go left facing the exit portal, open the door by using [key R] the side lever, and push the lever inside. You also need to control the levers on the ground floor, and then will be able to get further in the complex. Down some stairs, a brief respite as the tuskers and virindi are behind a closed door. Open the door, using a lever, and you are in another area with a couple of tuskers, and virindi. Another pointless empty chest, and an upstairs path that leads to switches to open an exit portal, and a door that leads to the final area. I would not recommend jumping down, as there is little hiding place from a dozen virindi puppets and fairy things, but an exit is placed there, back to the surface. -- Goldhart 5/2/2000
Well what can I say about this place...A great drain spot for lifers...But heed my warning If you see Krow or Ryucho zen in the harvest gain world and myself...get out I will never stop trying to kill them and I dont care who gets in my way... -- Krack of HG 9/18/2000
Goldhart, I would like to note, that your post above is a complete waste of text, and should be deleted. -- Fairy GodMother 7/3/2001

location.name: Lich Spire
location.description: Very tall spire with more undead than a George Romero movie: Liches, Lich Lords, Revenants take your pick. Probably about 10-15 total. They spawn on the spire but will jump down onto you if you get close (read massive impact damage). Lot of traffic through this area headed to the Virindi Fort, so usually all the liches end up huddled around the base of the spire waiting to bum rush you if you attack or get close. The spire itself basically has a wraparound path leading up to the top where there are two chests with ... drumroll please ... nothing in them! Usually Ob golems and high level drudges around spire as well. Unless you like lich xp and loot, skip this place and head over to the Virindi fort. -- Arioc

location.name: Small Black Hill to Black Hill
location.description:
-- Polecat -- Arioc 4/26/2000
This drops you into the middle of a nasty spawn. It is actually high up on a plateau across the river from Wai Jhou.-- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Stone Head
location.description: A second Stone Head lies just east of the first at 16.6E -- Sundoro Taal

location.name: Empyrean Stones
location.description:
A double-circle of standing stones, on the road in Holtburg. Purpose at yet unknown. -- Trez the Handy
If you stand in the center of the stones it now restores your mana. As of 9/12/00. -- Brother Fish 9/13/2000

location.name: Fort Morntide
location.description: Nice place, great view! Lifestone nearby, banderlings in easy reach. Even has Revitalizing Vat in the lower level. You can get to the top od the plateau from -- Willow

location.name: S. Direlands Coastal Desert
location.description: This region between the big crater outer rim and the coast is composed of sandy circular pits surrounded by moderately steep walled ridges -- climable in many places but not all. The pits contain palm trees and plentiful numbers of monsters. The ridges are barren of vegetation, less populated, and easier to travel. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Rat Rock
location.description: A rock with cavern underneath. There are Desert Rats in the cavern and more come from around the hill when the cavern rats are attacked. Watch out! The rats can jump up and bite your toes through the ceiling! Treasure is high quality food (Auroch healing meat, fresh fish). -- Doc FeelgoodCave is now populated by 4 Banderling Aggressors and 2 Savages guarding a runed chest. -- Jungle Souljah 7/29/2004

location.name: East Nanto Outpost
location.description: Starter Town -- Big Red (FF)

location.name: Olthoi Rock
location.description: Just half a click south of the Olthoi Tunnels entrance. Never seen it before. This is in addition to the one 2 clicks north that has been reported, and yet another NEW one found 2 clicks east. -- FWH Saxxon

location.name: Cave
location.description:
A small cave with 4 outcast monougas. When you come back out, youll be near Cragstone. -- Xyblea
The exit does NOT drop you near Cragstone but at 18.4E, 62.1E. It shares this destination with the cave closest too the drop point. Perhaps a usefull way for a burdened warrior to make it back to Eastham but little else. -- Sundoro Taal 6/8/2000 This is actually the same dungeon as the one to the east of here, I tested by dropping a gem in this one and going into the other one, lo and behold, the gem was there. It simply has two entrances, one exit. A truly pointless dungeon in any case. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

location.name: Ayan Baqur
location.description: Gharundim town located on the western coast of Direlands.

location.name: Uziz Portal
location.description: Next to the town of Ayan Baqur. Exits at 24.3S, 28.9E -- Halbarad D.

location.name: Baishi Portal
location.description: Exits at . -- Halbarad D.

location.name: Shadow Crypt
location.description: Small crypt filled with Shadow Spectres, Phantoms and Wraiths, Bane Grievvers and a Sturdy Steel Chest. -- Chiun Zen -- Chupon

location.name: The Deep Pit
location.description:
A very deep, wide, hole in the ground with no way down or back up. Nothing in the bottom could be seen. If you accidently fell in, and survived, the only way out would be to recall possibly. Location coordinates approximate from standing on the edge of the rim. -- Chiun Zen
I went out there with my Jump buffed to over 400 and jumed in to see how deep it is. It is no worse then the jump in the Arwic Subway. There was nothing in there and no way out other then a Recall. -- White Heart 1/12/2002

location.name: Skeleton Ambush Tent
location.description: An empty tent on the desert surrounded by a half dozen skeletons and a couple skeleton warriors. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Stranger in Town
location.description:
A 2nd villa south of Yaraq. Nothing there yet.
The Stranger in Town is now here which is part of the Elysas Favour quest -- Jaz (Solclaim) 1/23/2002

location.name: Lithos Shrine
location.description: A pair of flame-topped pillars and a pair of tall trees mark off the corners of a diamond. A Lithos Lugian stands between the pillars, and, when we were there, another roams around as a guard. -- Obunaga & Haak

location.name: Sunset Execution Stones
location.description: Two pillars, each with a dead body attached to it facing west. -- Zloth

location.name: Skeleton Crypt
location.description:
This a spot similar to the Drudge house in Holt, or the newly added Skeleton Trap Tent. Z Black Dragon Z and I entered only to be attacked by millions of Skeletons. -- Lukan Shilh
There are 3 Skeletons in a Crypt. 3/3/2001
Not much of a trap anymore. 3 Skeleton Lords spawn here, and a Weathered Red Key spawns in the back corner, for use in Sylsfear, no timer on pickup. -- Hentaya (HG) 1/23/2003

location.name: Another Olthoi Rock
location.description: This one didnt make it the first time. East and slightly south of the Olthoi Tunnels, this brings to 3 the number of roakcs with 4 workers in the vicinity. Location might be just a tad off, but it is there nestled in a shallow canyon past on the other side of the mountain from the Dungeon. -- FWH Saxxon

location.name: Crater Entrance/Exit
location.description:
To my knowledge the only crater entrance and exit make sure to go to the exact coords to get in. You may see places where u can get in but u cant! Do not jump in one of these places because you will die. -- Critical Hit
A little unclear... you may see places where u THINK u can get in but u wont be able to trust me... only way is 65.2N 11.1E. -- Critical Hit 5/7/2000
Seems to be gaurded by 3 flames as of late... -- Pit the Fencer 10/31/2000

location.name: Skeleton tent
location.description: The tent has 2 Skeleton Lords inside along with a chest that spawned descent loot. Outside nearby there 3 Skeleton Lords around what looks like to be a sleeping area.

location.name: Ma'yad ibn Ibsar
location.description: This NPC asks you to look for her missing brother (Abmim ibn Ibsar)and gives you a place to start. She also offers a reward of 300 pyreal when you return his jambiya to her.

location.name: Corpse of Abmim ibn Ibsar
location.description: This is the location of the corpse of Abmim ibn Ibsar. Gaurding it are 4 shallows sharks, and 3 shallows lurkers. on his body is Abmims Jambiya and couple misc items -- Bloodstorm

location.name: Tumerok Canyon
location.description: Canyon with walls at either end guarded by Tumerok warriors, priests, fighters, scouts, and others. Some sort of structures with zombies in them, not sure what else. Coordinates are for northern wall by beach. Canyon continues south, not sure if you can exit that way. -- Shiera

location.name: Mosswart Hangout
location.description:
A Lone building with bunches of Creeper Mosswarts, Mosswart Feeders, Drudge Prowlers inside and out. Theres also a lot of other critters in the area. -- Big Red - (FF)
There is also some very good loot off of the Azure Grommnies that hangout near the east tower..i once got a bd3 katar and a bd2 2-5 cestus off ofem, but I am currently camped there along with about 10 others so it is fairly hard to get xp and loot. -6/28/2000 -- Cuumark 6/28/2000

location.name: Mysterious Tunnels
location.description:
Near Nanto. No Level Restrictions. Mostly Drudge Skulkers, with a couple Prowlers. Gnawer Shreths down one tunnel. Contains a quest item for Miyako of Nanto. (Note: Quest item cannot be dropped, only given) -- Nonnus II
Restricted to levels 1-5. Portal out of dungeon at entry point is to Yanshi. Didnt explore past finding the book so it is unknown if there is a surface portal or other town portals. -- Cuttler Strngmd 8/26/2000
There are no other portals, only the one to Yanshi, this is to make the quest tougher, this is very harsh on newbies, who think they will appear near nanto, but instead are plopped in the middle of nowhere to hopefully find Yanshi nearby, took me 25 minutes by begging for help and finding portals to get back to Nanto, and thats all without the quest item. -- Sadness 9/3/2000
The Yanshi portal is now gone and has been replaced with a surface portal. Drudge and Gnawer Shreth. The dungeon is divided into four elemental sections. The fire section is real cool, a must see. -- Dr. Faustus 9/16/2000

location.name: Tower
location.description: Just a tower on a ridge ... nothing much except a good view at the top ... -- Blayd

location.name: Lugian Fort / Third Lugian Raider Camp
location.description:
Lugians galore. Everything from Lithos to Laigus. About 8-10 lugians with a couple of limestone golems nearby. Approach the fort from the south, and you can hide behind the south wall until they run out of rocks. Lifestone and peddler and healer to the west. Banderlings, mossworts, and reedsharks in the surrounding hills. Mattekars (great, snowy, and white) in the mountains to the south. Good place for melee fighters from their upper teens to mid twenties. -- Minas Tirith
Bigger Lugians now (Gigas and Extas) and the Dread Mattekar can be found here. Spawn cycle is about 5 minutes. -- Tanu (MT) 4/21/2001
Location of the Commander and LTs for the Blade of the heart, used for the Spear of Purity -- Korgan (DT) 5/22/2001
The Lugian Commander drops the lugian paduons, used to get the helm of craig. There is LS at 67.3S 28.3E, pretty good place for level 30+. Lugian Titus raiders with hollow weapons spawn when the lugian commander at the 2nd camp is killed. -- BuffDaddy -MT 8/27/2001

location.name: Windmill on Plateau
location.description:
Ka Ku-To can be found near these three windmills up on the Plateau. Ka Ku-To sells the key that opens the Inner Dungeon Doors. (Also sells nice plate armor.) Area has a few level 15 flames - fire elementals - bring your fire protection! -- Blayd
The fire elementals are confirmed as flares. Also some Tiofor Ursuin near the windmills as well, but I believe the flares are more permanent. The key for the inner dungeon costs 290p, and Ka Ku-To does take trade notes. -- Duryn 11/26/2000

location.name: Castle on a Hill
location.description: Castle with four towers on a steep bluff, couldnt find a way up. Four towers glow at the top -- An Tse

location.name: Ayan Baqur Lifestone
location.description:
-- Amaranthae
Life stone in the town of Ayan, starting get laggy here because of the huge gatherings of people around it -- Ffej IV 9/28/2000

location.name: Climbable slope
location.description:
The only place I know of that you can reach the plateau E of the LS/shop from. Beasties up here include Tumeroks, Granite and Sandstone golems, and Ash gromnies. --Rukkus Bloodbane
Only a problem north of this point, south the cliff is easily climbed for a long distance. -- Doc Feelgood 4/11/2003

location.name: Abandoned Tower
location.description: On the upper beach, just E of the Qualabar portal. Empty :( -- Rukkus Bloodbane

location.name: Mountain Entry Point
location.description: Access from the upper beach into the mountains, just S of the abandoned tower. Beats running all the way around to the escalator slope. From these coords, head W into the little pit, then turn N. You have to run along some edges, but it gets you up there for some excellent good ole-fashioned Dires hunting. -- Rukkus Bloodbane

location.name: Grievous Vault to Samsur
location.description:
Theres a portal to Samsur in the Grievous Vault. after the first drop, turn right and head down the corridor to a crossroads. The room to the left is empty except for assorted furnishings, an altar, and a flame trap. However, there are fake walls: one on wall paralleling the Altar and to its left (which leads to a bunch more traps in a small room with an empty chest), and another fake wall just right of the altar. This second one leads directly to the portal, no traps. I put it on the map and not in the vault section so that the Shortest Path part of Explorer will take advantage of it. Exit -- Orome
The triple-trapped chest hidden in the altar room has good loot! It is NOT empty! I found a pair of Impenetrability IV Steel Toe Boots and a high-base Simi inside. -- Jadok al-Siran 10/11/2000
The chest is not empty but it doesnt spawn anything near that good!I found some leather bracers and some darts!maybe they nerfed this chest?Of course nerfing it is better than what they are doing with all the quests in that game.you know.handing them to the lockpickers on a silver platter. -- Sega Slayer 4/16/2001

location.name: Direlands Swamp Life Stone
location.description: Lots of nice spawns around this one. -- VanyelAshkervon

location.name: 3 Pillars w/Pool
location.description: Not sure if the pool aids mana regen or not. I was too busy frantically trying to slay the 3 Dark Wisps before they got off too many IV and V bolts. -- Rukkus Bloodbane 5/25/00

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone -- Dresden

location.name: Tumerok Tower
location.description:
Right next to the Slaughter house/Fort Teth portal, this seems to be the home of a bunch of Tumeroks trying to be farmers...3 or 4 warriors, an officer, and a couple scouts overlook a swarm of cows and Auroch cows. -- Rukkus Bloodbane 5/31/00
Could this be a sighting of the cow riding Tumerok mentioned by the alcoholic town crier in Ayan Baqur? -- Raja Khamadan 6/3/2000

location.name: Tumerok Outpost
location.description: This is the low-walled reinforcement building Doc speaks of in his Slaughter House description. Lots of tumeroks here...nothing tougher than a Priest that I could see. Excellent hunting between here and the big Slaughter House...sandstone, copper, iron, granite golems, gold wasps, drudge lurkers/raveners, some dillos, and of course lots of Tumeroks. Oh, and the occasional Umbris/Penumbris spawn SW of the Slaughter House. -- Rukkus Bloodbane 5/31/00

location.name: North Desert Ridge
location.description:
exits at . -- Doc Feelgood
Actually it now exits at 4.7S, 3.1W. -- Immacolata 5/21/2001

location.name: Desert Ridge Border
location.description: exits at -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Portal Fort to Hebian-To
location.description: Inside Portal Fort, exit at 38.6S, 82.1E -- Blayd

location.name: North Edge of Beach Cliffs
location.description: South of here the cliff between the beach and the highlands becomes unclimable in most places until you get south of the Beach Pass region. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Golem's Stone
location.description:
3 golems spawn next to a standing stone, popular with campers -- Xang lo
4 golems actually. the stone is surrounded by fires that fill up with drudges and low level shreths. A little further down the hill, and youll find things like reedsharks & banderlings. A good place for a low lvl group to get exp. -- Al-Tuvah 8/8/2000
Four mud golems spawn right by the stone, with a fifth just down the hill. Downhill towards the south and particularly the west things like Dolls, low-level Lugians, and low-level Tumeroks can be found. There are also lots of Mites, Bandys, Wood Golems,and Mattys in the area. This area served as my main hunting grounds in my early and mid teens until I switched to the Lugian Citadel at level 16. -- Wylfghar 12/7/2001 There is one sandstone golem amongst the mud golems, warning to low-levels. There is a Runed Chest here, locked (diff 100). -- Halcyon 9/11/2003The Mud Golems that were here are now Sandstone Golems and the Sandstone Golem is now a Sand Golem -- Armin 5/26/2004

location.name: Two Pillars
location.description: Two pillars on top of a mountain in the Kara area. No apparent purpose to them. -- Khendra

location.name: Black Spawn Den
location.description:
Found by my buddy Joeis Mage, who was running ahead of me:-)..2 tusker slaves near portal entrance detered us from exploring further as we both had vitaes -- Karasawa Yukio
Hmm, strange, so maybe there are two? I was in the dungeon at . Tusker slaves on first level, guards starting from level below. Nice place -- Sargoth of OIF 6/7/2000
With the june patch, it seems they have added multiple entrances(two) to each major dungeon... -- Shugyosha 6/7/2000
Three. -- Mengar 6/7/2000
This place is solid tuskers. The top level is all slaves but the levels below it are guards. Awesome XP. Id suggest travelling with a group or else youll get overwhelmed very easily. -- Flake 6/10/2000
Dangerous place for the unprepared. Exellent xp if you can handle the respawn rate. Dont count on fighting individual Tuskers
expect at least 3 or 4 to attack you at once, usually more. One way tie to portal
you can only tie from outside so that you appear inside, and if someones dragged a score of Tuskers to the entrance and youre not buffed, then be ready for the LS :). Ive never managed to hit the very bottom, but have made it to the third level down before our party of six was reduced to two through deaths or playing the chicken :) Encountered Slaves on first level with the odd Guard, all Guards on levels below plus a Virindi (sp?) Servant in the main hall on the second level. If anyones gone further then let us know whats down there :) Massive value of loot just lying around the place because most come here just for the xp
however quality of loot is terrible unless youre after colour co-ordinated armour. Huge lag here, but that might just be my connection (I play from the UK). Expect to see a lot of people here during peak times. Be ready with the curses when that Tusker youre tanking starts being drained by some level 20 Mage who runs as soon as a Tusker turns on him :). Average level of player Ive seen here is 38. -- Laz al-Farah 6/16/2000
There are two ramps that go down. I have only taken the one to the right, and at the bottom of that once you go down the hallway, and if your solo youll die, there is a room with an uber chest 2 virindi masters, and i think 3 or 4 guards. Safest thing is to back into a corner when in trouble if your a mage, and just start imperiling the tuskers. Once imperiled the archers and meleers jump on em. Great xp for a lvl 40ish archer fellowed with the same lvl life mage. -- Theneler ( TD ) 6/22/2000
Lamest, the most idiotic dungeon of Dereth. Really efficient ruining of gaining levels with effort. Little over 30s mages running around at peak hours draining Slaves to 1/4 and then portal recall and same again. Most people dont even bother to finish off the tuskers at all - just waiting to someone else to get their attention. This dungeon is making more selfish and idiotic powerlevelers to Dereth. -- Finkish 6/29/2000
