Rooms are big, hallways are wide, the tuskers move about easily, and wall working is hard. Life mages have compensated by innovating a gang work technique instead, and have prospered. (It is nice that this game can be played in many ways.) -- Doc Feelgood 7/1/2000
The left down ramp leads to a Servant and then several large areas with lots of guards. Following this a ways youll get to a big hall with alcoves on the sides of it, with tuskers in. At the end of this hall is another ramp down with about 12 Drudge Ravs and Stalkers, and a couple of Virindi. Theres a chest in the room with the drudges (uber I guess). Two locked doors after this, followed by a long hallway up and an exit portal. Why would a mage drain a slave to 1/4 and then portal out? Who kills the tuskers then? I never see anyone draining for 2/3 or 3/4 and running -- people kill what theyre fighting... oh well. Sorry your experience isnt better Finkish... =( -- Chen Kenichi 9/8/2000
BSD Ayan Baqur on DarkTide was nerfed, down to 8 tusker spawn near the uberchest, still alright hunting on a 7 minute spawn... -- -PsychoStarfire 10/13/2000
The XP is good...if you can get it. Three words best describes this place...TOO MANY MAGES! I spent too much time trying to find my own kills. In the end I gave up and began kill stealing, its the only way to get the good XP everyone talks about. My level 52 guy can easily take these tuskers on, but its a real fight trying to keep your kills. Its no better than Qualabar Citadel and the lag is even worse (at least at the Teth BSD it is). Mages are only after the tuskers and will flee when confronted by high level drudges and virindi. Back to OHN or Lugian Excavation for me. Loot is much better, XP is almost the same and Mages there are very rare. -- prok 2/19/2001
I dont know what everyone is smoking but I am lvl 38 mage and with my draining and my lvl 6 buffs, Tuskers are about as hard to kill as an ant. Trust me any mage which casts 6s will kick tusker ass, only problem with BSD is such a slow spawn rate, and it almost forces us to steal kills :( -- Ghandalf 7/25/2001

location.name: Hall of Metos
location.description:
New Dungeon near Ayun B with a portal that can be tied. Didnt go too far but Lichs and lots of them in the first room -- An Tse
There is a couple of key chests in here. When you get past the liches, you will find Obs golems and Revs. Nothing but a surface portal at the end. -- Tayway(TD) 6/7/2000
Additionally there are two rooms with quickly respawning granites and irons -- Timm 6/27/2000
The acid pits have 1 illusionary wall in them
its the wall facing the hallway as you jump over to get to the Iron Golems. So if you fall in, you can still make it out alive....once you get past the Revenants or have Item Magic. Additionally, there are 2 Obsidean Golem rooms...easy to get overwhelemed when being attacked by 5 of those puppies. -- Khaos 8/2/2000
PLEASE NOTE: The dungeon and suface portals can no longer be linked nor summoned to. -- Psy 8/9/2000
Dont know when they changed it but you can now Tie to the entrance portal and summon. -- Fleshreaper 6/27/2001
Geez, Turbine make up your mind! I get the message that I cant tie to entrance or surface portals when I try. I have not tried the one at the bottom though and will do so soon. 7/6/01 -- Hrothgar 7/6/2001

location.name: Cursed Swamp
location.description:
Couldnt enter, cap is level 5-15, but I am sure it is one of the new dungeons introduced with the june patch.6/6/2000 -- Sis. Immacolata
Many many mosswarts, from creeper to barker/mudlurk. No shaman. In many of the winding passages there are tons of traps, mainly acid. As you are entering the tunnels, the traps will miss you almost every time... But, if you are running out of the tunnel chased by mosswarts, you will be hit almost every time, so watch out. A few minor chests, not much else. -- Fenping-TD 6/7/2000
Area surrounding portal is clear, but the foyer is a hot zone with six or so mudlurks ready to greet you. Design is swamp dungeon, including solid cattails that act as barriers to movement and war magic. -- Doc Feelgood 6/9/2000
I was plaing on darktide and jumped in here to escape from some PKs who were camping the sho roadside portal exit.BAD IDEA!!dont come in here unless you can solo AT LEAST FOUR mosswarts who will come at you FROM ALL SIDES. -- death to you ha 3/24/2001

location.name: Olthoi Horde Nest
location.description:
New dungeon discovered in the recent prop on 6/6/00, what ancient horrors await us in this new dungeon? PROBABLY OLTHOI! Level 30+ -- Embryodead
Dont bother going here i alrady killed all the olthoi. DEAD -- Dagger McGee 9/24/2000
This dungeon is not there at the mentioned coordinates. No sign of it. -- Brindle 10/21/2000
It is most definitely there. -- Adric the Red 2/4/2001
If you cannot find this dungeon via AC Explorer DO NOT goto 55.3S 43.45E. OHN is not there, you will need to go to 55.8 *NORTH* 43.5E to find it. Its not very far from the Bandit Castle OHN. -- prok 2/23/2001
It appears that AC Explorer is not properly updating dungeon info when theres a coordinate conflict such as this. I doubt this post will be of any help to AC-E users are they will never see it unless they come to this site. -- prok 2/24/2001

location.name: Black Dominion
location.description: Moved in the Treaties of Stone event (July 14, 2004), to 88.6S, 25.9W from 49.0S, 66.4W Tieable, Summonable, Exit to surface just inside. This is now where you upgrade the Blue Singularity weapons to Purple (Martinate Holding for changing Purple to Green ). Be careful in this dungeon, If you die with your Blue weapon, you will lose it. At that point you must wait a week to begin again. You need lockpick to get to the bottom, there is a 40 resistance locked door near the top. The top of the dungeon has altered drudges and as you continue down you meet Virindi Observers, Executors and Terberous Hollow Minions in good quantity. You can lure many of the Hollows into a pit near the bottom of a large room and snipe them from above. At the very bottom there is a room filled with blue crystals, a few SIK chests and a blue Virindi NPC (Virindi Castaway, level 11) that asks you to hand him a Singularity weapon for an upgrade. -- Buttros -- Brassyl -- Virindi Inquisitor of TD -- Seeker -- Lila_MT

location.name: Olthoi Horde Nest
location.description:
Level 30 and above. So I could not enter it. -- Pounce, HG
Well, first floor full of workers, about 15 second respawn time, go one ramp down and full of soldiers, same respawn time, very narrow hallways, if someone is being attacked and runs, those who wait to late will die. They will be trapped within this mess. Farther down you come to a room which everyone calls the ""flood room"". Not sure how many have been here. Narrow hallway going into this room, soldiers swarm in. I did not have time to approximate the number of soldiers here because there was just to many to count. I would say at least 50 hit this room at once if not more. 3-6 uber chests found so far. Unless you like vitae, I wouldn't go to far down. -- Eichschet 6/8/2000
Spawn time is now more like 2-4 minutes. It isn't bad if you are alone in there, but with 5 or more people running around, it is a mad rush to try to get some bugs to yourself. -- T-Bird (HG) 9/1/2000
If you're coming up from Zaikhal, make SURE to come at this dungeon from the east. It's in an impassable box canyon from the west. I hate mountains. Stupid, stupid, stupid design. Wasted 45 minutes running around trying to get down, so at least you get to save time if you go. -- Arisana 11/25/2000
The surface to this dungeon is very quiet, great place to buff and also has a nice view of the landscape. At the bottom of the dungeon usually has a surface portal, but not this one. No the Zak OHN has a portal at the bottom that takes you to the Bandit Castle OHN (surface of course). This is great for when Zak OHN becomes too camped, but then again so is Bandit OHN. There are 2 Uberchests in the dungeon, I would fully ignore the 2nd chest on the 3rd floor (in the flood room where about 20-30 Olthoi Soldiers spawn in a large room with a narrow entrance hallway). Ive gotten nothing but crap (Gems!? Stam elixors!? im insulted!!). Note: Olthoi Soldiers become alot easier to deal with when using Level V protects. Acid and Piercing IVs just dont cut the mustard. -- prok 2/12/2001 Has been moved to 40.4N, 34.5E from 48.9N, 12.9W. -- Armin 12/12/2004

location.name: Ridge Citadel
location.description: Gotrok Montok, Gotrok Extas, Extas Raider, Gotrok Tiatus and a sik chest.

location.name: Dungeon of Corpses
location.description:
Millions of Drudge Raveners, Stalkers and Lurkers and some Virindi Servants, really fast spawn. At least 2 uber chests. -- Snake
Less ravs, more stalkers and lurkers. Virindi are servants, not too many. 2 uber chests in the same room. another chest that I check repeatedly but never got anything. -- Theneler (TD) 6/9/2000
Warning to people without item magic, it is possible to get trapped in this dungeon, without a way out. There is a lot of jumping from this to that in this dungeon, and there is one spot near the end that you cant get out of without recall or summon. I counted at least 4 chests when I was there. -- IpNomad (LC) 7/23/2000
Lots of Stalkers and Lurkers. Only a few Raveners. No Altered Drudges. There's about 3 Virindi Servant spawns in there. Be careful now that the virindi cast bludgeon vuln, the drudges can hurt while they're kicking... The above poster was correct, there is one room that has no way out unless you can recall. 2 uber chests, 2 chests I didn't check, and 1 chest-not-so-uber. -- Garfield Bond 8/5/2000
This is a great place for lifemages 25+, tons of stalkers and such to drain, and once there all dead (nearly an endless supply of them) you can jump down, and collect your uber loot. Really nice. ;) -- Tiabin 9/21/2000
Dunno about collecting ""uber loot"". I usually jump down and collect a fish or two, a gem or two, and a heavy virtually worthless shield or two. Stalkers here seem to drop even worse loot than outdoor Stalkers and I've never found a Rav gut here (although it seems Turbine has lowered the gut drop rate considerably everywhere). Fun place to meet some wall-huggin life mages and perched archers, though ;) -- Janx Spirit 10/18/2000
The above post about not being able to exit the last room is incorrect. The room in question is the one with the 2 uber chests and the virindi in the middle. If you take the tunnel opposite the stairs and go left, at the end you will come upon a set of iron bars. Those bars can be opened. Jumping down puts you near the main entrance. Makes a great escape route in case you get ovrewhelmed. -- Kisama Ryoken 11/21/2000
Your incorrect about the non-drop of Rav Guts..I have gotten 6 guts there....but it took me from level 25-30 to get them... -- Rykar Stonestel 1/19/2001
guts, keys and Xp best place i have every been too. It is a power lvl Powerhouse when it's not camped. Lots of fun stuff out side when it is camped -- the dead 1/23/2001
If you're a mage with melee defense you can buff with 6's and jump down into the ""pit."" You will get many more kills using war spells than the life mages will camping on the ledge....but it does take some big balls to pull it off against 7 or 8 stalkers! -- Happy Spellmore 6/16/2001
How times have changed... now a lonely place. -- Doc Feelgood 1/4/2003

location.name: Village Lifestone
location.description: Near the North Desert Edge portal and Three Merchants NW of Zaikal -- Wei Kou Gai

location.name: Hills Citadel
location.description: Gotrok Obeloth, Gotrok Lithos, Gotrok Gigas, Gotrok Montok, and still has a SIK Chest. -- Zen Tek Ken 9/19/2003

location.name: Lugian Barbeque
location.description: 8 Laigus Lugians and a Litho Lugian having a barbeque in the mountains. -- Erik of Frostfell -- Erik

location.name: Direlands Life Stone
location.description: Surprisingly a lifestone in the middle of nowhere. -- Buttros

location.name: Location of Bai Den's Gem
location.description: The gem is part of the shoushi starter dungeon quest. 6/7/2000

location.name: Murk Warrens
location.description:
North of Zaikhal. No entry restrictions. Full range of basic Mosswarts in early stages and most of the Banderling race in the later stages. Spawn is very rapid and large groups are encountered. Always some more rushing to help the current bunch youre fighting. Didnt find much beyond the locked doors except a surface portal leading to the entry point. Theer were parts of the dungeon we may have missed through our exploration and constant battling. Found by Agamemnon. Fought through by Katsumii, Agamem, Chibi and God. -- Katsumii
This place is Full of Mossworts, mudlarks barker, shamans at least as far a I got, which Wasnt far. The respawn is fast and I only got a little way in by myself before I was ankle deep in mossie corpses.. It is rather large and you should definately take a group just to keep up with the respawn. Or take lots of stamina potions.. -- Stranyr alQroni
Futher Down you get knee deep in Banderlings, Breeders, Captains, Ravers, Guards, Raiders .....made it to the end and thats about it -- The Vampire 6/24/2000
Great place for levels 15 and up for experience. Re-spawn rate is incredible. Above notes correct, bring stamina potions with you...preferable in bucket loads. -- Leifson 6/26/2000
This is the ULTIMATE place for a mid sized lvl 15-25 group to lvl. You want a challenge, you wanna see some of the coolest battles in all of dereth? Youve come to the right place. Murk Warrens has only 2 BREEDS of monsters. Mosswarts (Feeders-Cheifs) in the first half, and Banderlings (Scouts-Ravers) in the second half. In 1st area if the dungeon, the monsters only rush in at the front (about 5-15 at a time). As you progress in the dungeon, they come in about 20 at a time, in front, and 10 rush in from the back. Oh, and remember that the respawn time is 2 mins, so alot of times, as you kill 1 wave, another wave will spawn behind you. I didnt know my way around too well, because it is dark, and so is my monitor (it REALLY REALLY sucks), but when you get to a locked door in the mosswart area, DO NOT GO IN FOR GODS SAKE. There are about 10 moss cheifs and 50+ other mosswarts that will rush out as you open it. Besides that, when you are fighting that group, youll get side rushed by a group down another hallway. There is also a room in the banderling area with the same situation, but diffrent look. Just look for the locked doors. This place IS NOT reccomended for mages =P. I know because I am one (lvl 22 all schools mage), and I went with a group of Melee fighters. If your a mage, stay in back and cast de-buffs on the stronger guys and heal, & infuse stamina on your allys. If you waste mana using war spells, your done for because theyll start to rush YOU. If your in a group, make sure all the melee fighters are lvl 20-35. Mages can be any level (we had lvl 11, 17, 21, 24, and 32 melee fighers, and me, as a lvl 15 mage). -- Al-Tuvah 8/8/2000
The dungeon is new school with heroic physical dimensions and spawn rate. A nice place for mixed levels to work on leveling. Entrance and foyer are both safe. Running in from Zaikhal (south) is safer than running in from the north. -- Doc Feelgood 10/8/2000
Dont even bother coming here unless you have a small army of low level people with nothing better to do than kill mosswarts.too many for anyone to kill them all alone.Nobody is ever here!why did turbine even make this place? -- Sega Slayer 11/15/2000

location.name: Collector
location.description: There is a new collector here. She will take all the normal stuff rat tails, wings, bandies, dillos etc. but no hides. -- Stranyr alQroni

location.name: North Nanto Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone near North Nanto Outpost and Training Dungeon. 06/08/2000 -Hidesato -- Hidesato

location.name: Asuger temple
location.description:
i just saw a lvl 60 banderling berserker in here. i engaged it with my sword from behind a gate and to my shock and surprise, the dang thing opened the gate and hit me down to 4 hp. at lvl 10 with sword 144 i had no chance. next time ill not try hitting him thats for sure. the rest seems accurate enough. -- Tattoo 1/23/2002
The above changes in the dungeon are because it is now part of the Elysas Favor quest. I will put the details under the Fort Witshire entry since that is the last dungeon you need to go through to complete the quest. -- Krell (LC) 1/23/2002 Mid level Banderlings and Hollow Minions inhabit this dungeon. Toward the end is a large room full of Hollow Minions. This room has a Storage Chest containing a Glass Spherule. Find the key on a hollow, then return the Spherule to Sir Rylanan -- Taarna Blood SC 10/11/2004

The notes below are out of date and for historical reference only.

Really nice banderling temple NW of Holtburg. Cotains Young Banderlings and Scouts at the top and Banderling Guards and Raiders further in. Found 2 chests with gems and 1 level 2 magic ring. Nice design and graphics. I assume this is a new one since I havent seen it posted anywhere else. -- Pyreal Hawk
Level 5+ restriction 6/8/2000
Not the greatest loot, but it does provide some excellent sniping spots for archers and mages, but nothing completely safe. Fun dungeon with nice mists. -- Yoshi Suji 9/12/2000
Yup, went there today with level 10 archer and two mages. We had a blast fighting our way down to the bottom and up again. There are two paths to take. Lots of narrow tunnels and few open places means its possible to have a meat shield protect the flimsy mages. One of Dereths better low level dungeons. -- Immacolata 5/12/2001

location.name: Black Spawn Den (2)
location.description:
Seems to be similar to the one at 56.6S, 86W. 3-4 Tusker Slaves at entrance, lots more deeper in. Managed to get my first +20% vitae at this place but the xp is incredible!!! Not sure if theres another level (I didnt find one) but didnt go all the way through. -- Steve Al-Thos
Level 20+ -- Steve Al-Thos 6/8/2000
This dungeon really sux. -- BaelZevuv 6/8/2000
Sucks? Its awesome. I can earn a million xp in maybe 4 hours max. its awesome. -- Theneler ( TD ) 6/22/2000
Its pretty easy to die in here if youre not careful, but its a great place to get XP. There are no safe rooms here. The front room occasionally has tuskers in it because someone brought them up there. This is a great place for a small group of mages to lvl up! The surface portal cannot be tied to, only the entrance portal. Just be sure to bring all your bludgeoning protects. -- Garfield Bond 8/5/2000
this place is easy if you are buffed with pros and banes -- Gordan 8/19/2000
I dont have anything against mages, just mages who insist on casting on the tusker im fighting when there are 10 tuskers on me. Get your own tuster buddy :) -- Fullcrum 11/4/2000
Good tying point for Obs Plains hunting. Steel chests nearby. -- Khazeh al-Qunat 7/13/2001
Level 20 restriction, but in reality, no 20th lv player will survive in there without serious help. Robe mages beware: if youre not casting at least 5s in item and life you will not survive (and I mean at least!) Great xps if you can get into a fellowship. An OG/BM combo works great in here. -- Tuspec of MT 12/30/2001
This dungeon is amazing, after the monster rebalancing, these tuskers are worth about 20,000 XP per kill. This BSD inparticular is really never camped, because not alot of travelers know about it, and therefor you can make mad levels in no time at all. -- Rush of WE 4/13/2003

location.name: Nor's Folly
location.description: Nice dungeon, good place for a party of chars L5-8 or so. Tons of Drudges (Prowlers, Slinker, Sneakers) on a pretty quick respawn. Found two chests, one locked, the other with typical low-level loot. Just be careful as the Prowlers are pretty smart about finding a path to you -- its easy to get swarmed if youre alone. -- Ibn Schachabo 2/24/2001

location.name: Mosswart Bunker
location.description:
This holds the key needed to enter Swamp Temple. Key is lying on the ground at the back of the bunker. It's a Mosswart ambush point, when battle starts a dozen will show up inside and a couple dozen will close from outside. Grab and run works... if you don't get stuck in the crush. -- Doc Feelgood
Stock AL 50 Chain Hauberk and Stock Tachi also spawn in here. If you can, get into the bunker and kill everything in there, and wait for the swarm to go away before heading back out. -- Kinjou Dragoon 1/30/2001

location.name: Greenmire B&B
location.description:
This is a lugian house-style dungeon: no portal but three levels deep in the wilderness world. There are about 20 swamp rats and a granite golem greeting you outside. Swamp Rats are lightning breathing brothers of Mountain Rats -- just as ornery, but only half the level. Inside are at least 2 shadows, another granite golem, and 3 liches. Approach from the life stone and arch mage hut just to the north. -- Doc Feelgood
This place has MANY hidden passages and rooms and makes excellent use of optic tricks to hide them. Search Carefully! -- Senshin -MT 9/14/2000
3 liches? Try like 10. A lich lord, 2 shadows, 4 shadow children... this place is really good if you can survive it -- I was able to solo it at level 24. Bring your healing kits and stamina potions, as the liches drain through walls and you WILL need to heal. Oh, and theyre not just optic tricks -- some of the walls are fake and hiding more liches, shadows, and treasure chests. I made 75k XP in about 20 minutes here, which was quite nice for my level. -- Daija of HG 11/26/2001

location.name: Le-Ai Rea
location.description: Just a small house with an NPC called Le-Ai Rea. When you enter he says Lemme alone. And keep my door closed. Not far from the City of the Dead and Mines of Dispair. If you give them a skull from the High Advocate, you will receive the gold key which lets you in, a special 1-use key that opens the door at the bottom of the Mines (to the home of the vortex that powers the Focusing Stone) as well as 12000xp. The High Advocate skull comes from the Three Towers Quest on the South Landbrige -- Windspear -- Ryth-al-Rothgar -- Chia -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Yu Vuo-ki House
location.description:
Bring here an insignia from a Tumorok and shell tell you how to save her sister. She says she rewards well. -- Soo Many Voices 10/29/2000
The woman is Yu Vuo-ki Gold. After you give her the tumerok insignia, she tells you that her sister is on the edge of Dryreach and you have 30 minutes to find her. Go to the house at 9.0S 73.7E, and she is locked in the cellar. Her sister, Dansha-Ki, will tell you that she needs her spell components to escape. Tumeroks took her belongings north, just moments ago. After you talk to her, a tumerok guard will spawn. Kill it and it drops bone key, which you must have. Her belongings are in the Tumerok Tower at 6.3S 73.6E. Use the bone key to get in and her pack is at the top. Take her pack to the Tumerok House and give it to her. She will give you a Gem of Portal Recall and Dansha-Kis Ring, which is Magic Resis III & Lightning Resis III (diff: 110). You can only perform this quest once in a set time frame. Not sure how long. Not sure why youd wanna do it more than never. Lots of Tumerok Warriors, Fighters, and Scouts. -- Harkoth 11/20/2000
The Dryreach or Portal Gem Quest is broken. I gave Yo Vuo-Ki (2) Tumerok Medialion and she does nothing. Found further information that Turbine has permanently discontinued this quest because of the portal gem. --Keltor Trynos 05/22/01 -- Keltor Trynos 5/22/2001
Not true, I handed Yo Vou-Ki a tumerok insignia, and she started off the quest. I didnt get to finish it though, due to a disconnect. But I assume since she starts you off when you hand over the insignia it isnt broken! -- Fistandantillus 7/14/2001
Well, I spent 2 days looking for her and she was nowhere to be seen. We killed every Tumerok for miles (inc. Officers) and there were no Insignias dropped. We also could find the Bone Engraved Key. I tend to agree with the theory that Turbine have retired this quest... -- Jaz 9/20/2001 9/19/2001
I just completed the quest fir the portal gem and Dansha-Kis Ring. I found the gold insignia on a Tumerok officer up the hill from the East Direlands Swamp portal (8.1S, 74.4E). 3/16/2002

location.name: Western Mountain Path
location.description: Path through the mountains by Kara to the river. Saw Lugians, Mattekars, Shadows and others in the area but most can be avoided if you are in a hurry. -- Khendra

location.name: Eastern Mountain Path (start)
location.description: Path through the mountains east of the river by Kara. -- Khendra

location.name: Eastern Mountain Path (end)
location.description: Path through the mountains east of the river by Kara. -- Khendra

location.name: Olthoi Horde Nest
location.description:
Clone of the other thoi horde nest dungeon east of Colier. Lots of bugs...better call the orkin man. Lvl 30 limit on this one too. -- Surtor
this OHN,just like the other OHNs, is WAYYYY to camped allmost all the time.come at midnight if you choose to some at all.This OHN is near bandit castle and is easy to walk to from there if you dont have portal magic but keep in mind that bandit castle has no jeweler so you wont be able to loot much if thats where your headed back to. -- Sega Slayer 3/24/2001

location.name: Hall of Metos
location.description:
Level 15 and up. Probably a copy of the dungeon by Ayan Baqur. -- Niethra
Liches, Iron Golems, pits of acid (have to jump) -- Krylos (TD) 6/25/2000
Pass liches and jump to acid pit. you will find a secret passage there. there are a lot of revenant here. they cast lvVI spells... -- Elder Merlin 7/20/2000
I have been here several times in the last month and have yet to see anyone else here, probably due to the LS being a long run away. -- Renroc 11/9/2000
The portal here is tieable, the entrance is clear, as is the foyer. Fast gen Lichs and a Lich Lord just beyond the foyer, golems and other monsters beyond that. -- Doc Feelgood 11/26/2000
I spent most of my time hunting here, but got sick of it. Too many level 15 archers camping the Iron room. When a level 15 archer can take on 7 Irons at once, and survive, you know theres something wrong. Anyways, rant aside, I dont know how it is now. If its like the above comment, Im going to grab my tie back there again. But I highly doubt it, since this one is the easiest of the three to get to. -- Duress 11/26/2000
LOTs of revenants (8 in the first part and another 8 passed the Obsidian golems). Heavily camped, but good XP, lots of SIKs, and peas -- Neoson 7/30/2001 Iron Golems, Liches, Great Revenants, Granite Golems, Obsidian Golems, This is a great place to pick up motes and hearts -- Druxus (MT & FF) 6/13/2004

location.name: Portal Fort to Zaikhal
location.description: From Portal Fort to Zaikhal: exit at 14.1N, 1.3E. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Sm Fort
location.description:
Very Small complex (like a fort) Entrance on the North Side with a Single Tower. I didnt explore, a few Tumeroks and Banderlings outside to take a swipe at you as you run past. -- Heman
Locked front door is opened with the Tumerok Gladiators Key thats found in the Tumerok Mine dungeon at 7.9N, 61.3W. Inside a High Tumerok drops the High Tumeroks Key which opens a door in the Cave dungeon at 47.8S, 83.7W -- Nodoka 3/3/2001

location.name: Hall of Metos
location.description:
This dungeon is the one with Liches, Revenants, and assorted golems. Very cool architecture. -- Aphex - HG 6/17/2000
Entrance is clear, restriced to 15+, foyer is clear. But beyond the foyer the gen rate is spectacularly high. Liches and Lich Lords on what seems a one minute gen cycle. -- Doc Feelgood 6/19/2000
Oh thats complete garbage. YOu try to jump across, a simple procedure, yet, hit your head and fall into a pointless acid pit. Remove this CRAP TURBINE Increase the ceiling size or put a portal there. Its nonsense to lose things because of such a stupid stupid feature. -- Goldhart 7/23/2000
There is a wall you can run through at bottom of acid pit. You stand in the middle, jump, then run like heck through the wall to get to other part of dungeon. -- Ceasar Camerion 7/23/2000
In the very beginning, there are, as stated, liches and a lich lord on short respawn. After you run through a little complex full of undead, you can choose between left or right. If you choose left, you have two options. The straight ahead one takes you to a room with granite golems, but the right one leads over an acid pit (jump 130+) and after that a corridor which winds down to a room full of irons on a short respawn. This is a great place for melees of level 25 and up, who can handle the multiple spells. Room also holds a sturdy chest. If you pick right in the corridor you can jump over another acid pit and get to another iron room. In this room there is another corridor leading to multiple Revenants. -- Mr Briefcase 8/12/2000
They call it Paradise for Archers, get some acid arrows and lvl really fast (5000 xp for every iron) -- Neoson 7/30/2001

location.name: Tumerok House
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
Actually two houses- one at 8.9S, 73.2E, and the other at 9.0S, 73.7E. They are within sight of each other. Many Scouts, Fighters and Warrios in both, the one to the east seems to be a barracks of some kind and is more crowded. The whole area is full of Tumeroks and they seem to rise up out of the ground. Warriors throw lvl II and sometimes lvl III bolts. Cant give better description as I was almost killed marking the coords. -- Jann 9/30/2000
Eastern house has a cellar, the stairxase is near the northern door. Both houses have two chests upstairs, no loot. There is also what I will call the Tumerok Picnic Area west of the western house, at 9.0S, 72.9E, where a warrior, two scouts and a fighter are having kunch around a small table. Anything you attack in this area will cause reinforcements to come running, but they dont seem very interested in fighting. -- Jann 10/1/2000

location.name: Tumerok Officer's Camp
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
5 or 6 Tumerok warriors, an officer, and 1 or 2 grunts occupy a one-sided defensive barricade. Most are on the ground behind the wall, a couple are on the ramparts. This is a dangerous spot to attack alone as the Tumeroks will not allow you to tease them into single combat, and the firepower coming out of this position, especially the back side, can have a mid level warrior running for cover. Level III magic bolts, and arrows fired by level 20 Tumerok Warriors. The loot is heavy, mostly magic weapons and armor, but Dryreach is visible from the wall. -- Jann 9/30/2000
WOAH! Did I forget to mention that the Officer throws level V bolts?? One shot took almost 100 points off. Also, if you kill a Tunerok within range the others seem to get a fix on you and you will suffer a rain of arrows and magic bolts. -- Jann 9/30/2000

location.name: Tumerok House
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
A little military style combat. Dryreach is under siege, and the Tumeroks have set up this roadblock to restrict travel into the city. You cant really see the house from the road. You will know you are getting close when you see the tower off to the left. If you are travelling on the road you will not see the sentrys until you are caught in a crossfire of quarrels fired from behind the protection of roadside bushes. Best to start from the outside and work your way in. About 4 fighters and 5 scouts guard the road, and sometimes the back side of the house. 2 Warriors are either in or near the house, and they will occasionally fire level III bolts at you. But this is a defensive position, and the Tumeroks fight like humans. They wont chase you far. You have to go in and get them. They like to stand behind cover, bushes, trees, rocks, so archers make sure you have a clear shot. A mid level warrior can handle the grunts pretty easily, but watch the warriors and bring your magic resist or your heal kits, because those bolts sting. When you attack the house itself you may trigger a massive spawn of reinforcements, but they dont seem to want to cross the road, and I have never been able to engage them in battle. Where do they go?? The loot is heavy, and mostly magic. But take it. You will rake up in town, as the prices are quite high. -- Jann 9/30/2000
There are actually two spawning points here, one directly in front of the house and the other is a little ways north. Depending on how long it has been since someone came through and cleaned it out there could be as many as 20 Tumeroks between the two spawns, 4 or 5 of them being warriors. The warriors WILL chase you, especially if they have you injured. -- StoneCold 9/30/2000

location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
Restricted to Level 1-12, so I couldnt get in -- Cordelia 12/29/2000
Mostly Drudge Skulkers and White Rats. Nothing that a level 3 could not handle easy. Only thing about this place I liked was the design, very nice dungeon layout, maze like almost, creepy sometimes...wasted on the mobs currently there. A lot more dangerous outside, almost got swarmed by 3 Mites. -- CD - DT 2/19/2002 No restriction now. Otherwise doesnt seem changed at all. All the dungeons in Lytelthorpe could do with overhauls, since new players dont start anywhere near here anymore... -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

location.name: Top of Mt. Zabool Tower
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
This is a low level dungeon with restrictions on higher level characters -- Saphyre Blue 7/9/2000
Actually there is no level restriction on this entrance. This portal takes you to the top of the dungeon listed as Zoobool Tower (21.7N, 19.4E - which you must have just come through, as its the only way to get to this mountain top), just above the dungeons exit portal. There is no exit portal at the bottom of this dungeon, so the only reason to use this upper entrance is to enter, blast the lvl 20 lich, exit back here to the mountain top to heal/recover, and go back in again to blast the lich some more. Not fair for the poor lich! -- Larce Mantoll 10/3/2000

location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
This a a stone which you can jump on and if you stand in the right place you can kill the 5 Olthoi Workers that spawn like clockwork. If you stand in the wrong place you will get killed. This stone is very heavily camped, in fact, some people have moved mules onto the rock and never leave. If you fo during the heavy times you will probably have to share space with 2 or 3 other people. If you are not a high level archer you will get next to nothing out of it. -- Jann 9/29/2000
As of June 01 patch, there are still olthoi workers spawning. Is camped pretty good too by archers. Watch out for a group of Drudge Lurkers, Stalkers and the new Dark Claws that spawn nearby. If you get there attention they will cast level 3 and 4 wars/debuffs on you. -- Jake the Dog 6/21/2001

location.name: Collector's House
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Cabin and Hut
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Northern Passage Watchtower
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Empty Hall

location.name: Three Stone Heads
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
Three Stone heads lying in the mire. One stands upright and has an entrance in the mouth to a chamber. Its a mosswart ambush spot. -- Doc Feelgood 7/6/2000

location.name: Desert Lifestone
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Four Towers Lifestone
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Shoushi Southeast Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Shoushi West Outpost
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
Give Lou Ka his Yaoji, found to the west in Drudge Grotto, and he gives you a Stone of Discipline to take to Oi-Tong Ye in Shoushi. 4/1/2001
Give Lou Ka his Yaoji, found to the west in Drudge Grotto, and he gives you a Stone of Discipline to take to Oi-Tong Ye in Shoushi. -- Immacolata 4/1/2001

location.name: Al-Arqas West Outpost
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
One of the Start Destinations. Advocate Spire, and a merchant, along with newbie quest inside the building. Double click the woman standing by the fountain for a quest involving kitchen knives. -- Punisher Zod 1/24/2001

location.name: Al-Arqas North Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Yaraq East Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Yaraq North Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Yanshi North Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Samsur Northwest Outpost
location.description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
Youll now find that Rubid al-Jurma (0.0, 16.3E) is Samsurs Society Representative. Give him your stamped letters for nice rewards. -- Sis. Immacolata 1/14/2001

location.name: Rithwic East Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: Holtburg South Outpost
location.description: Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat

location.name: South Direlands to Qalaba'r Portal
location.description:
Exits at 75.0S, 19.6E. -- Polecat
If you use Z

location.name: Black Hill to Small Black Hill Portal
location.description: Entry is courtesy of . -- Polecat

location.name: Cragstone Portal
location.description: Entry is courtesy of . -- Polecat

location.name: Tumerok Fortification to Dryreach Portal
location.description: Exits at 8.1S, 74.0E. -- Polecat

location.name: Walled Portals
location.description:
Exits at 21.5S, 74.6W. -- Polecat
This is an

location.name: Direlands Lifestone
location.description: -- Firath

location.name: Stone Head
location.description: A stone Head that looks like the one leading into Sclavus Keep (Dires), but there is no portal, just a little room. -- Niethra

location.name: Murk Warrens
location.description:
Murk Warrens: NorthEast of Baishi. No entry restrictions. Full range of Mosswarts and very very rapid spawns. Good for lvl 15+. Didnt get far into dungeon since i was alone. -- kang Wong-Li
Lots of Shamans. Further on you run into Banderlings, then more Mosswarts inlcuding a Chief. We were running low on supplies, so we fought our way back to the exit and left. Still lots to explore... -- Siergen 7/15/2000
If you are 25th or below, this is an excellent place for sellable loot. You can kill/re-kill the first two spawns (regens every minute or so) with little danger and (by being selective) easily make 30k a trip. Portal or LS recall is recommended as this dungeon is quite far from town. -- Sooyoonow 2/10/2001

location.name: Toppled Stone Head
location.description: A toppled Empyrean stone head in the middle of a swamp. -- Niethra

location.name: Murk Warrens
location.description: West of Stonehold. Probably a copy to the other two Murk Warrens found to date. The top level is full of mudlurk and barker mosswarts, spawning very quickly. Did not go any further. Many banderlings, tuskers, and wood golems around the entrance - not a safe place to rest from the dungeon. Exit portal near the entrance point. -- GladiusHawkwood

location.name: Lugian Mine
location.description:
South High Mountains, Near Baishi And Qalabar. Dungeon added During Julys Patch, Contains Ore at the end of the dungeon -- RaidenTheVampir
Rather sparsly populated with Laigus and Amploth lugians embueded with the charming ability to ignore any and all magic, include banes, vulns, war spells, and protects. Magic users: You have been warned -- JA 7/11/2000
The above poster was right. If your a mage you NEED to whip out your atlan, and got get some armor and shield. You can buff you weapon, and stats, however watch out for the dispel magic traps. Mages in robes
be ready to be 1 or 2 hit. Imagine yourself running in there naked. . because you are. -- Theneler 7/12/2000
Get your low quality ore here, makes a hollow weapon same damage as superior atlan but useful for pk as it cant be buffed and ignores armor/imperil/impen/banes -- mengar 7/12/2000
I think its medium quality ore. And yes, mages are screwed here. I got killed in one hit by an obeloth (oops). Mages can avoid the mana drains by running alongside the walls while going through here though. If youre a mage going through here, bring warrior friends to kill for you. -- Garfield Bond 9/9/2000
Poster above is incorrect, it is low-quality ore that you can mine here. Again, mages should just keep the hell out of here. Melees in the high teens to low 20s can make it as long as there are two or more of you. You only need one ore deposit as they are No Drop and useless except to make the Hollow weapon of your choice -- Syndi 9/19/2000
This mine is also a decent place to level if youre a melee. Groups of 3 amploth and laigus up top are no problem, the toughest part will be once you get down to the mining floor/caves about 8 can come at you from both sides if youre not careful. Oh, and if youre looking for the ore, go straight ahead (going around the rings as neccesary) until you get down to the bottom floor. Then go right, and youll find a portal to the surface and the ore. When in doubt, go right. As above, not too tough for a melee in the high teens or low twenties. Remember though, your Armor jewelery is pretty much useless. -- Jadok al-Siran 10/5/2000

location.name: Catacombs of the Forgotten
location.description:
Skeleton warriors, captains, and lords. This is the resting (not quite actually) place of Mi Krau-Li. -- Xinister
A note is in the sacrophagous. The Jitte can be found near the Sacrophagous, guarded by a skellie lord. Its not so obvious, I missed it twice. -- Xinister 7/18/2000
Did this quest the first day of the patch, the Jitte is infact lower down the dungeon after the sarcophagous with the note 2 branches lead deeper left and right. Actually they both end up the same way but the Jitte is on the floor in the room farthest to the left guarded by a couple of skele lords and other misc skeles. Be warned the second part of the quest is alot tougher i soloed this place at lvl 34. -- Sem 8/10/2000

location.name: Chalicmere Fortress
location.description: This is Chalcimere Fortress -- an oasis in a drear direlands plain. The Gates to this castle are guarded well, the Door has a lockpick resistance of 242. There are reasonably easy jump-up points on the north wall. The fortress is inhabited with Revenant, Mu-Myiah, Obsidian and Diamond Golem, and its a good Diamond Golem hunting area. Spawn rate is slow. Falahda The Emissery opens a portal to Aerlinthe for a C note. -- RaidenTheVampir -- Doc Feelgood -- Silverion DD -- DaOlthoiKiller -- Temunji Sakura -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Lugian Quarry
location.description:
New for July Patch.Get your red hot medium level ore here. This ore is for the dispel magic potions. Lugains protecting this are carrying hollow weapons (i.e. goes through buffs) Lithos and Oboleths, plus mana drain traps. -- Brother Za
Correct name is Lugian Quarry, this makes it much easier to find when searching for it
) -- Ardak Eaglehear 6/20/2001

location.name: Krau Li Labyrinth
location.description:
Hill was only approachable from west side. I assume this is where you take your jitte for new July jitte quest. Top level is all Skel captains and Lords, lower levels were lords and Skel Bone Knights. Oddly never saw an acid weapon. Doors are all lever activated off torches. But I wasn't able to get back to any of them with a 269run in time. must take at least 2 people. Bring friends. -- Senshin-MT
Ok talked to Makish and the final section is Bone Lords,Bone Knights, and some misc. Skel Lords behind the doors. Switches are aparently a major pain. Be sure to be about 35+ lvl to hit the Bone Lords. -- Senshin -MT 7/12/2000

location.name: Aerlinthe Reservoir
location.description:
Goes from Dark Revs at the drop in the beginning, to many wasteland (annoying!!!) rats on you. Then, if you get past the golems, it turns into olthoi city with workers, soldiers and some nymphs. Got stuck at a locked iron door. Not sure if you need lockpicking or a special key--would guess you need a key. -- Parabolic (DT) 9/4/2000
Entrance and exit are hot with Diamond Golems and Alerinth spawn. Foyer is hot with two Dark Revenants. -- Doc Feelgood 11/12/2002

location.name: Peddler (and farm)
location.description: Peddler south of Rithwic. Sells armour, paper, clothing, lock picks (plain, crude), food, healing kits (plain, crude), weapons, etc. Only seems to buy weapons though. -- Dunc

location.name: Setab's Barracks
location.description: Level 1-10. Small dungeon with Druges. Skulkers, Sneakers, etc. A couple of chests with a few Ps in them. Nothing else special in here. -- DuncNo level restriction. Otherwise looks the same. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

location.name: Northwest Direlands Portal
location.description: Restricted to 35+. Exits 5.5N, 87.5W. This portal is on top of a small obsidian hill, and is yellow. -- Niethra

location.name: Northwest Direlands Portal
location.description:
You need to be on the new isle to get to this portal. It lets out at... -- Savage
The portal has a level 35 and higher restriction on it. Good to know for those of level 45 or higher that has access to Aerlinthe. -- Immacolata 9/9/2001

location.name: Burun Cathedral
location.description: No level Req. Part of the 40+ Renegade Stone Clasp / Renegade Herbal Kit quest. Contains a locked door near the top (resistance 124). Entrance is clear. Layout of the dungeon is medium-size with large rooms. The main room on the top level is so big that you can get into some interesting in-sight-but-beyond-radar battles. Contains Burun Ruuk Louts and Fiends near the top, with Seers and Soothsayers at the bottom near the chest room. Spawn is quite fast. To open the chest, use Strong Iron Keys from the Small Complex just north of here. Chest contains a Stone Clasp (bracelet), 10 Renegade Herbal Kits and some lore titled "Correspondence." -- Dotto and Temunji Sakura -- Khaos -- Doc Feelgood -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Banderling Camp
location.description: A banderling camp with banderling captains, guards and raiders, mite diggers and brown rats. They are guarding two unlocked chests that spawn low level loot, didnt wait around for a respawn. The surrounding area has more banderlings, tuskers, mites and wood golems. -- QBahn

location.name: Two Sandbars
location.description: We noticed this spot while hunting the beaches south of Mayoi. Two completely flat sandbars on the water. The northern one had lots of various spawns. The southern one had no spawn and offered a brief respite. Nice quiet, if remote, area to hunt. -- Woochan/Peipei

location.name: Dark Wisp Pool
location.description:
4 or 5 Dark wisps hang out here all the time... -- Skeeve
How did you find that? :) -- Notright 8/8/2000

location.name: Tower
location.description: Tower near Ft. Teth. Inhabited by 2 veteran reedsharks and several banderling guards. There was a group of banderling enforcers and thrashers nearby, but I think that was a random spawn. -- Mr. al-Habib

location.name: Lifestone
location.description:
Must be new for August update...good lifestone location for the Artifex Vault. Also a hut with a peddler and trophy collector. Lifestone surrounded by various beasts (mud/water golems, azure groms) 08-08-00 -- Ahmed al-Turas
Also a portal to plateau that exits at 44.5N, 43.1W -- Ahmed al-Turas 8/8/2000

location.name: Peddler/Collector
location.description:
Peddler and Trophy collector located in a hut on the beach. 08/08/00 -- Ahmed al-Turas
This is just a regular collector, *not* a Trophy Smith. -- J 10/4/2000

location.name: Mountain road Lifestone
location.description: A lifestone on the road between Qal and the south dires. Also has a tent with a mecrchant / mage dealer and an armorer. -- Faelon

location.name: Arena (Yaraq)
location.description:
This is one of the arena portals added in the August patch. Lifestone right when you enter. Some neat lighting effects at the judging station. -- Fyrecrypts
This place looks like a Q3 Deathmatch Map
) -- Al-Tuvah 8/8/2000
Becauseful when you go to the Judges Platform, there are some levers that open doors, if the doors are not open and you jump down, there is no way for you to get bak out. Youll have to call your patron or one of your vassels to come free you =P -- Maldovix 10/10/2000

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone on the road between Neydisa Castle and Bandit Castle -- Enosh

location.name: High Mountain Valley
location.description: A one way portal to High Mountian Valley. High Montain Valley Portal exits at . Also as far as I can tell, this is the Interest Point between Arwic and Eastham. -- Dunc

location.name: Changing Random Portal
location.description:
This is a portal near a travelling Mages tent on the road from Qalabar to the South Dires land bridge -- Ty Phoo
This is no longer a portal to Tufa, it now goes to Uziz -- Salmoneus 9/14/2000
Its a Floating City portal now, looks permanent. -- Ladonna 11/5/2000
Exits 4.7s 3.1w on the Northern edge of the desert 11/30/2000
Nope, I see a portal to Qualabar, no level restrictions. It appears that this a permanant portal, yet randomly changes its destination. Someone should put a portal mule here and periodically check to see if any interesting portals are found. -- prok 3/4/2001
Todays portal is to Tufa. Obviously this portal spawns to random locations. -- Rojon 6/23/2001

location.name: South East Direlands Lifestone
location.description: Its a lifestone baby! -- Alkitron

location.name: Sawato Portal
location.description: Exits at 29.1S, 58.9E portal to sawato neeto! -- Alkitron

location.name: Arwic Mines to Moss Chamber
location.description: Portal at the bottom of Arwic Mines. Takes you to the Moss Chamber near Zaikhal. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/29/2004

location.name: Arwic Mines to Old Mine
location.description:
Inside the arwic mine, a newbie dungeon, down a little ways, there is a portal to the old mines. Goes to the old mine, a lugian dungeon with Laigus at the beginning. The surface portal there drops you at 79.1S, 27E -- Julian
Portal Exit coordinates takes you to the Old Mine. 8/23/2001

location.name: Arwic Mines
location.description: Like many of the old newbie haunts, the critters here have been upgraded. Silver and Sewer Rats, Drudge Lurkers and Stalkers, Malus Shreths, etc. have replaced their previous newbie counterparts. -- Shemp 6/8/2004 Contains Elthina the Shady, a provisioner type shopkeeper. Buys at 90%-- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Dryreach Lifestone
location.description:
The new and improved lifestone near Dryreach added with the August 2000 update. -- Khaos
Completely surrounded by Banderlings, Reedsharks, and Small Shadowchilds. A low level character could get killed trying to use it. -- Jann 9/30/2000

location.name: Hill of Bones
location.description:
A field of bones that leads up a hill to a statue of Baelzharon. The dead are not peaceful here though as a horde of skeletons, skeleton captains and lords guard this strange place. -- Tekkiw
No statue or undead. Copper and Ice golems, as well as mid-level drudges (i.e. Lurkers and Stalkers.) Also groups of low level Bandies (Gaurds, Raiders and Ravenors.) -- Jake the Dog 6/21/2001
As of 1/24/2002, no golems, just drudges, manougas and lugians -- Ognam 1/24/2002

location.name: Plateau River Lifestone
location.description: Me and my friend Myrridin found this lifestone while exploring the river area for fragments. We also found a Zhaikal portal near here, which then dissapeared when we went further. There was also a Qalabar portal right by the Lifestone but when I reloged the portal was gone! The lifestone is a good staging point if you are hunting in the River area. -- Nexic

location.name: Shimena Keep
location.description: A castle situated on a small islet north of Aerlinthe Island, also mentioned in the Aerlinthe Record . Inside there is a Floating Advocate tower building with a North Yanshi Advocate Building Portal. There are about a dozen Ancient Coral Golems surrounding the keep, with some high level undead and more Ancient Coral Golems around the back of the keep where the entrance is. A broken bridge crosses from the mainland to the castle. There are Pyreal, Platinum (1), and Sapphire Golems (level 120) inside. There are also a number of Diamond Golems inside the keep, along with Relic Bones. -- Fin McCool -- Nightwolf (LC) -- Invictus -- Seeker

location.name: Dillo Rocks
location.description: Group of rocks just off the beach, with a submerged chest in the middle of them, guarded by 6 - 8 shore dillos. Chest spawns low-grade gems/jewelry/misc. items, comparable to what you get off the dillos. Good spot if youre looking for spines or large hides. -- Adric the Red

location.name: Water Golem Shrine
location.description:
I came accross a small shrine in the water which had 4 Water golems at it. It is just south of the hut/lifestone near the river, nw of Holtburg
12/08/00 -- Nature Stud
During the December 2000 patch I was up here found 3 of the new Tainted golems -- Armin 12/27/2000

location.name: PK Only Arena
location.description: This is an exact copy of the other PK Arena, but it is restricted to pks only. Hopefuly this will end the debate of weather or not the arenas are PK only or not by proving there are 2 arenas, not one. A PK only and PK/NPK (located at 18.5S 3.7E) -- Sargonas

location.name: Lifestone
location.description:
Near a portal to Baishi and another to North Desert Ridge, a mage, bowyer and healer are nearby -- hailesmail
portals are random spawn -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

location.name: Shop by the Sea Life Stone
location.description: Life Stone next to the shop -- Dysphagia

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Wilderness lifestone on the beach just south of the ice isle -- Enosh

location.name: Stonehold Portal
location.description:
Portal to Stonehold on the northern beach. Just south of the ice isle, and near a lifestone and wandering bowyer. Exits at 68.7N, 21.8W -- Enosh
random spawn -- Doc Feelgood 1/2/2003
Its perfectly static. Has been for years. Still here. -- Immacolata 6/13/2003

location.name: Empyrean Temple
location.description:
An Empyrean Power Station type building with a white flame burning atop the spire. Inside, gazing up into the interior of the spire, one sees dozens of small floating motes of light and two spheres. The larger sphere is a mottled reddish-gold. The smaller sphere is green. Both are about a foot in diameter and slowly change position with the passage of time. A model of the two moons perhaps? Found by Haak al-Qulus. Entered by his pupil
Obunaga -- jameslawrence
Now taken over by 6 Raider Juggernaut -- Zen Tek Ken 6/24/2003

location.name: The Jolly Snowman
location.description: The Jolly Snowmanhas moved to the area west of Stonehold, sells Magic Snowball used to make icecream. He only sells the snowballs and only takes cash. Mostly matttekars and banderlings in the area, but with the migrations, Drudge Stalkers are not unknown. Choclate icecream is a healing food that does not require alchemy to produce. Snoballs cost 100p each. Mustafa Al Uziz, Scout for the Legends of Dereth Leafcull -- Mustafa Al Uziz

location.name: Lifestone/Peddler
location.description: Lifestone and peddler (basic peddler items). Portal to Baishi nearby. -- Less

location.name: Baishi Portal
location.description: Portal to Baishi, exits 49.3S, 62.9E. Lifestone and peddler nearby. -- Less

location.name: Aerlinthe Isle Portal
location.description:
Talk to Galaena the Emmisary and then hand over a D note. She will open this portal... be very careful. Run and jump off the ledge immediately
there is a spawn or three right at the landing. -- Milinda (TD)

location.name: Archmage Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone in wilderness near archmage. -- Skysong

location.name: Bandit Castle Portal
location.description: Portal to Bandit Castle (65.0N, 49.3E) -- Skysong

location.name: Aurlanaa's Gromnietross Aerie
location.description: Aurlanaas Gromnietross Aerie mentioned in the Aerlinthe Record, RE241. -- The Spectre

location.name: Tenkardunn Foundry
location.description: part of the Aerlinthe Isle Quest. The Sluice Gate Bar, and the Smith Golem are lcoated here.

location.name: Aerlinthe Undead Cemetary
location.description: Home of Smith Ejan, The Charred Book (translates to Aerlinthe Record), and the location of the portal to the Aerfalle Keep dungeon. -- The Spectre

location.name: Mt. Tenkarrdun Volcano/Behemoth Spawn point
location.description: This is the location the Behemoth (Aerlinthe Isle Quest) spawns at. -- The Spectre

location.name: Aerfalle Keep
location.description:
Approximate location of Aerfalle Keep dungeon portal, spawns during the Aerlinthe Isle Quest. Discovered by One Man Army of FrostFell. Main Gate is locked and requires lockpick skill. Known to be the home of the powerful undead, Lady Aerfalle. When killed she drops a key to the chest upstairs in her room and a note regarding the shadow wars. -- The Spectre 8/24/2000

No Recall, No Tie Portal. Beware the Level 7 Dispell Trap between the first two doors. Full of Relic Bones, Diamond Golems, Umbris Shadows, Firestorms, Cursed Wisps and Rats. With the quest update during From the Darkness Born this dungeon now has 2 level breaks. In order to get the Recall Scroll, you MUST give the Sacrifical Dagger from Aerlinthe Reservor to The Ghost of Galaeral who is inside this dungeon. He is located near the start on the right side near the exit portal and is behind a lever door. The Dagger weakens Lady Aerfalle and activates the 45+ quest. If you do not hand in the dagger, Lady Aerfalle will be the 80+ version. In the high level version she is very dangerous and should not be taken lightly. She dispells and casts Self protect spells if debuffed. Lady Aerfalle has around 5000 hp and looks like a living Empyrean woman, a very mean Empyrean woman. Use rending weapons and War to defeat her. She will lock onto a single person, debuff them, and then beat them mercilessly. Bring Healer Hearts, dispell gems, and a well organized group. She also has some VOD type undead bodyguards. Regardless, she drops around 9 keys in both 45+ and 80+ versions. The spawn does not stop and maintains its relatively fast rate. Run up to the chest room, minding the 2nd Level 7 Dispell Trap at its entry. Use your key on the appropriate chest. The 80+ Version does NOT get the recall scroll, however the items are much better than the 45+ version. The 80+ Ashbane can be given to its old owner for 10 million XP while the 45+ Ashbane gives 500k. --Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

location.name: Chalicmere Fortress to Aerlinthe Isle Portal
location.description: Portal from Chalicmere Fortress to Aerlinthe Isle, drop you out at 84.1N, 47.1E -- The Spectre

location.name: Aerlinthe Isle to North Yanshi Advocate's Tower
location.description: Portal inside Shimena Keep drop you out at 12.5S, 45.5E, the North Yanshi Advocates Tower -- The Spectre

location.name: Life Stone
location.description: A lifestone next to a peddler and a Archmage. -- Darvin

location.name: Drudge Grotto
location.description: This is where you get a Yaoji to give to a vendor in the shop by the lifestone directly east of here. The vendor then gives you one of the 4 stones that you take to a guy in town that gives you a Key and direction on where to find the next stone. -- Takagi Shouga

location.name: Point Despair
location.description:
For the most part the Mayoi beach is just like every other beach with Azure Gromnies, Blue Phantos Wasps, Water and Mud Golems... until you get to this location. I have seen a number of mid-level characters hunting the beach only to get to Point Despair and get jumped by Shadows, Shadow Lieutenants, Lithos, Gigas and Amploth Lugians, Great and Snowy Mattekars or Ash Gromnies. The spawn is different on a daily basis. The best suggestion, check out that low, dark shape as it approaches you... what you think is an Azure Gromnie will more than likely be an Ash or two, or three... Also, there always seems to be a Bandie or two in the mix just to stir things up. -- Ool
Even saw a Diamond Golem here. A group of us just stood there trying to decide whether we should attack it or not... decided not was the best answer. 160th level was the read on it. -- Ool 9/16/2000

location.name: Path down
location.description: Path down off the plateaus north side -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Small Crater
location.description:
Small Crater, a little west of the Broker Sigil Hermit and south west of the Dark Spire. Strange rock protrusions around the rim. Volcanic crater? Left over from the Beta? Who knows, but its visible on the AC Explorer map... Nothing else exciting. -- Dunc
This is where one of the Shadow Spires erupted from the ground. It has since drifted away. -- Siergen 8/28/2000

location.name: Statue of Bael'Zharon
location.description: This huge statue seems to ooze black fog. If you stand too close the four empyrean heads that surround it cast Whirling Blade III at you. Says its a magic trap. -- Elphin

location.name: Stone Marker
location.description: A blank stone marker on a snowy hill surrounded by 3 Ice Golems. Greater/Snowy/White Mattekars are in the immediate area. -- Khaos

location.name: Lake Pillar
location.description:
Pillar in a lake guarded by 2 Water Golems and 1 Granite Golem. 2 chests are submerged next to pillar
spawn poor loot. -- Khaos

location.name: Pyramid Shaped Colunms
location.description:
2 Pyramid Shaped Columns in the water
one is knocked over. -- Khaos

location.name: Path up
location.description:
Path up the cliffs into the highlands, part of Rochesters Way from Zaikhal to Stonehold. -- Doc Feelgood
This is the west end of Angiels Face. -- Doc Feelgood 9/30/2001

location.name: Plateau Village to Base
location.description: Portal off the mountain. Exits at 45.3N, 44.3W. -- Polecat

location.name: Base of Mt. Alphus
location.description: Exit: Base of Mt. Alphus (19.6N, 17.0E) -- Dunc

location.name: Cragstone Shadow Spire Piece
location.description: Another piece of the destroyed Shadow Spire lies in a small crater here. -- Wylandt

location.name: Empyrean Shrine
location.description: A shrine similar to the structure south of Eastham. This one has crystals growing within the triple arch. -- Ravic

location.name: Paul & Babe
location.description:
....has to be seen to be beleived. -- Jaiph Windlass
The Title should speak for itself have a look up north and see the tremendous monouga Paul and his buddy the baby blue auroch. No joke! -- Goshen
Paul Bunyon and Babe the Ox.. lol turbine outdid themselves -- Tabero 9/13/2000
Wow man this is really cool!You should see the stats on these two I wont spoil it but if we ever have to fight these watch out is all I can say!hehe too bad they are only NPCs for now...we came all the way out here to try and kill them oh well!Almost due north of stonehold... -- Krack + Dralix 9/14/2000
If you want to now how big they are, you can seem em in birds eye view! Nice stop if your going to the frozen Wasteland:) -- Wodrith the Man 9/23/2000

location.name: Ring of Crystals
location.description: Small ring of blue(nexus like) crystals embedded into the ground. One larger crystal at the top of the ring.

location.name: Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone. -- Doktor Megatrip

location.name: Northwest Direlands Portal
location.description:
A yellow portal (level 35+). Exits 5.5N, 87.5W -- Doktor Megatrip
At least this portal seems permant. Was here and its at the correct spot. That was at leafdawning 14th, evensong-and-half -- Immacolata 5/7/2001

location.name: Lich Camp
location.description:
In the middle of nowhere, a Lich has decided to set up a sort of improvised throne room in the middle of a grove in the swamp, with a cohort of zombies (I counted 6). One chest with dull loot. -- Borgun Fistanvl
has been here since beta -- Qalan 9/14/2000

location.name: Crystal Ring
location.description: This is a blue crystal Circle identical to the one at 46.9S, 55.2E. Is this the ring mentioned in the Geomancy Note?!? -- Zenaxe

location.name: Tower and House
location.description: There is a tower here with a small house at its base. I have been unable to find a way up there yet. -- Salmoneus

location.name: Portal Holder
location.description: This is actually an Empyrean Portal holder of the type such as has Mage Academy and others. -- Salmoneus

location.name: Mud Golem Stone
location.description:
4 or 5 Mud Golems lying around a Stone. Be carefull cause they are within range of many other creatures surrouding the area. I am lvl 36 and had to run cause there where so many creatures. Including: Mud Golems, Mosswarts, Gromnies, Undead, Zombies, Sharks. Most of which will attack you if you are near the stone. -- Bin Ibn Tabar
Should be 24.3 *S* 67.3 e -- Ruffian Godsun 9/16/2000

location.name: Menhir Rings
location.description:
Just like the Holtburg Stones. When standing in the middle, mana is restored. -- Samsun and Rasa
Shendolain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here, It spawned Dual Fragments. The Dungeon been removed, only the Menhir Rings are left. 3/2/2001

location.name: Caulnalain Menhir Ring
location.description:
This is one of the new Mehir Rings that came with the Sept. 2000 patch. -- Anonymous
Esper Menhir Ring -- x 9/21/2000
Caulnalain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here, It spawned Fragments. The Dungeon been removed, only the Menhir Rings are left 3/11/2001

location.name: Menhir Ring
location.description:
This is one of the new Mehir Rings that came with the Sept. 2000 patch. -- Anonymous / DT
Fenmalain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here, It spawned Broken Fragments. The Dungeon has been removed, only the Menhir Rings are left. 3/11/2001

location.name: Mehir Ring
location.description:
This is one of the new Mehir Rings that came with the Sept. 2000 patch. -- Anonymous / DT
Took a look.. not sure if its a Menhir ring.. CLOSE.. Ouside ring is familar but the inside ring looks like its for a huge Lifestone. -- Katra 9/20/2000
This one should be called: Menhir Ring with Broken Stones -- XxX 9/21/2000
Linvak Menhir Ring with Broken Stones -- XxX 9/21/2000

location.name: Plateau Lifestone
location.description: Unlike the other lifestone close to Plateau Village, this one is actually up on the plateau. It is not new, surprised no one has entered it in all these months. -- J

location.name: Sclavus Cathedral
location.description:
seems to be a copy of the one in the east dires swamps. Probably added in the july update. -- Llanwy
Entrance and exit are quiet, and summonable and tieable. Foyer is quiet. This is a good staging point for Essence of Verdancy. -- Doc Feelgood 5/19/2002
Layout of the dungeon is medium-size with large rooms. Fun for archers. Populated with sclavi up to Satas (40th). Spawn is slow except in final flood room where it is fast and pure Sata. SIK chest there. If you want to stack Slavi bodies deep looking for skins or other parts, this flood room is a good place to do it. -- Doc Feelgood 11/4/2002

location.name: Stone Formation
location.description:
Stone Formation same as one listed at [82.7N , 21E]as a Mehir Ring. -- Arion Dukat-HG
(SP)Menhir.. Not sure it is one that this quest is looking for.. the one at 67.9S, 40.1E was a false post.. I think it was posted by the same person that did the 82.7N,21E one. *shrugs* -- Arander 9/20/2000
Dont Lie. Those other rings ARE NOT fake, there the Fem. Menhir Rings -- Wodrith the man 9/24/2000 Updated with a Tempest, Stasic, Corrosion and Strife Wisp and a few Enku Zefirs. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Portal Arch
location.description:
An arch like that which covers the portal to Mage Academy. There is no portal in it currently. I wonder if this is a location for one of the August portals. There are 6 ice golems circling it. -- Heysun
With all the things that have changed in this area, this hasnt. The six golems are still here. -- Doc Feelgood 3/1/2002

location.name: Snowman Spawn
location.description:
Not a random spawn, been back here 4 times now. Lvl 8 Snowmen on the top of a hill, get your iceballs and carrots here. -- Typhoid V
I can confirm this. Any one know the spawn tho? I killed both of em, when to get some low ore, came back, and had to wait 20 mins for then to small. To bad there not the regualar snowballs, these ones hurt!:) -- Wodrith the Man 9/23/2000

location.name: Banderling Camp
location.description: This is the camp mentioned in the parchment Banderling Camp Directions and is located inside one of the smaller creater bowls. A small number of banders spawn in this camp including a Banderling Bandit who will spawn at random a Fire Spear, quarter staff of fire, or fire arrows or sometimes nothing. On occasion he will also drop two of these items. The camp respawn rate is 15 minutes. The other banders include youngs, scouts and one captain. A nearby chest usually spawns food. -- Cuttler Strngmd

location.name: Sclavus Cathedral
location.description:
Just NW of the Shipwreck, this is a pretty simple dungeon. What makes this stand out was the Sata Sclavus at the bottom guarding a SIK chest. There were about 25 Satas on a 60 second spawn. No match for a lvl 50 swordsman, lvl 53 mage, and archer. We made short work of them. Alot of fun for the fact of nothing else to do. Btw, only about 2k exp per kill. Its not worth the effort for experience. Oh yea...the SIK chest is a low quality one (lvl 4 enchants and spells). -- dcp-cystemzero
This description is a little dated I think. Check the description for the other Sclavus Cathedral near WaiJhou for a more detailed description. The larger Sclavus drops a hide occasionally that can be made into a snake skin coat - Armor Level 130 with decent protections. The coat is like a breastplate with sleeves so it can be worn with Shreth pants or Amuli. In 1/2 hour I got 3 hides near the bottom. -- Blau (MT) 4/15/2001

location.name: Baishi Portal
location.description: A portal on a peninsula near the sand bars. Oneeye Archar, Silver Citdael, leafcull -- Oneeye, SC

location.name: Sawato Portal
location.description: A portal on a peninsula near the sand bars. Oneeye Archar, Silver Citdael, leafcull -- Oneeye, SC

location.name: Eternal Flame
location.description: An eternal flame, corpse and unlocked chest guarded by 10 Gold Wasps. Chest contained low level junk loot, but I didnt stick around for it to respawn. -- CiphersnowThe Gold wasps have been replaced with high 8 high level drudges, 4 peerless and 4 drudge cabalists. The chest is on a one week timer and spawns high level loot. -- Gelior Drake, Solclaim 9/12/2003

location.name: Caulnalain Menhir Ring
location.description:
Esper Menhir Ring with Missing Stones -- Darktide
Caulnalain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here. It spawned Fragments, but Dungeon been removed only the Menhir Rings are left. 3/11/2001

location.name: Plains Crystal Ring
location.description: Plains Crystal Ring -- XxX

location.name: Sclavus Swamp Crypt
location.description: Contains 4 Se Sclavi. In the crypt there are 2 chests with very bad loot. Also on the floor is a Diamond with NO DESCRIPTION AT ALL (ie - Well-Cut Onyx, etc.). Possibly part of some quest. -- Kimura Shigenar

location.name: Shendolain Dungeon
location.description:
Location of the Shendolain Soul Crystal in the Obsidian Plains. Use Shandolian gate key (duh). Dimond Golems, Dark Revs, Skel Bone nasties, etc. -- Brassyl
The Outside area is very ugly at times, and the enterance drop off is good reprieve, however, if you're level 35, not 36, and try to enter the portal for retreat, you will be horribly disappointed... -- Garfield3d 10/8/2000
The Shendolain Gate Key is used here, yet the Shendolain Crystal is not here. The dungeon isn't really all that hard, but you must have someone camping the switch room for you. One can get to the switch room by following the Right hand wall from the start. Only hard part of this dungeon is a room with 3 plasmas that jump down onto your party. They usually jump down one at a time however, for some odd reason. -- Flamelord of LC 10/14/2000

location.name: Caulnalain Vestibule Vault
location.description:
According to ACTips this is the Caulnalain Vestibule Vault for levels 26-35. Havent been there yet so I have no idea of the monsters. The key to this vault can be found on shadows. -- Rendar
100% true - Starts out with 2 not so big jumps, after the 2nd jump there are pairs of shadows, the textures are even worth the visit alone. -- Richard the B. 9/23/2000
woah boy-I did not like this place.It starts out just Shadows then LTs. Oh and then a panumbri. My party of 4(one archer and 3 meleers) killed the panumbri, then further in met another that killed me and another of my comrades, NOT A FUN PLACE!! -- Dark Stryder 10/2/2000
This place has the eeriest feel Ive ever encountered in AC as yet, nothing compares - not Olthoi dungeons, not anything. Its gruesome and scary and quite wonderful!! :) The key you need for the gate at the end only drop off Shadow Lieutenants, so if you are in this dungeon the Fenmalain key is useless to you. I got to the very end with a party of 4 and I only saw 2 Pans the entire time. We didnt really know the way, but it seemed as the purple portal mist got thicker we were heading in the right direction, and we did indeed find the gate. -- Silvermoon 10/2/2000
Ok, This Place is Sorta Kool, I ran Through it last Night, I tried to solo it but Didnt get too far due to the Magic Happy Shadows, I went with me, and Archer, and a Mage, ended up meeting 5 more at the entrance, and 3 on the way there making the place WAY too easy, Umm, You go through a Buncha Shadows, then a Couple LTs, a Couple Pans, A Couple of shadows that are Labeled Caulnalian Guardians or something, not Sure what they could be, I was able to Hit them Grat with Axe mastry 4 on, But when it dropped I couldnt hit them with my 235 Base, so whatever they would be, You Put yer Key in the Gate and It Gives you a Portol Gem,, I think that you Could LS recall, and Re-Stock or get level 6 buffs from someone or what not Because I think you can Use the Gem that takes you to the Second Part of the Dungion NP, I think the Hardest Part was Jumping into the Pi with a Buncha shadows in it, Just Because most everyone was afraid they would be the only ones to Jump and Would Die, besides me and a COuple others who did Jump, I think that my Party would have Made it but it would have been Hard, If you are Going in a Small Party Be sure to Bring a Mage as a LOT of them could Just as Easily Be Drained, at the end of the Dungion there was the Cauln Crystal which I averaged about 15 - 25 Per Swing on, I usually got like 6 swings whatever that means in a Big Party, there were 2 r 3 other Crystals that Spawned there, Not Sure of the Names but they were also Easy, I would say that the only troubles that I had Was the Caulanian Shadows when my Buffs Dropped, I got the Shield, SL 140, Like 1300 Burden, +10 to Health 15 or 20 to stanima I forget, Invuln 4, Cant be casted on, its Kool Looking but about worthless lol, I ran there from Holtburg, was a Very Short Easy Run, was able to Avoid Mountains until about that last 2 Clicks, Just be Careful in there, A Melle Mage Might have a Chance Soloing the Place, and a Good Melle Would have slim to none, the shadows woud have to keep magic at a Minimum, Kool Scenery, a Fun Place -- Crystal Knight 11/1/2000
New level restrictions: 26-40. -- Path 12/21/2000
Geez! I wish People would take some time when writing their notes. The one above sounds like it was written by someone on drugs. Get it together Knight! -- Artek 1/18/2001
Jump thru the portal at full power, when you exit the other side you will land on a ledge, the vault will be right infront of you, may be 1 or 2 shadows near the vault, just grab your key and recall. Best to run here from crater. -- BuffDaddy -MT 8/27/2001
The upper level limit for this quest has been removed. -- Kovich of TD 5/17/2003

location.name: Lugian lakeside Camp and Chest
location.description: Three Obeloth Lugians camped out and guarding a chest. Chest had little of interest (a few ps, food, Good healing kit, etc) -- Dunc

location.name: Water Golem Shrine
location.description: A pillar surrounded by several water golems -- Fr3nsyc

location.name: Lake Watched by Statues
location.description: A small lake between Holtburg and Crater, the east and west edges are overlooked by abstract statues of people (like those at Festival sites) facing each other. A water wisp spawns in the middle of the mushroom ring next to the eastern statue. Hunting around here is a woodland mix, including tuskers mixed in with the hunter shreth. -- Red and Gold

location.name: Plateau Portal
location.description: Shortcut to Plateau, Brings you at the plateua village. 44.0N, 43.5W -- Yobe the Mage

location.name: Top of Mt. Zabool to Top of Mt. Alphus
location.description: Drops out at 19.7N, 17.8E -- Larce Mantoll

location.name: Small Blackmire Temple
location.description: Small temple structure in the swamp, inhabited by a shaman and some mudlurks. If you fight inside the temple expect lots of helpers to come in from the surrounding mire. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up
location.description:
Path at the head of a canyon from the lowland forest to the North Mountain Plateau. -- Doc Feelgood
This is the east end of Angiels Face. -- Doc Feelgood 9/30/2001

location.name: Xarabydun
location.description: Underground town with a unique open landscape dungeon feel. Full of shops and NPCs. Locked door (diff 82) seperates you from a couple of quest dungeons at the bottom with Crystal Nodules needed for the Impulse gems.

location.name: The Floating City (Primary)
location.description:
Ive replaced the lots of speculation with a dissertation done by Dereths leading Floating City Expert. Ladies and Gentlemen, without further ado I present you the savant Tyr on HG
-- Immacolata 7/20/2003
Yes this is a random dungeon, yes there are allready a billion and one entries for it (edit: no more, cleaned out a kajillion of those, thanks to Doc Feelgood), yes I am apolagising for entering another one, but I tried several times to add to the Floating City (Primary) thread and managed only to put in one line... so here is what I was trying to say, assuming this adds itself. There is far too much speculation and rumour on this thread, so, since I know virtually everything there is to know about the city, let me set a few things straight. Firstly, portals may now be tied and recalled to, they cant be summoned but if you see one on the landscape, tie to it, and camp it for any friends who may want to tie too (random portals only disapear when the landblock resets, so if your watching the portal it wont go anywhere). Secondly, there is no pattern to the portals appearing, they are RANDOM! Thirdly, multiple portals can spawn on the surface, the city is broken up into 8 different landblocks (7 called The Floating City, and one The Golem Sanctum), and I think all of them can be created as random landscape portals. I think the golem sanctum only spawns in the dires but I cant confirm that). Thus all these reports saying when you enter go this way are useless because it all depends on which part of the city you have entered.
