Now, when you enter the city, your first step is to do a /loc and work out which landblock your in, then before jumping off anything or going through any portals, check ACMaps.com which has maps of the city (done by yours truely). So far Ive only done 6, Im waiting on the random portals to take me back to the final two landblocks. That raises another point, many of the portals between the different parts of the city are random as well, which is why you should tie to the first one you found, as you may not be able to get back to explore more. Inside the city, all exit portals, and lots of the internal portals (all helpfully called just The Floating City) are random, but unlike random portals on the surface, they are allways in the same place, but every month (on patch day) they change their destination. On the maps I have made all portals are identified as either stable or random, stable portals all have a return portal next to them to facilitate two way travel. Lockpicking is not required, but does make a little more of the city accessible, it is I believe posible to get everywhere by random portals but random portals are of course random. The toughest door is resistance 322, and worth picking if you can because it leads on to a stable portal to another section. There are what apears to be two significant points of interest in the city, one is the golem sanctum, an absolute labyrinth of tightly twisting passages and more junctions than I can count, all filled with Iron golems, and at the end one obsidian with a dispell trap and a chest of crap loot. The other point of interest is something everyone should see at least once in their life, a floating advocate tower in the direlands (3.7S / 69.2W), about as high above the ground as the tou-tou lighthouse is tall, and with a bright pink energy fountain inside it. On top is a random portal to the direlands somewhere. At the begining of the Golem Sanctum is a stable portal back to the city, and a random direlands portal, I have seen these portals go to North Direlands Valley Junction, and my old favorite hunting ground North Direlands Land Bridge. During this months patch I also found a portal whos name and location I didnt write down, but the drop was so hot I died before I materialised. Shortly after that they did a server rollback and the portal changed again. Within the city you will find a number of Strained Books, which cannot be picked up but give you some interesting lore about the place, and some interesting insights into the Empyrians past. In all I would say this whole place is priety much a place only to come if you like exploring and lore, the monsters inside are for the most part, low level undead and a few banderlings, there are 2 virindi servants, and 2 revanants, and thats about it for the high level monsters. However, it does make a wonderful alternative to the Abandoned Mines as a subway, because while the portals change every month, there are a lot of exit portals and they drop you in often rare towns like Kara. A few non town portals spawn, but rarely, and all Ive noticed is Heartland which has to be one of the most common random portals (and the most boring). Anyways, Im begining to ramble on without really saying much, so I will just say that the floating city is a great place to visit, and a nice place to tie to and use as a subway (incidentally the exit portals can be tied to and summoned, so when you find a Kara portal, take a copy of it for your guild, its a nice quiet town that sells level 6 scrolls for those rich enough to afford them). Should anyone be interested in learning more, go take a look at ACMaps.coms maps and post a message on this thread, I look at it occasionally, alternatively if your on harvestgain, just tie to the city and use it to get arround, Im sure well bump into each other there (tho its never happened yet, portals in are VERY rare). -- Tyr on HG 12/3/2002

location.name: Lightless Tunnels (Xarabydun)
location.description: This dungeon is located at the bottom of the Uninhabited Area Portal found in the Xarabydun sewers. It is 1-25 restricted and cannot be Recalled, Tied, or Summoned. It is also the place where the Crystal Nodules for the Gem of Impulse are. You can pick up as many Crystal Nodules as you want, but there is a 1 week turn in timer. They are givable. There is also a Mid Direlands Portal at the bottom of a 40 damage pit (with Bludge pro 7 and 110 jump) It is Tieable and Summonable, restricted to 18+. This exits at 37.1S, 65.9W and is actually the Valley of Death hot drop, which is very hazardous for any lowbie that goes in. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Linvak Tukal Castle
location.description:
Im not quite sure what is inside this place yet since i haven't found a way in. Its located up on a mountian near Serac Vault and is surrounded by Lugians. The lugians near here seem to be new with the october update, at least their names are different. These lugians are called raiders and I've seen every lugian type except Laigus here, even Extas and Tiatus raiders. They all seem to be using hollow weapons like the lugians in the ore mines. -- Jandrel
Couldn't get in either :\ oh well.. easy to find tiatus are sweet. -- Mengar -LC 10/11/2000
These Raider-caste Lugians are very mage NON-friendly. With a 230 skill and rank V's, I couldn't affect the lvl 29 raiders, let alone the 108's and 178's. They are either EXTREMELY resistant to magic, or completely immune. Melee-type people have it a bit easier here though, and a mage is still useful in a (sigh) support role. Extas are 8 k, Tiatus are 15k. And yes, it's a beautfiul, yet bizarre structure. -- N'Sciira deGris 10/15/2000
this is a tower i saw that was not on ac explorer and though there was an entrance to but as i could not figure the entrance to this castle out i decided to post it to see if anyone else could find the entrance. there are various luggies on the outskerts with the name of raiders, such as litthos raider, gigas raider, and even taitas raiders. -- Darkmessenger 10/17/2000
The ""raider"" Lugian variants around this Castle are weilding hollow-equivilent weapons. Mages beware. -- Kystanto 10/26/2000
This is truly a wonderful sight, but I see no way in. I also saw no high level Luggies in over an hour of hunting there. Where are the Extas and Titas Luggies??? Highest level thing was a Lythos Raider. -- Shoku Kang 1/3/2001
Someone mentioned this place will be populated in the feburary patch. Another comment was made that the size of the fortress is the largest the game engine will allow. -- prok 1/10/2001

location.name: Twin Statues
location.description: 2 Statues watching the lake below, nothing much else to see. -- Vengeance (DT)

location.name: Banderlings "Temple"
location.description:
Some kind of Temple with Banderlings -- Bui Chon-po
Not really worth the trip. Just 3 or 4 Young Banderlings & a Banderling Scout. -- Oshun 11/27/2000

location.name: Mosswart Maze
location.description:
Second part in the new October midlevel lost explorer quest. no level rest. Mostly mosswarts including many shaman and a chief. 4 chests, 1 locked. The banderling ceremonial mace head is here guarded by 2 Goldenback Tuskers. Also the second journal of the missing explorer is here. clues point ever on westward. both head and book are the first east/right passage as you come in. then first right for book, or straight and stay left follow the glow for the head. Entry room is not safe and the only 2 surface portals exist here. Nice layout, fun traps and maze feel. -- Senshin -MT
Actually, it is 2 Goldenback Tuskers that guard the mace head at the end. Also, the exit is not in the entry room, but if you head left and stay left for a ways you get to a surface portal. There is another surface portal down off a long side passage by the tuskers. -- J 10/13/2000
If you are looking for the second part of the ceremonial mace (the haft), its in the Banderling Conquest Dungeon (29S,50.5E) -- Monkey3 2/4/2001
Also, theres a locked chest in here. When you enter the dungeon, just go straight. The passage goes into a spiral (right turns), and ends with a locked chest. I didnt have lockpick, so I have no clue whats in it. -- Obsidianblade 4/7/2001

location.name: North end of W's Face
location.description: North end of unclimable NW-SE cliff in North Mountains. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: South end of W's Face
location.description: South end of NW-SE unclimable cliff in North Mountains. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Washington's Face
location.description: An unclimbable cliff stretching from 79.2N, 6.6W to 84.7N, 10.6W -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Stone Obelisk
location.description: Stone Obelisk with lone Skeleton Guard -- Habidakus

location.name: Sotiris Dungeon
location.description: The portal in is tieable, summonable. The exit portal is tieable, not summonable. Entrance and exit are hot with Obsidian Plains fauna, the foyer is quiet. Its a good portal pop hunting place. The dungeon layout is Lugian citadel-style and has a lot of symmetry. The big corridors and simple layout mean that monsters can come in from miles around, and the fighting tends to be clumpy -- big swarm, then nothing. Spawn rate is modest. Soltiris Hollows are 55th level and drop decent loot. -- Doc Feelgood 11/2/2002

location.name: Tower
location.description: A tower with a locked door and no switch cant be picked........ cool place for a newbie archer ls near it. -- Solarfire

location.name: Mayoi Mountain
location.description: This mountain spawns decent mid level creatures, good for leveling from around 15th level to 20th level. Expect to find White and Snowy Matties, Lugians, Spiny and Bronze dillos and some low level grommies. Respawn is decent for a single hunter. Occasionally, shadows will spawn up here, and I have seen up to Shadow lts. -- Lynn deLeslie

location.name: Neydisa Lifestone
location.description:
Lifestone is inside the courtyard of Neydisa Castle. -- Chiun Zen
(Amazing this has never been added to the database) -- Chiun Zen 10/22/2000

location.name: Archery Fextival Grounds
location.description:
This is an archery Festival grounds. Oak and straw target drudges, two tents with a bowyer and farmer, and various other interesting features. It looks almost like a shooting gallery. Quite interesting. I can see contests and fairs set up here
it would be perfect! -- Penne al-Dente

location.name: Banderling Camp
location.description:
Banderling Training Camp - Lots of mosswarts and banderlings, including a banderling captain. The respawn is really quick -- Lan Mar 11/1/2000
This is one of those monster training camps, as the Banderling Captain drops the note from his General. Population at this one includes up to a dozen Mudlurk Mosswarts, up to a dozen Barker Mosswarts, two Shamans, a Chief, and the Banderling Captain. The spawns for Mudlurks and Barkers is 30 seconds--insanely fast. Spawn time on the others is two minutes. If youre an archer, bring fire arrows and run like hell
if youre melee, bring friends and stam potions. Good place for mask heads and brown beans, though. -- Arisana (SC) 11/4/2000

location.name: Floating Spire
location.description:
This place has also been called the flosting power generator, the entrance to this place can be found int the floating city. As I found the place by accident, and many of the portals in the city move as well as the ones leading to it I can give no accurate directions, other than to say that I passed a portal guarded by several lichs and a revenant to get to the portal leading inside. Ill be giveing pictures taken to my guild on solclaim which can be reached at www.valour.acsage.com And to give credit where it is do I was asked by Epsilon Alpha to list his name here as well since he was with me when we entered. The tower is empty but has some interesting scense inside, worth a visit but not a return. -- Corus Firebrand
The tower was not empty when I when there, ...it had a Direlands Desert NE Portal in it with the drop point of 82.1S, 59.0W...which coincidentally also is close to another portal, the South Landbridge Portal (drop: 83.3S, 19.2W) at 81.9S, 59.0W. -- Sword of Truth 12/11/2000
I confirm that the entry to the final section of the floating city is a portal in the Revenants bedroom closet. The Portal in the spire dumped out at Northeast Dires junction when we visited (2.3N, 65.2W). -- Doc Feelgood 2/2/2002

location.name: Valley Junction Portal
location.description: Exit at 2.6N, 65.1W at the valley junction east of Teth. Maybe one of this random portals? Level 25+ only. Be ready to run as soon as you hit the ground... guess why... -- Kara Gandharvi

location.name: Mattekar Lair to Bandit Castle Portal
location.description: Portal to Bandit Castle located on lower level of Mattekar Caves where the Ice Golems Spawn, drops out around 66.3N, 50.7E -- Milrace

location.name: Kryst
location.description:
New city of Kryst, on the far south east islands. -- Hyawatha Khan
Are there even shopkeepers here? -- Señor 11/14/2000
Neat little town, despite having some of the cooler surroundings of the towns in the game. Occasionally the odd swamp rat/mudlurk mosswart pops into town, particularly to the mage shop (which is just a bit west from the main town). Most of the dealers will buy at > than the value of items, and the mage sells peas (the tool is 72k there, however). -- Ruiner-Eraser 11/15/2000
The mage wears a purple faran, different color than the master robes. Also, dont sell anything to the weaponshop, bowyer pays around 50% more. Has an Ivory Crafter/Leather Crafter. -- mengar 11/15/2000
Vanten (Archmage) - Sell:110% Buy:180% Brita (Barkeep) - Sell:100% Buy:150% Kamira (Grocer) - Sell:80% Buy:160% Sharon (Bowyer) - Sell:130% Buy:160% Imad (Jeweller) - Sell:110% Buy:160% Illic (Weaponsmith) - Sell:90% Buy:170% Padira (Armorer) - Sell:100% Buy:160% Sanami (Healer) - Sell:110% Buy:130% Natalie (Scribe) - Sell:100% Buy:150% Sanami the Healer sells potion spell components as well. Cheaper than the archmage. -- Jadok al-Siran 11/25/2000

location.name: Large Span Bridge
location.description: Big Bamboo Bridge with Diamond and Obsidian golems -- Yobe the Mage

location.name: Floating Advocate tower
location.description: Floating Advocate Tower -- Yobe the Mage

location.name: Adja's Memorial
location.description:
NPK Alter on SW island. -- Yobe the Mage
Bad Coords, should be 82.3S, 93.3E -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002
Fixed! -- Immacolata 05/16/2003

location.name: Treacherous Tunnels
location.description:
Forsaken Portal inside. Lots of tentacles and moarsmen. -- Po
Look for a hidden lever to open the first locked door -- its disguised as a plant. After that, if you bear right you get slithis and low level moarsmen
if you bear left, you get sulthis and high level moarsmen and a portal which will take you further into the islands. Be careful not to mistake the high level stuff for low level stuff. It is possible to run past the sulthis tentacles easily, but be ready to deal with the putrid moarsmen beyond. -- Red and Gold 11/21/2000

location.name: Rumuba's Hidey-Hole
location.description:
No level restrictions -- Yobe the Mage
The mosswart NPC inside makes what you need for the spear quest, and there is a section for lockpickers only (not needed for the quest). Fun change from spellcasters but at this time on Leafcull there are 30 people wandering through the dungeon. -- mengar 11/14/2000
This place has a uber chest in it that spawns weapons, gems, armor, and cloths. Only race restriction I saw was gharundim. Uber loot is of medium qualtity. -- Rendar 11/15/2000
Entrance is clear, foyer is clear. Top looks like a small ""Q""-shaped place if you miss the corridor heading down. Lower level is big and meandering. Fanatics and idolators up top, zealots below. At least one locked door. -- Doc Feelgood 11/19/2000
The Uber-Chest is behind a locked door which you need to pick. It is guarded by a few Zealots and a Soul-Trapper. Made 3 pulls off the chest and all of it was expensive but sellable crap. 4 floors to the entire place, mostly Fanatics and Idolators until you hit the 4th floor. The bottom end is anti-climatic, nothing but a dead-end. -- Garfield3d 11/24/2000

location.name: Moarsmen Muck
location.description: Top contains several Rank Moarsmen. Go further in and youll get to a bit with a whole slew of Foul Moarsmen and a Putrid Moarsman (level 72), as well as a Jungle Phyntos Wasp. Even farther in are several more Putrids and Foul Moarsmen. Bring acid, fire, and lightning protection, and bring a bunch of melee friends and stamina elixirs. Use of a shield is highly recommended. A very ambitious dungeon for the level restrict. -- Accident 7/7/2002

location.name: Nearest Kryst Lifestone
location.description: This is the nearest lifestone to Kryst that I've seen. Located very close to an crumbling tower that makes an excellent perch of mages or archers. Those Jungle Wasps are 5K a pop and not very resistant to magic! -- Sixfingers

location.name: Northeastern Lifestone
location.description: If you like battle Moarsmen, this is the lifestone for you-- located spitting distance from the (shudder) Moarsmen Laboratory! -- Sixfingers

location.name: A Small Ruin (Island)
location.description:
This place resembles a component from the Empyrean Power Plant. I was playing a 17th level mages and I was alone, so I didnt chance it. -- Sixfingers
Gone down a few levels so far - lots of level 60 sclavi - throwing lvl 5 war spells. Site is guarded by 2 Cursed Wisps (lvl 89) -- Quixis Blight 11/16/2000
Deeper: Ulu Sclavus (60), Faisi Sclavus (74), Slithayr Tendrils/Tentacles/Eye Stalks, Liches, Lich Lords. Didnt find anything of interest beyond that. -- Kelyn Blackwolf 11/19/2000
Entrance is hot with wisps, foyer is quiet. You have to jump down and run through a big Ulu Sclavi-infested room to get to nearest exit portal. Upper levels can be wall worked. -- Doc Feelgood 12/31/2000
This ruin isnt very small. -- Keef the Thief 1/8/2001
Yes its actually quite small, its not even truly 9 rooms. Its only 3 floors, and there are less than 50 creatures total, respawns are about 3-4 mins though, so it can seem large. (also note this is a duplicate entry, I entered all this months ago. READ people) -- Shal 1/13/2001

location.name: Moars Laboratory
location.description: A few Level 75 and 47 Moarsmen and a few mossies, a rabbit in a huge cage. This was all I found. Very nice looking place, have to jump down to go thru (25 hp jump) -- Blacthorn 11/15/2000

location.name: Yanshi Portal
location.description: Between Al-Arqas and the Desert Mage. The portal is underground in a crypt structure amid a field of cacti. There are dead bodies in the crypt also. Destination: 12.6S, 47.5E. -- Akem ali-bon New exit coords: 10.7S, 46.5E (was 12.6S, 47.5E) -- Dutton 7/11/2004

location.name: Idol Spawning Grounds
location.description: Entrance is hot, dungeon foyer is hot, come in prepared for a fight. Top is winding and filled with idols, fanatics, idoltors, a few zealots and a dread idol or two. Lower down the dungeon wall pattern *is* wild -- flashback to the sixties. -- Doc Feelgood 11/19/2000

location.name: Moarsmen Hideout
location.description: Entrance is clear, foyer is clear. Have to jump to get from foyer into rest of dungeon... some lever pulling. Lots of rank moarsmen behind doors, on the upper level, so it's one of the few good ""wall working"" places on the isles. -- Doc Feelgood 11/20/2000

location.name: Slithis Pit
location.description: Lots of Slitharyr Tendrils, tentacles, and Eye Stacks. Need to jump down from first lvl to get any where.

location.name: A Small Temple
location.description: A VERY small temple, Ulu Sclavus (lvl 60), Slithis, chest with lame loot that does not require key. -- Ardak Eaglehear

location.name: MacNiall's Freehold
location.description:
Interesting back-story for this town. (in relation to Kryst, and Bandit Castle...) Quite dangerous, as high level baddies seem to stroll right into town frequently... Side note:Bowyer sells Armor Piercing, Regular, Frog Crotch, and Blunt Arrowheads, as well as bolts and arrow shafts., and Archmage sells Tapers, as well as Gold and Pyreal Scarabs... Majiya Bint Branith, HG -- Majiya bint Bra
Expensive shops and they dont give near what Teth/Ayan Bakur do, some starter towns pay better. -- mengar 11/14/2000
Arrgh, me hearties, a wickeder pirate town is hard to find. These merchants will skin ye coming and going. But the mage does offer shiney gold and pyreal, and shell service ye with dispell magics should ye have the need. -- Doc Feelgood 11/20/2000
This town along with the vesayen isles themselves can now be seen in your user friendly in game map thanks to the new December 2000 patch. -- Archbow 12/12/2000

This is the starting pt for the January Bandit Castle handle quest. Give MacNial a idol gem and he will give u letter to his cousin in bandit caslte. -- Saint Thomas 1/9/2001

location.name: Moars
location.description:
I didnt spend much time inside but guess what I found.... Sometimes the name says a lot. -- Shoyu Suru
This appears to be a dungeon of little point, the end part with 3 putrid moarsmen appears to be it - however this room is very tomb Raider in design, Id like to see where somebody with a high jump skill can get to - there are other monsters in here that cant seem to be got to. Contains 3 lvls or moars - (the easy ones), rank and putrid, plus there are shallows destroyers, jungle wasps, and a water golem (????)! -- Typhoid V 11/16/2000

location.name: Eastham Beach Portal
location.description: Portal on beach on Kryst Island. -- Adra Mar Sula

location.name: Moarsmen Spawning Grounds
location.description:
No level restrictions. Found with Stranyr Al-Qroni -- Ardak Eaglehear
Full of mossies???? Lots of low lvl mossies, mostly mudlurks, lame dungeon, except for looks. -- Stranyr Al-Qron 11/14/2000
If you make a left instead of a right near the end, you run into a Clinger. Kill it then continue down 2 spiral staircases and you find Dark Revanants and a room with a pit with moarsmen inside. this room has many exits..I had to leave since I was alone -- Darcphenix 1/9/2001

location.name: Empyrean Magical Defense Battery
location.description: -- Ardak Eaglehear

location.name: Mud Cave
location.description:
Tough little dungeon for 3 mid-20s players. On top were Shallows Destroyers, Island Dillos, and a Jungle Phyntos Wasp. We didnt go further, because they were too tough for us. -- Adra Mar Sula
Can you say OUCH? The abover poster is correct on the creatures Id seen so far. A Destroyer is waiting in first corridor while 2 island dillos and the wasp are in the open room the hall leads to. Just like the above poster I didnt go any farther, 15 vitae in about 10 min on a lvl 28 life/war/creature/ua changed my mind :P -- Rendar 11/15/2000
Levels 10-30 only. In my opinion, the level restriction is very low considering whats inside, and considering whats on the island where this dungeon resides. You go from Mosswart Shamans on the island to suddenly being greeted by Island Dillos (lvl 38) Jungle Phyntos wasps (lvl 65) Shallows Destroyers (lvl 37?) and Shallows Devourer (lvl 50-some). I would recommend a group of at least 6 to 8 decked out level 25-30 people to even attempt this dungeon. Be ready for some serious tanking. The dillos and destroyers are immensely painful. I went in here with 3 lvl 26+ Melees and we got wasted hard, I ended up with 15% vitae Personally, I feel this level restrict needs to be fixed. On the other hand, the exit portal is a great place to tie to if you are levels 10-30. its close to the lifestone as well as the new city -- Jadok al-Siran 11/15/2000
I got a wee bit further in (just past the wasp) and ran smack into a ghost wisp. barely made it out alive after that with dillos spawning in front of my escape. -- knockturn 11/18/2000
Ugh.. Finally got to the end of this surprisingly small cave. After the Wasp, there is 1 island dillo, then 3-4 destroyers going straight followed by a brutal devoueror. TO the right was a wisp, and maybe another dillo. Both paths end a short way from the fork. Big thanks to Shemsu, and Zyrel on Frostfell for helping me finish exploring this place. -- Adra Mar Sula 1/18/2001
Today I soloed the place in 10 minutes as level 29. High melee defense helps a lot in here. Beautiful but disappointingly small. -- Immacolata 3/22/2001

location.name: Small Temple
location.description:
-- Ardak Eaglehear
Has 2 SIK chests, both had garbage when I tried them. Dungeon contained Sclavas and Revnants -- Fenrus (MT) 11/15/2000
Entrance is guarded by Sclavi, including one who blocks the doorway. Exit is hot with same sclavi. Dungeon is a single room filled with Slavi, undead and a tenticle. Foyer is modestly hot. I found two chests, one was SIK the other was open. Entrance and exit are recallable, but not summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 12/16/2002

location.name: Vesayen Isles Portal
location.description:
To 72.5S, 81.3E South of Bandit Castle -- Vixx (HG)
There are NO Level restrictions on this Portal BTW. There is a Portal back to Eastham just up the Beach on the Exit side of this Portal also. -- Stern [LC] 11/15/2000

location.name: Mayoi Beach Portal
location.description:
Found on a run of the islands Exits at 60.8S, 82.8E -- HawkofStonehold
Changed portol to portal in name. --Geomancer 8/16/2004

location.name: Floating Advocate Tower
location.description:
Floating advocate tower (open type of dungeon), lots of dark revs (nothing I conned was lower than lvl 111), probable entrance to this place is at the portal that is by town on big island (portal loc is 83.1S, 93.2E, HEAVY concentration of undead, bring BIG group). -- Kylos
Confirmed the entrance portal is Perimeter Portal. -- Fenrus 11/15/2000
Just to clarify: the majority of the higher undead are not in the Advocate Tower, but in a nearby castle. Dark Leeches, Dark Magus, False Dark Revs, Revenants, Skeleton Lords, and Scalvi too. -- Oceanus 11/17/2000
The Perimeter Portal near Santuary has been removed, so there is no longer a way to enter this tower (that I know of). Also the portal to Chalicmere that was inside seems to have been removed. -- Firilisun 12/14/2000

location.name: Tent camp
location.description:
Desserted town on big island (nov patch), BIG concentration of undead, slavius and putrid hoarsemen, got portal that might lead to floating advocate tower (also found on same island). -- Kylos
Hardly a town, more a small tent camp guarding the approach to Ithaenc Cathedral. These days I only see a couple of high level Bones in the camp. -- Immacolata 5/1/2001

location.name: Bridge
location.description: A bamboo type bridge linking the two islands together. -- Vengeance -DT

location.name: Bridge
location.description: Bridge connecting the islands -- Gyco of FF

location.name: Tower
location.description:
A tower surounded by Mosswarts (Idolator, Shaman), Jungle Wasps and Island Armoredillos. -- Vengeance (DT)
Bring your lightning protection. -- Spam Scud 12/14/2000
A good wall working spot. Jungle Wasps gen at a modest pace on top and inside the tower, but they tend to fall off and end up buzzing around the bottom. The wasps have low magic resistance so they are fine stock for an aspiring life mage who has high-level backup. -- Doc Feelgood 4/27/2001

location.name: Ithaenc Cathedral
location.description:
Very nice looking Cathedral, invisible(on radar) level 153 Dark Rev, very tough, Kelderams Tomb, Adjas Memorial (npk). -- Ardak Eaglehear
This is the firthest point in the New Island chain. It is on top of a large mountain that has waterfalls coming off of it. Undead camp on the way up the mountain to the Cathedral. Lots of nasties, Diamond Golems, Skeleton Bone Lords/Knights, Mourseman, and all those. Fairly difficult but I managed to make it to the Cathedral at lvl 35....just ran...didnt stop at all! This is am amazing site to see, the trip is well worth it. Note: there is no LS close to this so be careful! -- Chogall - FF 11/15/2000
Abondon castle by town on big island (nov Patch), top most floor got a eirie cathedral music with chest off unknow difficulty, basement got a cript, with a altar to turn pk into non-pk. This castle is a archers and mages perch paradize! -- Kylos 11/15/2000
The name of the place is Ithaenc Cathedral and the spell Recall the Sanctuary takes you right into the middle of the Cathedral, a safe spot these days - no high level Undead camping here. Its a wonderful staging point for forays into the western part of the island. Run to the tent camp south of here to find a ramp down. -- Immacolata 5/1/2001
Staging point for Dark Magus / Leech hunting
also Catacombs of Ithaenc quest starts here [Healers Heart / Recall Scroll ]. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

location.name: Jungle Shadows (aka New Subway)
location.description: Full of shadows and portal hub at bottom

location.name: Jungle Shadows to South Dires (level 12+)
location.description: Exits 84.2S, 34.4W -- Shoyu Suru

location.name: Mosswart Nest
location.description:
A small winding dungeon filled with newer, tougher, religous fantatic mosswarts, 35-45 levels. Entrance is clear, but monsters are nearby, foyer is clear. Tieable, no level restrictions. -- Doc Feelgood
This place has been in the data base for 24 hours! Please check before you enter your finds. -- Stop the Spam 11/16/2000
Correction: the entrance can be hot. -- Doc Feelgood 11/22/2000

location.name: Mosswart Hideout
location.description:
Right near MacNialls Freehold. Swarming Mosswart Idolators, Zealots, and Soul Trappers, Shadows (small children to Lts), a room with kneeling small chadow children in a circle, and at the bottom a Harrower Greivver, a couple Goldenback Tuskers, drudge raveners, and one Sotiris HollowMinion standing over a large bloodstain with Sir Martines Journal (excellent lore, btw). Creepy dungeon. -- Kerrara
The entrance can be hell - you can be gangbanged by 10-15+ mossies here - not too bad if theres no Zealots among them but those guys musthave been going to the same armorer as the bone lords cos those fire swords reaaaaly hurt :). Bring LOTS of stamina potions. -- Typhoid V 11/16/2000
Entrance is hot, foyer is *very* hot with fast-gen fanatics and idolators. Zealots get dragged into the foyer by fleeing heros (sorry, fast advancing backwards heros) -- Doc Feelgood 11/20/2000
Okay, this is the place for the Virindi Essense, which is a necessary part of the Singularity Weapon Quest. You need to use a Sturdy Iron Key on the chest in the Sotiris Hollow Minion room. Take the essence and leave. =) Nothing else is here unless you WANT to waste your time with some weak shadows. =) -- Gynax 7/5/2001 The thick spawn of Soultrappers makes this a fine place to hunt for Life Magic Ruined Amulets (for Sunstone Gauntlets). The other mossies here drop Ruined Amulets for War, Item and Creature, as well. -- Doc Feelgood 1/21/2004

location.name: Auroch Feeding
location.description: 2 Auroch Yearling, 2 Auroch Cow

location.name: The Lee Side Of The Mountain
Lighthouse
location.description: This is the right Coords! -- Ricko(MT)

location.name: Fallen advocater tower
location.description:
Is a fallen advocater tower, with 2 island wasps inside, and one outside. You need 225 jump to get inside the tower. Chest found inside, need lockpick skill to open it. Loot regular -- Okupa
The wasps guarding this tower are Jungle Wasps, actually. The chest inside is no longer locked, but produces low-quality weaponry loot. -- Confucius of FF 6/29/2002

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Plateu Portal
location.description: Destination location 4.5N, 43.1W -- Okupas Clan

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Glenden Wood Subway
location.description: Exits at 28.9n, 26.3E -- Okupas Clan

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Zaikhal Subway
location.description: Exits at 14.3N, 1.3E -- Kylos n Okupa

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Tufa Subway
location.description: Exits at 13.9S, 5.4E -- Kylos & Okupa

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Neydisa Castle Subway
location.description: Exits at 69.5N, 17.9E -- Kylos & Okupa

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Baishi Subway
location.description: Exits at 49.3S, 62.9E -- Kylos & Okupa

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Eastham subway
location.description: Exits at 17.8N, 64.3E -- Kylos & Okupa

location.name: Jungle Shadows to Hebian-To Subway
location.description: Exit 38.6S, 82.1E -- Kylos & Okupa

location.name: JUngle Shadows to N. Direlands
location.description: Level restriction of 12+, exits at 24.4N, 53.8W -- Kylos & Okupa

location.name: Skeleton Tent
location.description: Desert tent with 4 skeletons in it. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Scenic View
location.description:
The most beautiful view in all the lands. The cathedral overlooks a fallen advocate tower, a floating advocate tower, and spectacular 3 level waterfall. After standing here for about 15 minutes, the message You need to find the key first. appeared. No idea what it means. -- Cyphersnow
That message still shows up once and in a while. I wonder what it refers to - the Mistress Chest perhaps? Anyway, this place has a sculptured guardian stone looking west, and there are nearby benches one can sit on to enjoy the view over the waterfall and Ithaenc Cathedral. -- Immacolata 5/1/2001
There is a PK altar down stears. The need to find key message is shown when someone doubble clik the altar - without a key -- Loke 8/27/2002
please note that none of the comments about messages and altars has anything to do with this view point. Its just a nice view point. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

location.name: Key Gorge
location.description:
A huge key shaped gorge with a group of undead at the center. No special loot or messages appeared when I killed them, no other items in the gorge. -- Cyphersnow
When we went in the gorge spawn was cuomo sclavi, the highest level ones, so it is a random spawn. 100 pt jump down from the walls around it. -- Aelryinth 11/20/2000

location.name: 3 Pillars and a Corpse
location.description: The Three Pillars are all pointing to a center and center is glowing, corpse next to the stones. Been here since beginning of game -- AR

location.name: Treacherous Tunnels
location.description: No Level Restriction, You can not tie. -- Truthsayer

location.name: Sho Roadside
location.description:
Destination 27.9S, 68.4E
this is between Sawato and Shoushi -- Kara Gandharvi

location.name: Northwest Dires Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone Near a tower. -- Crunchyfrog

location.name: Northern Point
location.description:
Found this in my golem hunting travels. Portal exits at 93.5N, 7.7E There are two portals near the exit point for Northern Dires Ridge and Zaikhal. -- Chen Gong
Its an ambush at the exit point. Better buff before enter. I didnt buff and jump

location.name: Lifestone - East Lytelthorpe
location.description: Convenient for hunting Setabs Barracks, Forgotten Temple, and the Lytlethorpe-Rithwic road. -- Marcus

location.name: Dires Lifestone
location.description: Not too far from the Amperehelion Vault -- Twae di Diji

location.name: Mushroom ring
location.description: -- Jart of SaH

location.name: North Direlands Valley Junction
location.description: Exits at 2.6N, 65.1W, The portal is in a building that goes underground, Restricted to lvl 25+ -- AR

location.name: Nomad Tower
location.description: A ruined tower containing 2 Nomad Mu-miyahs. Might be new content from the November update. I wasnt able to ID their lvl, but they cast level VI war and life and are not too challenging to kill. -- Dotto

location.name: Vesayen Isles Portal
location.description:
Exits at 72.5S, 81.3E. A second permanent portal to the isles, didnt have time to write down exit coordinates because I got killed in the exit. David ibn Jensen, Dreamfollwers, Solclaim -- Davidibn Jensen
Exits at 72.5S, 81.3E, the same spot as the other Vesayen Islands portal. Immacolata 11/22/2001

location.name: Mosswort Prayer Group
location.description:
Cluster of 4 Zealots, 1 Soul Trapper, 1 Idol on the top of the hill in the center of the island. Several fast spawn groups of Idolators and Fanatics guard the approaches. This is a nice place to go to fight the new mossies without a lot of distractions. Fast, reliable spawn. -- Sol Chen
Danger!! Zealots are very bad dudes, and if you attack one you will be attacked by all of them. Along with the mossies there are Jungle Wasps on the hill (if you dislike Gold Wasps you will HATE these), Island Dillos and Shallows Destroyers on the beach (the baddest Dillos Ive seen yet). There are no structures, there is no place to hide, and if you get injured on the hill the dillos on the beach will make you run for your life. Of course, first you have to get to the hill. Did I mention the Island Dillos? -- Lars Larsson 2/1/2001

location.name: LS with 2 ports
location.description: Just a lifestone with a direlands northwest shore portal and a direlands valley portal. Did not take either, just running by... -- Blaze Lawless

location.name: Yaraq Portal
location.description: Exits at 21.9S, 2.1W -- Nanies al-Fylin

location.name: Obsidian Stone Triad
location.description:
This is a curious set of three irregular obsidian columns, arranged in a triangle in the middle of the snowy forest. Nothing of note around it
nothing inside it. Perhaps a future portal or dungeon location? -- Path

location.name: Training Camps
location.description: Coords are a bit off, as there are 2 of these camps within a few meters of eachother. From last months story line.... this is one of the locations where you can find a training camp. In a small ring you will find 3 Drudge Raveners, and up to 5 or 6 Tusker Guards, and a Virindi Master. They are being trained by 3 Tumindeon Hollow Minions. The spawn rate of the monsters is a bit crazy, if you can clear the camp in about 2 minutes you should do fine, goodluck. I havent found out the true meaning of this area, as it seems that the storyline took more of a turn to the PK god. There are not many that know of this location, but dont be surprised if someone is there camping the tuskers. -- Partycrasher

location.name: Mosswart Field Camp
location.description: Small Mossie field camp on the foot of a small hill, SW of Dryreach, with 2 Shamen and a Chief, as well as Barkers and Mudlurks, all on a reasonably fast spawn. The Chief has reasonably good magic loot, like lvl III Magic Items. Banderling Captain spawns very close too. -- Moriah

location.name: Southern Mt. Esper
location.description:
Found this while exploring southeast of Tufa. Level restriction of 12+. Destination 56.4N, 12.9E -- Nakita (MT)
I came across this portal during the march 2001 patch and it was surounded by a thick blue mist. -- Armin 3/24/2001

location.name: Chakron Flux Dungeon
location.description:
BaelZharon High Level Quest Dungeon, Entry level contains virindi (inluding observer), tuskers, hollow minions. -- Afreyt
Virindi Masters/Observers, Tusker Slaves/Guards, Hollow Minions. Level restriction 36+. Bring 2 large groups. Halfway through the dungeon splits into 2 sections with a 36-45 restricted portal and another for 41+. Both groups must work together as there are a series of buttons/levers that will open doors for the other group. At the end of the high level area spawns the Singularity Fragment which when combined with the Heart of Shadows and the Skull opens a portal to BaelZharons lair. It spawns on the floor between 2 large crystals. The spawn time is around 5 minutes. Be prepared for Bludgeon Vuln 6 from the observers combined with hollow bludgeon damage from the minions. There are some hot spots. The floor at the bottom of a ramp in front of a lever door will do damage and a couple of the large crystals will drain mana. The 36-45 group is rewarded with the Virindi Amulet. Item Mastery 6, Mana Conversion Mastery 6, Exhaustion 5. An easy approach is from Black Dominion or the Obsidian Rim portal exit. Run up the back side of the hill to get to the dungeon. There is an exit at the entrance as well as in the final room. -- Krell (LC) 12/27/2000
Virindi Servants Amuljet was upgraded in Aug 2003 patch to Moderate Item Magic, Minor ManaC, Item Magic VI and ManaC VI. Portal isnt summonable -- Jaz of SC 8/31/2003

location.name: Shade Stronghold
location.description: This is part of the December quest. There are actually 2 portals here, reqs are 26-35 and 31-40 higher is full of shadows,LTs and grivers.lower is shadows and children. each side must pull levers for the other. final parts are Dark Heart of the Shadow from the high, and Shadow Captains Heume from the low. -- senshin -MT

location.name: Empyrean Cloister Portal
location.description:
New lowest level quest dungeon(s) for December 00 update. One portal levels 15-30 enters a place that then has 2 portal levels 15-25 and 15-30? inside. results are the Skull of Palacost, a new Obsidian Dagger (4-8?) and the Barbed fletching tool? Was unable to enter myself, just sat and buffed my vassals and others. undead, liches,etc inside. -- Senshin -MT
Portals are *not* tieable here -- closest tieable are in the Yaraq area. Foyer is clear, top is clear... barely, mid-level desert monsters are easily brought to top area by heros running in. Top exit portal is guarded by a lich. Dungeon is large, winding, and populated with lich and higher level undead (Risen Soldiers and Risen Knights). The quests are designed to be attempted by large (8-16), well organized parties (know your route, know your levers, plan your body recovery). -- Doc Feelgood 12/25/2000
All liches, lich lords, and Risen soldiers(26)and knights. risen do not cast but have excellent melee. bring your ~190+ jump and as much run as you can. There are acid pits here I have yet to see a mage cross ;( -- senshin 12/27/2000
Inner portals are: lower (15-25) and upper (21-30). Upper side acid pit can be jumped with 148 jump/150 run (a mage doing it ;->). For a quick jump check, see if you can jump on top of the tall rock at the entrance. If you can, you can probably jump the acid pit. Upper and lower parties must coordinate their lever pulling to get through. Lower group gets the dagger and archery tool, upper group gets the skull. There are surface portals at the jump down point and just beyond the party split point. -- Doc Feelgood 12/28/2000
update: there are *three* acid pits to jump, the second requires 199 jump, third is easy. Upper level guardian is Mausoleum Director (55th). Whatever size group you think you need, double it. (20 would be comfortable). -- Doc Feelgood 12/31/2000
Well, as for the acid pits on the high side which is lvls 21-30, i cleared all 3; the first 2 with a jump of 200, and the last with 220. (this was a standing jump mind you). Also you can do this quest with only 8 people, we had 4 for the high side and 4 for the low. wasn't too bad, just watch for the respawn at the end, if you're not ready for war magic, you're dead. -- Elhanan Jabar 1/5/2002

location.name: Chosen of Asheron
location.description:
A man that looks like a fire elemental, but made of light stands on the top of this hill. He one of the Chosen of Asheron. If you talk to him, he gives you a book titles Asherons Missive. The book tells how we can finally defeat BaelZharon. Found on: 12/22/00 -- Al-Tuvah (HG)
I just past by that hill and he is no longer there. Must have past on, along with the BaelZharon quest. -- Zenaku (WE) 2/4/2001
Chosen of Asheron is now in Zaikhal near coords 14.5N, 2.5E. He/She is on a small plateau, cant miss it! You receive Asherons Second Missive. -- Octavian (FF) 7/4/2001

location.name: Snowman Igloo
location.description: On the way to the new Luggie Castle from Qual. An igloo with a few lithos around. Inside a lvl 128 snowman selling Magic Ice Balls. Only to be used for cooking, not throwing. -- Tatian-Mane

location.name: Shipwreck
location.description: Another skeleton shipwreck on the coast. This one has a Lord, 2 captains, and a bunch of warriors around a chest, many barrels, etc. much like the west coast wreck. Chest had low level junk like excellent kits, lockpicks, food, gems, etc, but about 8 items. -- Senshin MT

location.name: Hidetaki's Warrior's Tower
location.description: This is the tower four of Hidetakis warriors hid in after fleeing the battle field to avenge Fychecks death. The warriors were killed by a nearby wisp and now haunt the tower as zombies. -- Cuttler Strngmd

location.name: Fycheck Outpost Stone Monument
location.description: A stone monument south of Fychecks outpost that spawns 2 zefirs. -- Cuttler Strngmd

location.name: Abandoned Campsite
location.description: Looks like someone set up their camp site, went for a swim and never came back. Randomly spawns basic food and clothing. Good for true newbies to earn a couple of pyreals. -- Comothinon

location.name: Platform
location.description: A large platform surrounded by stones and 4 previously unknown portals. Discovered by the LKODs Banneth and Xorg. -- Xorg

location.name: Catacombs of Ithaenc
location.description:
Located on top of the Cathedral. The key to the Mistress Chest is located here on a Putrid Moarsman on the bottom. The chest is also located on top of the Cathedral and contains the Healers Heart (Heal Other VI, Healing Mastery VI. Life skill required: 245, Diff: 105). Inside is high level Sclavus, Cursed/Affliction Wisps, Foul/Putrid Moarsman. Not sure if it can be done solo do to the levers. From the entrance, take the ramps to the bottom and pull the lever. In the lever room the Putrid Moarsman with the key is on the other side of a fence. You can kill him but unless your lucky you wont be able to loot it through the fence. This lever will open the south door on the 2nd level. Go through the south door and down one level and you will find a room with 2 levers. Watch the dispel trap on the ramp down and the mana blight and stamina blight floor traps in the doorways to the dual lever room. These 2 levers will open both the North and South doors on the 2nd level. Run up and through the North door on the 2nd level then work your way down. At one point youll need to jump off a ledge with affliction and cursed wisps waiting at the bottom. Work your way down to a room with plants and a cage overhead. The Putrid Moarsman with the key will run in to meet you there once your in range from the original lever room nearby. The easiest way to the dungeon is with the Recall the Sanctuary spell (Copper Scarab, Brown Taper, Comfrey, Personal Taper, Orange Taper, Cobalt, Personal Taper, Rowan Talisman) or take the Vesayen Isles portal south of Bandit Castle at 61.7N, 48.6E and run the length of the island chain. -- Krell (LC)
You need lock picks to open the door, at the buttom lever room -- Qq 1/19/2001
Good strategy to make it through is to throw melees in the front, and have archers / mages behind them firing away and healing. Form a wall with the melees so everyone gets the benefit of the shield. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Entrance and exit are quiet. Foyer is hot with Chomu and Ulu Sclavi. Spawn rate is modest. Entrance and exit portals are not recallable or summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 10/20/2002

location.name: Training Camp
location.description: A little group of creatures, looking kind of like a camp because of the number of creatures, and the rate of spawn. A Bander Captain, Mosswart Chief, 2 Mosswart Shamens, and more than a dozen lower level Mosswarts in the imediate area. Super quick spawn. I was lvl 28, and I had fun keeping up with it. Nothing else of interest, but didn't stay to look around. -- Adra Mar SulaUpdated to Obsidian and Oak Golems, with Ferocious, Cruel and Brutish Monouga nearby -- Chupon 8/19/2004

location.name: River Mouth Portal
location.description:
Portal I discovered in my wanderings, Exits at . Which is Shop by the Sea. Lvl 12+ to enter. First discovered it around 20/12/00, so it has been here 3 weeks from the date of this entry. -- Davros DT
The exit is pointing in the wrong place in AC Explorer. The exit co-ordinates I entered are correct. -- Davros - DT 1/9/2001 Looks like a bug in AC Explorer. -- Polecat 9/25/2001

location.name: Desert March
location.description:
A new dungeon for Januarys patch. Tumeroks are outside guarding the place with Drudges, Virindi, and a pair of Hollow Minions deeper in. Has many portals to obscure places, including several deep in the dires and the Obsidian Plains. -- Optim Shi
The portals at the bottom are in the three wings off of the room with the minions. North Wing -- Bandit Castle (65.0N, 49.3E), Surface (6.4N, 3.9W), Obsidean Rim (48.0S, 65.0W / lvl 35). West Wing -- South Mt. Esper (56.8N, 12.9E / lvl 12), South Dires (84.2S, 34.4W / lvl 12). East Wing -- Black Hill (62.4S, 52.3W), North Dires (24.4N, 53.8W / lvl 12). -- Mariko-san 1/15/2001
The 3 wings are long hallways from the center room which contains the 2 minions and a Virindi Master on a fast (About 2 minute) spawn. No way to run by without taking some hollow hits. -- Krell (LC) 1/21/2001
Upper levels of the dungeon are all turmock warriors and priests. Going lower you will meet high priests and officers then finally gladiators. Watch out after the gladiators. There is a mass group of high drudges. Swarming can become pretty bad. The Master is guarded by high drudges and hollow minons. I couldnt solo the group of drudges at level 41 before the ones behind me respawned. Bring a group if your after masks. -- Dragonbait org 2/2/2001
In ACexplorer, the exits of this portal are wrongly displayed. This causes great inconveniences when trying to plan routes =( -- AquilaT 5/11/2002

location.name: Bunker
location.description:
Small cave filled with 7 or 8 Wild Monougas. Appeared with January 2001 update. -- Disturber
Spawn has changed to several Extas Raider, and Tiatus Raiders, the cave has some misc items on floor of cave. Nothing special. -- Zen Tek Ken6/27/2003

location.name: Essence of Strife
location.description:
If you hand this creature a level VI war scroll, it will teach you a level VII war spell of the same damage type (i.e. a Frost Bolt VI Scroll will yield Icy Torment, 110-180 points of Cold Damage) It adds the spell directly to your spell book, so in order to learn these spells, you must come here in person. -- Optim Shi
Since Oct 2002 patch (Festivus) this location is the start of the Gaerlan Citadel quest for Lvl 40-59 (I think). The location has assorted Fire Elementals -- Jaz of SC 11/12/2002

location.name: Everchanging Portal
location.description:
On diresland road at the lifestone and mage/weapons shop. -- BA
Its now a Plateu Portal, not Qblar. -- NonSequitor 1/13/2001
Mislabled -- Doc Feelgood 11/10/2002
Changes every patch. always has. -- Shal - MT 11/13/2002

location.name: Tusker perch
location.description: A good place to perch and hunt tuskers in the ob plains. -- Rocker

location.name: NW. Samsur Advocate Building Portal
location.description:
Portal from Samsur to Samsur NW outpost. On second floor of the Advocates Spire. -- Sis. Immacolata
Portal no longer works. The NW advocate building has been overrun by Hollow Minions. -- Goldor 12/29/2001

location.name: Desert March to Bandit Castle
location.description: Located west of Al-Jalima, near the Inner Sea Coastline. Very dangerous dungeon.

location.name: Lone Snowman
location.description: A lone snowman you cant seem to attack it and it does not have a level - Archer From Hell -- Archer From Hel

location.name: Upper Shade Stronghold
location.description:
Dungeon restricted to levels 26-33. Didnt explore deep because there wasnt any close lifestone. Really detailed dungeon with red for and shadow children and shadows, maybe part of a new quest? -- Leafcull
Sorry about the spelling, it was a detailed floor. Looking for any info on this dungeon? Fryar -- Leafcull 1/16/2001
This is where you obtain the Captains shadow heume. You will need a group to go into the lower Shade stronghold to move levers while you move levers in the Upper dungeon for the lower dungeon. With a large enough goup in the lower dungeon you will be fine in the upper...the captain is like lvl126 i think but he wasnt a problem if there is enough of you...and he drops the heume...theres a timer as well but unknown length. -- Roland Chase-HG 1/18/2001

location.name: Empty Tower
location.description: Just an empty tower overlooking the pass below. -- Ryth-al-Rothgar

location.name: Snowman Salesman
location.description: A level 229 Snowman that sells Poofy Snowballs and Snowballs try not to piss him off or he will attack you. Really mean varmit..casted Defensless V, Cold Vul. IV, and nasty frost spells at me..but luckily i didnt die -- GeorgeKG

location.name: A Ruin to Baishi Subway
location.description:
Easy travel from Mayoi to Baishi. Enter the ruin, follow the left hand wall strictly untill you descend one level, take right fork for portal to Baishi. -- Immacolata
Ok, easy is relative. Be prepared to fight black rats, a water wisp, several mosswarts and a shaman. You newbies better be a wee bit careful in here, or you will be swarmed and killed, unless you manage to outrun the foes. For your first time in here, take a friend. -- Bro. Shadwell 2/27/2001

location.name: Coral Golem Spawn Site
location.description:
Not a Dungeon but still an important outside xp spawn point. Coral Golems be here along with usually those with illegal island ties (illegal ties were removed eventually
ed. note) whacking away on those great big mountains of walking xp called Coral Golems. -- Phoenix Wolfsun

location.name: Cragstone Waterfall
location.description: This is a really nice place to hang out and rest after a long hard journey. The waterfalls are very peaceful and make a good place to mule from. There is also a water golem spawn here tht will help lower level chars get a few levels fairly quickly. -- Michael Highlan

location.name: Hebian-To South Roadside Hunting Spot
location.description: Found that at this exact location you can expect spawns of high level critters on a regular basis. On occasion Ive witnessed Linvak Ursuins, Limestones, multiple Vorous... usually during the day to boot! The best part about this is that its 25 seconds from the south Heb lifestone. I camped this location for many a day so it should be pretty stable. -- Zenaku (WE)

location.name: Chosen of Asheron
location.description: Near Cragstone, Chosen of Asheron gives you a book called Asherons Second Missive... -- Kruntus Maximus

location.name: Tusker Training Camp
location.description:
Tuskers, Hollows, Virindi and aparently alot of Kool d00d who have been hoarding these spots to the exclusion of others. Most on a 2-4 min spawn cycle (Kool d00ds included). Usually divided into four seperate camps so this is an approximate position, circle round about .5 to 1 click and you should find all four parts. A lot of people use these places to level newbies or to powerlevel. They also contain the chests which contain the spell scrolls need to learn the Level 7 spells for the Jan patch. P.S. Thanks to Sorren on TD for the coords. -- Phoenix Wolfsun Oh and thanks to Senshin of MT for pointing out its a POI not a dungeon. Anyway the information is back in as a POI so that it shows up on everybodies database. Enjoy the xp. -- Phoenix Wolfsun
On Leafcull here, there is a level 79 (as of this date) sword user for which the concept of sharing is beyond his feeble grasp. A real S&^. Hes here a lot. There are 4 camps in the immediate vicinity, and he just must have all of them. Look out, folks (Im UA, BTW). -- Zimbalt (II) 6/11/2001

location.name: Tusker Training Camp
location.description: Tuskers, Hollows, Virindi and aparently alot of Kool d00d who have been hoarding these spots to the exclusion of others. Most on a 2-4 min spawn cycle (Kool d00ds included). Usually divided into four seperate camps so this is an approximate position, circle round about .5 to 1 click and you should find all four parts. A lot of people use these places to level newbies or to powerlevel. They also contain the chests which contain the spell scrolls need to learn the Level 7 spells for the Jan patch. P.S. Thanks to Sorren on TD for the coords. -- Phoenix Wolfsun Oh and thanks to Senshin of MT for pointing out its a POI not a dungeon. Anyway the information is back in as a POI so that it shows up on everybodies database. Enjoy the xp. -- Phoenix Wolfsun

location.name: Hebian-to Portal
location.description: -- Hexxor

location.name: Path up
location.description: You can climb the slope here to get up on the bluff. -- Sturgeon

location.name: Floating Vase
location.description: Just a little vase floating about 2 meters in the air. Whee! -- Whim

location.name: Tall Mushroom
location.description: Here on the beach between Nanto and Mayoi stands a mushroom twice the height of a man. It stands alone. -- Ibn Schachabo

location.name: Forsaken Portal
location.description: Exits at 71.2S, 93.7E. At the bottom of Treacherous Tunnels dungeon, cannot be summoned or tied. Lets out in the cave where the other Treacherous Tunnels entrance portal is located. -- Adric the Red

location.name: Diyas al-Yat - Virindi Translator
location.description:
A new Npc. A Virindi Translator located outside the Zakhail Library.2/15/01 -- Catdancer
This translator cannot translate the February Unreadable Text -- Sixfingers 2/15/2001
Translater will take a shard found on directers..from the hollow dungeon... did say much...said virindi are taken hollows as there new body gaurd...boy do they hurt -- The dead 2/19/2001

location.name: South Tumerok Vanguard Outpost
location.description:
Pretty much the same as the North Outposts description. -- Elias Kai
Vangaurd crossbow and amulet on boss. -- JZ 2/16/2001
Too easy in your late 30... did it just fro the fun and the Xbow for my younger toon.. tumeroks can get overwelming as they come out like 10-15 at a time in places...if in your 20s dont go alone -- the dead 2/19/2001
I am in my low 20s and I second that ! However, there is good money to be made from the critter loot. I made 15K from the first room with reedsharks and tumeroks. -- Yellowbeard 2/19/2001
I'd say this is tougher than the North Outpost, though easier to find your way. (Go south.) I'd say don't go alone in your low 30's either! -- Thenn 3/5/2001

location.name: Humming Crystal
location.description:
There is also a door above the crystal. You cans see it visually, but you can ID it. You can also double click on the crystal, but nothing happens. I also tried a Fenmalain key on it - it let me use it, but then said you cannot use this key here. So me thinks SOME kind of key may do something??? -- Ho Mang 2/17/2001
Ok want some help..heh...get your old dagger (bludge dagger) combine with Harrower acid and u get a key...use key in this place... -- The dead 2/19/2001
Yes, combine the Organic Acid from a Harrower Grievver with the Peculiar Old Dagger. This will result in a key that can be turned in to the giant crystal for a Lyceum Recall Gem. This will take you to the Lyceum where your War magic skills will be tested against Nephol Golems for the chance to obtain the Thaumaturgic Plate armor. The Lyceum is also where you turn in the Blue Orb to the trainer to receive the Globe of Auberean. The peculiar old dagger is found on a random merchant in the south dires. I found him not far from the south land bridge portal exit at 82.1s 35.7w. -- Krell (LC) 2/21/2001

location.name: Jewel Collector - Baishi
location.description:
Jewel Collector tells you, I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them. But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures. -- Sis. Immacolata
He is referring to gems created by the stone collector from black stones and rocks. Better to give them to an obsidian enchantress. He also makes items out of virindi jewels. -- Stormcrow Grey 2/24/2001

location.name: Leather Crafter - Kryst
location.description: Crafts stuff from hides of armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar. -- Sis. Immacolata

location.name: Lyceum
location.description:
This is the Ishilai Lyceum spoken of in the lore book On the Proper Use and Care of Thaumaturgic Plate. The Lyceum as it is commonly called, was founded by Exarch Hieromancer Sephrena Mirenndae, who later became Priestess of the Adjanite Sisterhood of Ithaenc. This will be your destination if you are on the Mage Armor quest. I would suggest Level 60+ for this place.
The Lyceum is on the top of a sheer cliff and can only be reached by using a Lyceum Recall Gem (which you must construct). It is no recall, so dont die. One of the gem components is on a week long timer. After you construct and use a Lyceum Recall Gem, you will be transported to a safe area within the Lyceum. The friendly NPC golem Eaushi the Trainer is there to greet you. Do as he asks and you will receive crystals. Give them to him for the uncharged mage armor. You can also give him a Blue Orb from the Heiromancer Halls and you will be rewarded with the Globe of Aubrean orb. Or you can give him a Sunstone Geode, a very rare random drop on the Nephol Golems within the Lyceum, for a Heiromancer orb.
The entire complex is very interesting and worthy of a look. There is a cooking dress in one of the locked chests in a building. The guard golems hold a key to this. There is also a Lightweight Tome hidden in the library at the mountain peak. Although this tome is suprisingly heavy, it can be written in. You can get outside by using a lever or jumping over the wall. If you have a low jump you may need a friend to stay at the lever in order for you to get back in. If not, you may be able to jump from the hillside and clear the wall. Whatever you do, dont fall off. You may lose your corpse forever. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Advocate Tower
location.description: Just east of Shoushi -- Whim, SC

location.name: Sho Roadside Portal
location.description: exit at Sho area 27.9S, 68.4E. Seems - as there are so many entrys - that this portal changes positions sometimes. Maybe always the same portal just other coords... -- Houlai Kami

location.name: Standing Stone
location.description: standing stone -- Senshin -MT

location.name: Building
location.description:
The terrain here has been changed, a Meeting hall syle building with 3 Empyrean stones and a portal holder is now here. -- Senshin -MT
This is actually the dropoff for the Mainland portal found inside the Lyceum nearby. -- Confucius of FF 10/20/2002

location.name: Qalaba'r Portal
location.description: Portal dumps out close to Qbar, may be random portal, not sure. -- Spliffa

location.name: Tumerok Dungeon
location.description:
This dungeon is located inside a Tumerok Fort. The dungeon itself has all kinds of Tumeroks. There is a big room with what looks to be a sacrifice table with a body on it and BZ statue Standing over it, there’s even a dagger on the ground... I looked all through the dungeon only thing of interest is SIK chest
Monsters inside have been updated. Ive seen a Diamond Golem, plate armoredillos, Banderling Enforcer, Ascendant Tumeroks, Augmented Tumeroks, Great Skeletons, Wasteland rats, Altered Drudges, Augmented Drudges -- Zen Tek Ken 6/27/2003

location.name: Plateau Top
location.description: Exits out at 44.4N, 43.5W

location.name: Monouga Camp
location.description: Theres 3-4 Outcast Monougas waiting around a open fire

location.name: Empyrean House
location.description:
Empyrean House with furniture inside, plus a lifestone right outside the door.
No furniture vendor present. Appears ready for a future AC update to populate with a vendor. -- Tyana 12/27/2001

location.name: A Mosswart Nest
location.description: very small cave, mosswart feeders and creepers will attack upon enter -- Black Hand 4/16/2001

location.name: Drudge camp
location.description: Small camp of drudges, one prowler and two skulkers. Battered remains of humans with mining tools scattered around. -- Lothar

location.name: Death Shore
location.description: This is the beach just under the Granite Golem tower. Spawn is decent. Good for leveling LVL6 to LVL11, any class. You will find water and mud golems, as well as gromnies and the broken fragment. -- Latheoth

location.name: Monster Camp
location.description: I seen like 3 camps of monsters, one with a Banderling Captain and couple ravers around a pot over a fire, one with Drudges and a pack of shreth and Reedsharks near by. I believe the Banderling Spawn is perm since theres 2 chests one spawned newbie stuff other just spawned some pyreals. If you are a lowbie might want to bring couple of your pals to clear it out.

location.name: Direlands Valleys Portal
location.description: Exits out at 42.9S, 63.5W Level Restricted to lvl 25+

location.name: Anadil's Tomb
location.description:
This Crypt is heavily guarded by Horrible and Nomad Mu-miyah, at the bottom lies the Tomb of the Sand King Anadil, which holds his most prized possession the Staff of the Nomads!!!! The Tomb is locked and has a resistance of 350.
Warning to those wanting to get the staff. Stamina traps galore. And the nomads arent the 50th level variety, but the 100 + variety -- Fon Win SC 10/20/2001

location.name: Flaming Pillar
location.description: A tall pillar topped with flame. The stumps of six other pillars form a small circle around it. -- Adric the Red

location.name: Small Hut
location.description: A small house occupied by 2 white rats between Rithwic and Dryreach, and nice for muling. -- Gisela Solclaim

location.name: River Bridge portal
location.description: Across the river to Cragstone. Exits at about 27.2N, 47.5E -- Chodley Chodson

location.name: Soul Fearing Vestry (Acolyte Towers / The Three Towers)
location.description:
This is a great mid-level quest. The tower to the West is tower 1, the southern one is tower 3, and the one kind of in the middle (and highest one) is the 2nd. Kill the lich in the first, run up inside the thing and hit the lever. Then run inside the second and kill the undead (run inside to get them to spawn) it will open 3rd tower door. Run inside there and kill the undead that spawn outside. Kill the lesser LAST or the quest may break (and youll PISS OFF alot of people). If you learn the spawn points you can jump over the traps and not fight monsters, but other than the liches I found the place easy. On the high acolyte Ive never had a problem and Im lvl 33. You can leave your guy in that last chamber where he spawns and come back every 5 hours if you want to get a bunch of Yucky Keys (4 pulls per key). I recommend doing the chests when theres a few people around, 1 is uber weapons/armor/jewelry/clothes/wands/gems/etc., one is uber weapons/armor and the other is crap. Usually if you go there at hours when a decent amount of people inside there will be a few to tell you which chests are which. All in all its a pretty easy quest if you know what your doing, but if you run ahead and start hitting traps and spawn too many critters (especially in the last section) youll get yourself and others killed. @tell me if you need help. -- Ken the Feeble Either play the tower lever-pull game, or more simply, wait for the Lesser Acolyte to spawn (every 15 min.)in front of the towers, and kill him for a portal to appear for access to the dungeon. Dungeon is split into three sections, first section is Zombies, second is Skeleton Captains and the last by Liches. Creatures appear on spawn traps. You trigger the trap, and the creature spawns. Most traps are in the corners of rooms and hallways, but not always. At the end of each section is a Lesser Acolyte that you must kill to make a portal appear to access the next section. Lesser Acolytes improve in level the further you go, until the last one which is level 48. Sadly, I did not loot each acolyte as I went, apparently they have the keys for the 4 chests in the room that have lockpick resistance of 9999. SIKs do not work on said chests. There is also a lousy chest on the west wall that gives crud. Great looking dungeon, lots of neat light effects! Entered by Grundas the Dark 8/8/2000
An arrangement of 3 towers, each with buttons and/or levers on the inside. The button/lever in one tower opens the door to another tower. Ooodles of little trigger steps
entire dungeon quest would be fun for a few mid-levellers, alas, the run to get to this spot is not mid-level at all. -- Garfield3d
VERRY important note, when nabbing the 4-use yucky key from te high acolyte at the end and hoping the portal to the chest room, you be be MUCH hapier if do NOT use the key on the 2 chests that are on the same wall together. Those 2 chests have TERRIBLE loot compared to the other two, which par with Uber Chests. Be sure to juts wait out the 15 minute spawn on the chest on the bench and the one to its left, youll thank me later! -- Sargonas 8/13/2000
THE safest way to get there : go to Qalabar, take the road that goes south, follow it till it ends, then stay on the serpentine forested hill, it goes to the bottom in a gentle slope. Once there, just follow the valley to the Towers. Youll find some Tumeroks, Mattekars and low level Drudges and Skeletons. Its a little longer, but that way its a mid-level quest. I made the trip with my 10th level mage, without any problems
-) -- Jestra of MT 8/18/2000
The chests are on a 5 minute spawn, not 15. Also, to confirm the 2 chests on the East wall have really bad loot.. they DO. The North chest is mainly wands/gems/clothing, while the West chest is mainly armor/weapons. The North chest HAS given some GREAT helms though. All in all a great quest. Fun for 1st timers too, who have no idea whats going on. :) -- Dorn Axehaft MT 9/5/2000
Ok heres the real correct info on acolyte towers....first of all I need to say its a 7 minute spawn on chests as well as high acolyte.This quest can be done every 5 hours...when you get to the final room there will 2 pairs of 2 liches that spawn as you head towards acolyte the spawn is activated by floor traps...after the liches do NOT enter room solo...unless you can handle it!You can sucessfully stand at the very end of the hallway with out triggering acolyte or liches and buff up for the battle but watch your back people coming behind you will with any regards to you trigger the spawn(I speak from experience here)There are also individuals who will attempt to kill you at this spot(at least on hg)The west chest spawns armor and weapons of various qualities from UBER to UBER CRAP!The north spawns jewelry wands gems and the occasional armor weapons spawns here are usually AWESOME and in my opinion worth the wasted pulls to get that one good one...The best way to get here to my knowledge is to head west from Qalabar then follow beach (northern edge)when you get to the equitarial axis stop and put lightning protects on if you got them~hehe and run like the wind!There is a LS here and i recommend using it!One other important note:There are some people who enjoy disabling the dungeon and then stay in the area...in order to reset(fix) the acolytes spawn to enter the area must be cleared for 15 minutes for the land block to reset...That mean totally cleared the best way to accomplish this is just to log off for 15 minutes...1st and 2nd lvls are cake 3rd gets tough but if you can handle 2-3 liches at a time solo I recommend coming here best chests in the game... -- Krack of HG 9/9/2000
Definitely follow the coast. I went through one of the valleys headed west and saw shadow lieutenants, berserker and striker banderlings and a few other high level baddies. -- Mothgog 9/30/2000
The south coast route has spawn points which can produce Bone Knights and Bone Lords
Ive heard the north coast route is better. -- Red and Gold 10/6/2000
Just follow any coast! =) Spawns are random and you could see Armoredillos to Shadows to Bone Lords. Even by taking the North shore, you have to cross back South through dangerous land since the towers lie in close proximity to the Southern shore. Run fast, keep your mini-map open... -- Garfield3d 10/9/2000
The Acolyte towers are actually due south of 87.6S 10.6W. All three towers are visible from these coordinates. -- Slyzzr 11/25/2000
Most of the previous posts are crap... The real scoop is that the end of this simple quest are chests that are lootable 4 times with the yucky(lucky) key. For an added bonus you also get a skull worth 12,000 exp to an ivory crafter(great to save these for quick vitae burners). The problem is choosing the right chests at the end to open. The chest positions in the room change constantly(previous posts telling what ones are good are worthless posts). Out of the 4 chests 2 are uber loot. 1 contains primarily weapons/armor and the other contains magic items like wands and jewelry. The best approach to finding the right chests is to either save your keys until you show up in the chest room with someone that has already located the uber chests or go with another adventurer so at most you both only waste one try with your key. Note: Unless you are lvl 40+ or you have a nice size party I would suggest staying just outside high acolyte room and draw him out with ranged attacks or spells(evil presence is the killer in the room not the acolyte). My technique is to cast imperil 4 on the high acolyte to where I can 1 time him with ease when he charges me and leaves his room. The ONLY drawback to this quest is that you can only do it every 5 hrs. Another note... The spawn rate for the high acolyte is only around 4-5 minutes. BTW another nice technique to conque

location.name: Dark mosswart gangs
location.description: This northern part of the third Vesayen Island has several groups of mosswarts that always respawn. Each group has at least one Soul Trapper that debuffs you at large with various vulns, weakness etc., and the rest is either the fire loving Zealots or the not-so dangerous Idolators. One group in the center sometimes worships a Dread Idol. -- Immacolata

location.name: Drudge Camp
location.description: 2 Drudge Slinkers and a Drudge Prowler around a pot over a hot fire, plus theres 2 human corpses, 1 dillo Head and 1 Auroch Bull Head. The camp is hidden behind some brush

location.name: Drudge Tower
location.description: A locked tower with three drudges in it. Didnt have a key nor lock picking. The door frame is decorated with two human skulls. -- Immacolata

location.name: yaraq cows
location.description: lots of slow stupid level 10 cows here that arcers and mages pick on with hit and run tactics.good place for low levels to level or work off viate(but dont let the cows catch you!)DO NOT COME HERE ON DARKTIDE!!either a PK will kill you or an Anti-PK will call you a PK and kill you anyway.and if you kill someone here they will come back with their level 40+ main character and kick your ass time and time again.EVIL!!!!!!!!!! -- death to you haAhh... the Yaraq Cows... I knew them well... First, the cows were nerfed to sixth level, then the Training Dungeons were enhanced so you came out fifth level, and finally Olthoi Arcade was opened so you could get to 20th level in two hours. But in their day... they were a prime gathering place for newbies, leeches and wannabe patrons. -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

location.name: Fire Auroch Pastures
location.description:
New for the 03/2001 they changed the spawns south-west of GW all the way to Zaikhal, this particular area is very interesting however, because up until this patch a very limited number of Fire Auroch BULLs existed in game at all. Now anyone seeking to make a White xbow, or bow has more locations to fight the Fire Bulls and get their horns. Note: for all those who have told you otherwise, horns on your comp affect only 1 thing.. + to defense on your comp bow/xbow.. NOTHING else.. if they tell you otherwise, theyre ignorant ^_~ -- Shal of MT
The aurochs are here, along with some dolls and mannequins plus a mu-miyah or two in the more desert-like areas around the plains. Interesting place to hunt. Note that if youre loking for fire auroch horns, kill all the fire aurochs you can find -- I got one horn off of a Cow and another off of a Yearling. -- Pandarus 4/3/2001
Still a fair ammount of Fire Auroch bulls. Lots of Broken Fragments as well. Fire Yearlings and cows drop horns, but are not useable for the ivory colored Composite. The guy who carves the horns will take them and not return. They need to be specifically Fire Bull horns. Drop rate is similiar to Great Mattekars. I spent a couple of hours out there, got both my horns, well worth the effort. Gives you only 2% on defence mod, but looks dayam cool. -- Neo Taciasun HG 6/20/2001

location.name: Wooden pier
location.description: A small wooden pier going out into the channel separating Osteth from the presumed Asherons Island. I wonder what a pier is good for since there are no boats in this world? -- Immacolata

location.name: Panopticon Complex
location.description:
New dungeon activated April 1st, Residents include a full range of Virindi, Hollow minions, Tuskers and Drudge Raveners. At the end all of the normal Ayan Baqur NPCs stand, some say some interesting things. Surface portals up the ramps from the NPCs. I didnt check past the surface portals so there may be more. -- Zenogias of MT
Hmmm, for April Fools Day the Virindi take over a town? -- -giggles 4/1/2001
Lots of Tumideon Hollow Minions, one SIK chest, and the townsfolk of Ayan Baqur. Bring stout for Ulgrim. -- Khazeh al-Qunat 4/1/2001
Surface portals can be tied to. Welcome to Ayan Baqur everyone. -- Virginia Plain 4/1/2001
The Panopticon Dungeon is outside of Ayan Baqur. The Entrance portal is not tyable and is level restricted to 32+ BUT a surface portal inside is tyable which makes AB no longer a non gatable town... Inside you will find Drudges, Tuskers, Virindis, Hollow Minions... and most of all you will find all the former NPCs from Ayan Baqur in one room. -- Zeeb 4/1/2001
SiK seems to smuck. The now-former townsfolk of Ayan Baqur are reduced to wailing now, cant buy or sell. -- Garfield3d 4/3/2001
59.1s 84.6w nope no dungeon at those cords must be wrong.... -- Byren 4/4/2001
Correct location is 59.1S 84.0W -- Zopem 4/5/2001
The entrance and exit are covered by local Dires fauna, the foyer is quiet. The hallways are large, and the layout of the first part is simple. The first part is a good place for ravener and virindi puppet hunting. The back is a complex of corridors that circle back on a main hall. The back is where you will find the Hollow Minions, higher virindi, and their tusker pets. -- Doc Feelgood 8/21/2001

location.name: Note spawning
location.description: Ive seen a note lying on the ground here numerous times. I think its a new rumor from time to time. -- Immacolata

location.name: Tuskers Camping Spot
location.description:
Red Kates Personal Spot... Come and get it powerlevelers -- ibn IceHole
roflmao Poor Red kate..... -- Zenogias of MT 4/30/2001

location.name: Soul Fearing Quest - Tower 1
location.description: These are the correct coordinates for the NE tower of the so-called 3 towers quest properly known as the Soul Fearing quest. This is the first tower which must be assaulted (kill the lone Lich) before proceeding to Tower 2. -- Alif of HG

location.name: Soul Fearing Quest - Tower 2
location.description: These are the correct coordinates for the NW tower of the so-called 3 towers quest properly known as the Soul Fearing quest. This is the second tower which must be assaulted (kill the group of Liches inside) before proceeding to Tower 3. -- Alif of HG

location.name: Soul Fearing Quest - Tower 3
location.description: These are the correct coordinates for the SW tower of the so-called 3 towers quest properly known as the Soul Fearing quest.
