Assemble book binding + 8 a hastily scrawled notes. Give this completed book, Nuhmudiras Charm - to the golem in the dungeon so you can help decide her fate. Choose wisely. As of this patch, much is still yet unknown about the consequences. -- Ankhentomen MT 4/10/2002
First level contains 2 similar rooms which each contain about 6 Flammas (Fire Elementals) and book new for April. In the centre of a wall with no doors on one of the Flamma rooms is a hidden passage that goes down to 2nd level. 2nd level contains Shivvers (Frost Elementals) and youll need to handle up to about 3 at a time. You then get to the Labyrinth and the rest is already described by various walkthroughs. 4/18/2002
First level contains 2 similar rooms which each contain about 6 Flammas (Fire Elementals) and book new for April. In the centre of a wall with no doors on one of the Flamma rooms is a hidden passage that goes down to 2nd level. 2nd level contains Shivvers (Frost Elementals) and youll need to handle up to about 3 at a time. You then get to the Labyrinth and the rest is already described by various walkthroughs. -- Jaz SC 4/18/2002
Vicous man. that vicous man is a pk hes touched the pk stone at the end of this man find another pk lifestone outside the dungeon -- kamrin 4/18/2002

location.name: Glyander Cartoth
location.description: This is in Cragstone. He is upstairs. -- Solan Thommad

location.name: Brontynn Marshad's Cottage
location.description:
Part of the Thorsten Cragstones Armor & Axe quest.
See Glysander Cartoth in Cragstone for the key to the chest.
-- Dunc

location.name: Brontynn Marshad's Tower
location.description:
Part of the Thorsten Cragstones Armor & Axe quest
-- Dunc

location.name: Balthazar,Royal Guardian
location.description: Balthazar accepts notes from the Agents of the Arcanum and provides list of amulet carrying critters. Part of April Gelidite Quest. -- Annabel

location.name: Hidden Dungeon
location.description: Hidden Dungeon entrance is located in Underground city behind a secret wall. In this dungeon you will find Thorstens Armor and Thorstens Axe. Both house decorations. -- Greeneye

location.name: Wedding Trial Dungeon
location.description: Here you will find the symbols to be combined to get the 'Symbol of Marriage'. -- Greeneye

location.name: Sanctuary Wedding Hall
location.description: On top of a promentory with breathtaking views, this is the Sanctuary Wedding place. You can get here by invitation portal, or by running a ridge that connects to Sancutary itself. (expect to run a gauntlet of Level 100+ monsters if you do.) -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path Down
location.description: This is a way down off the Sanctuary Ridge. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Shallow Hive
location.description: The portal spawns randomly in both time and space, though is often within 5 clicks of the above at least i have never found it further. -- Sho NilremCan not be summoned or recalled. The Shallow Hive has an exit portal near the entry. It has Olthoi Warriors near the top, and adds Olthoi Evicerators near the bottom. There is a single Olthoi Noble spawn at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble for the North East stone ring at 49.2N, 74.7W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Carenzi Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Path up
location.description: Path up from Obsidian Plan Rim Marsh to Black Dominion. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Arcanum Research Facility
location.description:
Quest Flag. Place where u get the Decanters for the Isparian weapons. -- Greeneye
Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Dungeon is small, twisty, and inhabited with Martinate Similacra (40th) and Martinate Similacra Magicians (44th) -- new style monsters with fast regens. The Magicians drop resonable loot. Short route to the decanters is the door on your right as you portal in. -- Doc Feelgood 11/7/2002

location.name: Valley of the Grievvers
location.description: A circular valley full of grievvers, mainly Scrawed Grievvers, but a few Virulents as well. A Venomous Grievver guards the way into the valley with 2 Scrawed and a Virulent. Easily has 3 or 4 DOZEN grievvers when fully spawned. Coords listed are the middle of the valley, which is where youll find a network of small dirt mounds being tended by tiny Scuttling Grievvers. There are also a couple of Red Phyntos Wasps nearby, trapped in some sort of webbing strung up between small trees. -- Lit Wu-Zin

location.name: Arcanum Storehouse
location.description: The place where you go after Gelidite Library -- Samson

location.name: Sea Palace
location.description:
In the water, off the beach a ways. Some sort of palace with stone head megaliths making paths to it. No apparent enterance.
--Courtesy of Virindi Inquisitor and Blessed Red Flower. -- Garfield3d
The gray temple-like structure is four-sided and may be element related. The stone head nearest the temple is VERY close. If you can get on the head, perhaps you can get in. Regardless, I detected no objects or residents. -- Neko Neko 6/14/2002
This is actually Gaerlans Citadel... on the evening of July 11th 2002, this place erupted in a rainbow of elemental electricity shooting towards the sky as the water surrounding it bubbled with flame. These recent events come on the heels of the first sighting of Gaerlan who nearly killed Asheron at the Midsong Festival Stone, no doubt foreshadowing the upcoming battle between Asheron and Elysa against Gaerlan and Martine. Still no way up there, though, besides forming a PK ladder or jumping from the top of the nearest stone head with a 480+ jump skill... -- Confucius of FF 7/12/2002
The palace, now known as Gaerlans Citadel, is no longer in this location. Having taken flight and migrated SSW, it crash-landed in the mountains far northeast of Holtburg during the Verdict event of Sep 2002, where it now lies. Accessing the citadel is now part of the Gaerlan quest. -- Confucius of FF 2/16/2003

location.name: Grievver Caves
location.description:
Portal is tie able and recall able. Lots of Scrawed and Virulent. At the bottom is a dude called a Spinning Griever. Kill him and get silk. -- Dark Man - Sol
Do the place some justice! Its really quite beautiful and makes for a really neat experience... billowing webs and carrion everywhere. Come for the silk, stay for the ambience. The Spinner is past the first carrion chamber. Go down from there. -- Neko Neko 6/14/2002

location.name: Slithe Tradittor's Cabin
location.description:
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""Traveler. I have a tale to tell and a task I would put upon you. Were you to take this task on yourself, you will bear witness to things I have seen and a wondrous device I glimpsed but could not fathom or grasp.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""For you see, there is an artifact in a place unlike any that exists in Dereth.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""I am an explorer for the Explorer Society. In a desert region, I came upon a suspended walkway hung out from the edge of a cliff. The other end of the walkway was attached not to solid ground but was lost in the spinning light of a portal. I held my breath and stepped upon the walkway, half expecting it to collapse and throw me to the ground so far below. Yet, the walkway held my weight! I crept forward and stepped through the portal. I arrived on another walkway, or perhaps the same one somehow extended through the portal. There was a platform at its far end, then another walkway... Well, it is something you must see for yourself. Suffice it to say that I journeyed through this structure, all the while being assailed by vile creatures. Near the top of this construction I spied an artifact- a tall pedestal it was, with arcane shapes gyrating in the air above it. I know not its function but it was clear to me that this artifact, this device, is of some import. There are many things it could be and none, I believe, of small consequence! Before I was able to reach it, a wretched monster sent me back to my Lifestone! Later, I attempted to return, yet the portal would not permit me to pass. I know not why.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""I must study this device. I call it the ""Arcane Pedestal."" I even believe I have the means to create a version of it, but first I require an imprint of its morphology.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""I shall give you a copy of my notes and an Imaging Crystal. The notes show you the way to that place. The Imaging Crystal can be imprinted with the composition and design of this device. Return to me with the imprint embedded within the Crystal and I will study it and determine how to create it.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""The Arcane Pedestal! We shall have the Arcane Pedestal!"" -- Astalon Decurth
This is the start point for the June 2002 ""Arcane Pedestal & Map of Dereth"" Quest. Speak to Slithe Traddior for an item, then travel to the Precarious Sojourn Portal. You *must* be higher than level 30 for the NPC to issue you a Crystal. -- Nocturne, LC -- Nocturne, LC 6/22/2002

location.name: Verdentine Magnan
location.description: This guy, dressed as the Isparian equivalent of Spider Man, is the guy you give your Silk (from the nearby dungeon) to. Hell give it back and tell you what to do with it. Even if you dont have the silk, come up here and check out his armor. -- Neko Neko

location.name: Ruined Tower lifestone
location.description: found on morningthaw june 18 2002 -- dauthiatull

location.name: Tou-Tou to Lin Portal
location.description: 53.9S,74.3E Not sure how this got overlooked for so long -- Quixis Blight

location.name: East Fork Gazebo
location.description: An Olthoi Gazebo located in the lake just behind the East fork Dam on Marae Lassel. There are fast spawning Olitho Legionary’s around base and on the dam. Perchers on the Gazebo can reach Olithoi on the dam with bows and crossbows. Great XP! -- Burch

location.name: Skeleton Castle
location.description: Their is a Spinning Wheel here now for the Greiver Flag Quest. It is upstairs above the Skeleton Captain spawn location. -- Thrush of DT

location.name: Slithis Hill
location.description: A hillside swarming with Slithis tendrils, tentacles, and eye stalks of all levels. There must be over 100 here, the orange dots on the radar merge together to form a startlingly large orange blotch. No idea why the concentration is so high here. -- Confucius of FF

location.name: Revenant Pond
location.description: A small pond at the extreme end of the Vesayen Isles chain, bubbling with green gas. A group of half a dozen Revenants and Dark Revenants kneel in silent meditation at its shores, almost as if it were a shrine for something. -- Confucius of FF

location.name: The Callous Heart
location.description: If you choose to pull the plain lever in the Gelidite Library quest choosing to damn Nuhmudira, you are flagged as Merciless and portalled back to Kai Mallan at the entrance. He gives you some poratl gems to Callous Heart dungeon (timer: 3 per weeks). There is 3 parts, Right Wing (15+), Left Wing (30+) and High Grounds (45+). Many Elementals and High level golems. In each parts u can find a life giver jewelry (from +15 to +30 hp). -- Call

location.name: West Arwic Lifestone
location.description: Dont know why it disappeared from the database, thought Id put it back in.17/07/02 -- Shinobi of SC

location.name: Martine's Retreat
location.description:
Cool looking place. No monsters that I have found. Follow left wall to his study. On the right side is a tusker husk. On the left side is a letter. Striat ahead is a portal to his throne room. the best part is near the tusker husk on the wall. Go look its LOL funny. -- Dark Man - Sol
Owe and there is a bunch of shop keepers includeing an ARCH MAGE that sells plats for 44k etc just like the three racial ones. -- Dark Man - Sol 7/18/2002
WARNING!!! I think this is another vote setup. If you give him the letter first your voteing one way. If you give him the husk first your voteing the other way. -- Dark Man - Sol 7/18/2002
Now home to the Sunstone Gauntlet quest. Enter the Subterrainian Farms portal (20+). Have fun with the eye-candy, and the plentiful infesting monsters. (Olthoi Grubs, Servants, Gold and Jungle Wasps). Harker at the back is a heavily armored, fast regenning 95th level. You want his head to hand back in for the gauntlets. -- Doc Feelgood 8/6/2003

location.name: Hellfire Spawn
location.description:
These are the coords to where the hellfire that drops the Soll part spawns and sets off the relic bone spawn in the relic town , sometimes there are a few plasma and vapor golems on top of the spawn which you might have to clear but this is where they will eventually spawn around.
- Army Of Darkness {Frostfell} -- - SoD ClanNote that you must drop the Pyreal Forge Bellows and Sluice Gate Bar (Aerlinthe quest) before the Hellfire spawn here will generate a red SoLL infusion. And you may still have to kill the entire spawn up to several times afterwards before the boss Hellfire appears. (6/14/2004) -- Zarin of HG 6/16/2004

location.name: Small Temple
location.description:
same than the 2 others -- me
The temple at this area is in no way lame! Chomu and Dark Leechs in here..found many +8% mana c orbs in the chests that open with no keys necessary. The chest that a sik cant open tho, im curious, is this a questor chest? Also to clarify, this particular small temple is behind the ithaenc temple, same isle as sanctuary. Perhaps you dont care for this small temple but my bm/65 loves it! Its the toughest small temple I have found, and considering the exp and loot...Im very happy! Im considering getting a Lady Adjas key to try here considering that its not SIK openable...and on the isle. -- GRIMM 10/22/2002
Something else odd....I logged out..then back in here, and all the chests now cont be opened. This place is odd... However I did get large menos and alot of siks drop here as well. -- GRIMM 10/22/2002
Entrance is guarded with Chomu Sclavi, one of whom blocks the entrance. Chomu, Dark Magus and Dark Leeches inside. Dungeon is one room. Foyer is modestly hot. Entrance and exit are recallable, but not summonable. The small temples are the same layout inside, but different monster mixes. -- Doc Feelgood 12/16/2002

location.name: Floating Advocate Tower
location.description: In midair here. -- Quink

location.name: New Hive exit dropoff
location.description: This is where you come out when you take the New Hive exit portal. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: New Hive
location.description: Entrance portal is a random spawn on the north end of the plateau. Foyer is quiet. Individual rooms are large and convoluted, but the overall dungeon layout is simple. There is a big jump to get to the bottom. Rubble drops from a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble who will randomly spawn in place of the normal Noble at the bottom. -- Doc Feelgood 1/26/2003 Can not be summoned or recalled. Dungeon is full of Warriors at the top, with a few Mutilators and Swarm Evicerators towards the bottom. Exit portal at the very bottom after a large jump. Turn in at Timaru for the Timaru Totem of the Palenqual elder weapons quest. There is a single Olthoi Noble spawn in a side room at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble for the North Ring at 53.0N, 73.3W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Timaru Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Citidel Access Point
location.description: This is the Location in which you jump across to gain access to Gaerlans Citidel. -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Asheron's Platinum Golem
location.description: Part of the September Quest Event - Gaerlan's Citadel -- Jaz of SC

location.name: Ziggurat Dungeons
location.description:
Lightning Ziggurat - Lvl 20-39
Acid Ziggurat - Lvl 40-59
Fire Ziggurat - Lvl 60-79
Frost Ziggurat - Lvl 80+
The Lightning Ziggurat (20-39) has Lightning Elementals (Sparks, Synnasts and Voltarcs), level 83 Stasis Wisps and Granite Golems.
The Acid Ziggurat (40-59) has Strife Wisps, Coral Golems, and Acid Elementals, including Mox and Buillics.
The Fire Ziggurat (60-79) is full of Fire Elementals -- Flares, Flammas, Infernos, Hellfires, Chaos Wisps and a few Diamond Golems. Go NW at the the first maze area, and west at the second.
The Frost Ziggurat (80+) has Frost Elementals, Tempest Wisps, Acidic Diamond Golems and Platinum Golems.
Each dungeon is similar in design, with a pre-maze area where youll be fighting most of the creatures, a maze area (head up), and the end portion with the Platinum Golem.
When you reach the end, hand the Imbued Pyreal Nugget to the Golem and it will open a portal to the Proving Grounds. -- Jaz of SC

location.name: Hidden Valley Springs
location.description: A beautiful pond in a quiet, narrow valley in the shadows of the Tattered Ridge mountains. Probably one of the more beautiful outdoor locations in the whole game... would make a marvelous place for a lone cottage :) Many wood golems spawn nearby, as well as laigus/amploth lugies and various reedsharks. -- Confucius of FF

location.name: Frest Greevling
location.description: New for the October 2002 Patch, Festivus. Frest Greevling has an evil mansion that needs cleansing. Talk with Frest, and hell give you a journal detailing the history of the Mansion, as well as listing items he is in search off. -- Elder

location.name: Frest Greevling's Mansion
location.description: New for the October 2002 Patch, Festivus. Frest Greevling has an evil mansion that needs cleansing. Talk with Frest at 6.0N 43.7E, and hell give you a journal detailing the history of the Mansion, as well as listing items he is in search of. -- Elder

location.name: Olthoi Arcade
location.description:
Added 10/2002. Lots of Olthoi Harvesters. -- Kristn (WE)
Four levels, Olthois Harvesters on first, Gardeners on second, Drones (lvl 35) on third and Servants (lvl 45) on fourth. -- Lorcryst of FF 10/21/2002
On the fourth level down (olthoi servants) there is a potral to Olthoi Arcade Central. 30+ -- Hoig 4/22/2003

location.name: Marriage Location
location.description: Grand Sentinel Tretia will join a couple in union. -- Eriq

location.name: Fathomless Chasm
location.description:
Entrance is quiet, Foyer is quiet, and it is a staging area for four separate dungeons that are level restricted: 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-70, and 70+.
Entrance is tieable and summonable, but you must have visited the arcanium research facility south of Zaikhal and collected ten magic decanters before you can enter here. (Theres a 3-day timer between collecting decanters and completing quest. If youre not finished, you start over.)
There is no surface portal in staging area, and no monsters.
The inner dungeons start with a drop, and fighting elemental monsters -- different for each level range. There is a boss golem to kill at the bottom. The BDT here is to fill your decanters with pure mana, which is then used in making Isparian weapons.
-- Doc Feelgood
There are three drops. Each drop is heavily infested with elementals and golems. But, the spawn is slow -- if you clear a level, it will stay clear for many minutes. The level area after each drop is small but there are some pseudo respite areas were you can stand and control the rush at you.
You can fill decanters before the boss golem is dead -- click high on the waterfall, rather than low. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2002
Correction: you can enter without decanters, for, say, a corpse rescue. But without decanters, you have nothing to fill. -- Doc Feelgood 12/18/2002 Updated level restrictions/portal names/element:
20-39 - Fathomless Chasm Devex - Cold
40-49 - Fathomless Chasm Clough - Fire
50-59 - Fathomless Chasm Plummet - Acid
60-79 - Fathomless Chasm Descent - Lightning
80+ - Fathomless Chasm Abyss -- Neros 10/25/2003

location.name: Portal to Random locations
location.description: There is always a portal here, but it will point to different locations from time to time. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Temple of Forgetfulness
location.description:
Entrance and exit are hot with North Osteth fauna. The Guardian will ask you for an herb, using its spell-casting name. (talk about forgotten lore!) Herb required changes about every thirty seconds, so bring a selection.
Foyer is quiet. Run by or fight your way through copper, iron and obsidian golems to get to Inner Sactum portal. It may be a bug, but sometimes I got portaled to surface, rather than inner sactum.
Inner Sactum is quiet, just pick the proper gem and use it. Three week timer on these gems, and those of the Temple of Enlightenment. (same timer, use one or the other) -- Doc Feelgood
Herb does not change every 30 secs. it changes every time you click on the head.. so bring whatever you know the spell word for, and keep clicking till it asks for that. -- Eoin Cortorl 11/13/2002
Boquar- Mugwort, Cruath- Ginseng,Equin- Mandrake, Malar- Hyssop, Quavosh- dragonsblood, Roiga- Yarrow, Shurov- Comfrey, Tugak- Vervain, Volae- Eyebright, Yanoi- Bistort, Zojak- Hawthorn -- Eclipsa of FF 11/26/2002
Now also contains Attribute Gems: pick up a pair, one red, one green, combine and use. Two week timer on the pair. -- Doc Feelgood 1/28/2003

location.name: Temple of Enlightenment
location.description:
Entrance is at the cliff base, not on top, and the jump is difficult. Come by way of the beach. The Guardian will ask you for an herb, using it's spell-casting name. (talk about forgotten lore!) Herb required changes about every thirty seconds, so bring a selection. Foyer is quiet. Run by or fight your way through copper, iron and obsidian golems to get to Inner Sactum portal. It may be a bug, but sometimes I got portaled to surface, rather than Inner Sanctum. Inner Sanctum is quiet, just pick the proper gem and use it. Three week timer on these gems, and those of the Temple of Forgetfulness. (same timer, use one or the other) -- Doc Feelgood
Make sure you are carrying ONLY the book you were given when the statue portalled you into the temple. If you pick up another book or drop that book, you will be portalled back to the surface as Doc noted. -- Mage-One 11/15/2002
In the golem area, take either all lefts or all rights whenever the path forks. That's what the Guardian means when he tells you to follow the path ""with conviction."" -- Garfield3d 11/18/2002
Boquar- Mugwort, Cruath- Ginseng,Equin- Mandrake, Malar- Hyssop, Quavosh- dragonsblood, Roiga- Yarrow, Shurov- Comfrey, Tugak- Vervain, Volae- Eyebright, Yanoi- Bistort, Zojak- Hawthorn -- Eclipsa of FF 11/26/2002
Now contains Attribute Gems as well. Pick up a pair, red and green, combine and use. Two week timer on the pair. -- Doc Feelgood 1/28/2003

location.name: Tusker Emporium
location.description:
You will find the Tusker T-Shirt at the end of dungeon. Plus you will be able to buy a decoration plaque I survived the Tusker Emporium and tusker statues. -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance is at the bottom of the crater, there is a path down. Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Portals cannot be recalled, summoned or tied to. Dungeon is linear and long, long, long. Tuskers of 41st and 61st, and Tusker Minions of 32nd level crowd the halls. Spawn is medium. There are some trappy places. The eye candy respites between the long corridors are nice. The souvineer shop at the end is appropriately tacky, and quiet... a good wind down place. -- Doc Feelgood 11/14/2002
Until someone makes a map, if you make a right turn at every intersection, you will wind up at the Emporium at the bottom. 11/18/2002

location.name: Tusker Grotto
location.description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance/exit modestly hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet.. barely. Dungeon is standard tusker architecture, but the flood rooms are more thickly packed than average -- stamina is an issue in this dungeon. Crimsonback (24), Goldenback (30), and Tusker Kin (12) are the inhabitants. A small dungeon, with medium spawn rate. The exit is at the bottom past a series of flood rooms that look like wide corridors. No BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood 11/27/2002

location.name: Tusker Retreat
location.description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance/exit modestly hot, foyer quiet. Small dungeon, medium spawn rate. Exit is at bottom and relatively straight ahead. Architecture is standard tusker with corridors and flood rooms. Monsters are Male and Female Tuskers (16) and Tusker Kin (12). No BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood 11/27/2002

location.name: Tusker Habitat
location.description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Went here, and it's awesome! Liberators, and lots of them (7500 xp each). There are probably double or triple the number of tuskers here than in BSD, but they are spread out further. Would be great for fellowships.
Kermit the Quick ~ LC -- Kermit 11/18/2002
Entrance/exit is quite hot. Foyer is quiet. Monoculture dungeon, pure Liberator (61). Dungeon is medium small in size. The layout of the first part is symmetric and ""O"" shaped. The spawn rate is medium. Exit is at the far end of the O, take the ramp up. BDT is a Liberator Tusk on a tusker in the last flood room before the exit -- worth 75K and a recall gem. -- Doc Feelgood 11/27/2002

location.name: Tusker Honeycombs
location.description: You can find Assailers in here, and one of them at the very bottom drops an Assailer Tusk worth 8.33% xp for next lvl, and a token for Master of Slaughter title. -- Immacolata 7/21/2003

location.name: Tusker Temple
location.description:
Inside are a myriad of Tusker Slaves, Guards and Worshippers. There is also a Tusker Shrine deep inside. This portal is fully tieable, summonable and recallable. -- Jaz of SC
Worshippers are 72nd level and throw BV6's. Spawn is fast, and fighting is ""clumpy"". Layout is BSD-like -- there are flood rooms. Static Shrine portal takes you to Oolutanga's Refuge, the standard Isle entry spot. -- Doc Feelgood 11/14/2002

location.name: Tusker Temple
location.description:
-- Jaz of SC
Entrance is hot with local fauna. There is no exit. The entrance is recallable. Foyer is quiet, barely. This is the same layout as other Tusker Temple dungeons. The spawn is a thick mix of Male Tuskers, Female Tuskers and Tusker Kin. Expect to get jammed in a hallway if you try to just sprint through to the shrine at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

location.name: Tusker Temple
location.description:
-- Jaz of SC
Entrance is hot. The Foyer is quiet, barely. There is no exit portal, but you can Recall to the entrance portal. The layout is the same as the other two Tusker Shrine dungeons. The spawn is a thick mix of Crimsonback, Goldenback and Minions, so expect to get jammed in a hallway if you try to just sprint through to the shrine at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

location.name: Oolutanga's Refuge
location.description:
Welcome to Aphus Lassel! This is the town you appear in when you use a Tusker Gem or Shrine. -- The Spectre
The full service town at the entry point to the Tusker Isles. The shop keepers all talk Tusker, except for Brighteyes, the Tailor, who is leader of the human resistance. (not too surprisingly, since all the humans on the isles wear only towels, he has nothing to sell.) -- Doc Feelgood 11/15/2002

location.name: Tusker Lacuna
location.description:
Tusker Slaves through Devestators... A VERY nasty place, great for LARGE parties of 100+ folks. At the end are three tuskers, one of which drops a tusk that can be turned in for 5% of the xp required for your next level. -- The Spectre
XP for tusk is actually 12.5% -- dwJoker - LC 12/4/2002

location.name: Tusker Assault
location.description: Home to a large number of Plated and Rampager Tuskers, along with a mix of Tusker Loonies who cast Imperil VI on you... have fun. -- The Spectre

location.name: Rampage Bluff
location.description: More fun with Plated and Rampager Tuskers, along with thos ever fun Tusker Loonies who cast Imperil VII on you... -- The Spectre

location.name: Plated Rifts
location.description: Plated and Armored Tuskers, combined with Tusker Loonies and their wonderful Imperil spells... Watch out for the combination debuff/Bludgeon Vuln VII trap... -- The Spectre

location.name: Tusker Gauntlet
location.description: The name says it all... more super high level Tuskers than you can shake a stick at! Throw in the debuff traps, Bludgeon Vuln VII traps, and Imperil VIIs cast by mages and you have a party!! Is this the home of Bobo, King of the Tuskers...? -- The Spectre

location.name: Vengeance Caverns
location.description:
-- Jaz of SC
This is the heart of North Tusker Forest. Lvl 45+ Entrance is hot. Foyer is quiet. Mixed dungeon with Silver Tuskers and Temple Worshipers. -- Doc Feelgood 11/15/2002

location.name: Tusker Tunnels
location.description:
Actual Location of Tusker Tunnels. Plated Tuskers Give 60,000 Xp. Also Tusker tusk at bottom gives you 5% xp for next level, token, gem Title: Bloodletter -- Astalon Decurth
Inside the dungeon, the larger red glows on the ground denote where a dispell/vuln trap is. You can avoid all traps(except one near the end) by running beside the walls. Entrance doesn't have a spawn but sometimes Tuskers get drawn inside. Only exit is at the bottom. -- Garfield3d 1/20/2003

location.name: Tusker Burrow
location.description:
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna
the foyer is quiet. Monoculture dungeon of Female Tuskers (16). Layout is a symetric fan-out of corridors headed down into flood rooms, which means the first fight at the top is a doozey. Dungoeon is medium small in size and spawn is medium. The exit is at the end of a big flood room on one of the center fingers. BDT is Female Tusker Tusk worth 15K XP and a Tusker Island Portal Gem when handed in to Brighteyes -- four drop off of Tuskers in the final flood room next to the exit. -- Doc Feelgood 11/30/2002

location.name: Tusker Lodge
location.description:
From the AC Vault. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance and Exit are hot with local fauna; the foyer is quiet. This is a monoculture of Male Tuskers (16). The layout is light and airy looking, and bilaterally symetric, and you go up and up, instead of down and down. The exit is at the top. The BDT is a Male Tusker Tusk worth 17.5K and a Tusker Island Portal Gem when handed in to Brighteyes. Four drop from Tuskers in the room which has the exit. Dungeon is medium in size, and the spawn is medium. -- Doc Feelgood 11/30/2002
Level cap removed. Now 5+. -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002

location.name: Tusker Cave
location.description:
From the AC Vault. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance is hot, exit is quiet... barely. Foyer is quiet. Dungeon is monoculture Crimsonback Tusker (24), symmetric, and the end room is found going up rather than down. Slightly more interesting graphic style than most nearby dungeons. Size is medium, and the spawn a bit faster than medium. The BDT is a Crimsonback Tusker Tusk, but they are found on Tuskers *near* the exit room, not in the exit room. Tusk is worth 20K XP and a gem when handed in to Brighteyes. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2002
Level cap removed. Now 12+. -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002

location.name: Tusker Cavern
location.description:
From the AC Vault. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance/exit are hot with Central Forest Fauna. Foyer is very hot, it is part of one of two huge flood rooms that make up the first part of the dungeon. (There is a respite corridor beyond the second flood room.) The dungeon is small, the spawn medium fast. Most of the dungeon is the first two flood rooms. Exit is at bottom. Spawn is pure Goldenback Tusker (30), and the BDT is a Goldenback Tusker Tusk found on tuskers near the exit. Tusk is worth 30K XP and a gem to Brighteyes. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2002
Level cap removed. Now 15+ -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002

location.name: Tusker Pits
location.description:
Silvers, Tusk worth 500K and Silver Serf title. From the AC Vault. Silver Serf?! As in Silver Surfer?! lol. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance and Exit are in a thick spawn of local fauna. Foyer is quiet. Layout is complex, but symmetric, with several jumps. Dungeon is medium size and spawn in medium rate. Exit is down and west off the main bottom room. Spawn is pure Silver Tusker. BDT is Silver Tusker Tusk, found on tuskers spawning in main bottom room. -- Doc Feelgood 12/10/2002

location.name: Path out
location.description: This is a way out of the Tusker Emporium crater. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tusker Quarters
location.description:
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna. No exit near entrance. Exit is at the bottom just off a big room. Foyer is quiet. Architecture is lots and lots of tunnels and rooms filled with pure Tusker Slaves. Monoculture dungeon, no BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood
BDT is Tusker Slave tusk (100K) found on tuskers in flood room in front of exit. The layout is a fanout of flood rooms from the entrance. The exit, and tusks, are in the center of the fan out. -- Doc Feelgood 12/14/2002
The floorplan is the same as that of Tusker Abode. -- Doc Feelgood 2/20/2003

location.name: Tusker Encampment
location.description:
Located on the hilltop. Entrance is quiet... barely
exit is hot. Foyer is quiet. Liberators, Redeemers and minions throughout
Slaves on 2nd level
Guards on 3rd. No exit near entrance. Exit is found *up* using left hand rule from the entrance. No BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Portal to Oolutanga's Refuge
location.description:
The shrine located at the back of Tusker Temple will take you to Oolutanga's Refuge. This is the same as the random spawn portals, but it is always here. -- Doc Feelgood
Exit at 2.3N, 95.5E -- Doc Feelgood 11/15/2002

location.name: N. Tusker Forest Ford
location.description:
A passage from the east island to the west island. Keep in mind that the west island fauna is considerably tougher than east island at this crossing point. -- Doc Feelgood
The best I can tell, this is the only crossover area. -- Doc Feelgood 11/28/2002

location.name: Chapel of Mowen
location.description:
-- Gripen
Entrance and exit are modestly hot
foyer is very hot: a narrow passage connecting directly to a flood room. Monsters are Tusker Worshippers (72), Sliver Tuskers (120) and Armored Tuskers (300). Layout is narrow corridors connecting flood rooms. Spawn is fast. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2002

location.name: Tusker Holding
location.description:
-- OmniTek
Entrance and Exit are hot with local fauna. Dungeon is pure Rampager, with Rampager Tusks dropping at the two exits. Layout is the same as Tusker Abode: a long, winding, statue-lined central hall with ""U"" shaped side corridors. Halfway through is a pit to jump in, with a bridge to land on. If you don't land on the bridge, you have to recall out, unless you can jump out. (A good jumper can do that.) After the pit, the dungeon ""twins"", and exits and tusks are available on either side. There are several debuff traps, in particular in ""debuff corridor"" about a quarter way through -- bring your creature-enhancing magic stuff. (Rampagers are hollow hitters, so protect magic isn't going to do a lot.) The Rampager Tusk is worth 6% of the XP for your current level. -- Doc Feelgood 1/3/2003
Inside the dungeon there are heads you can jump on to cast safely. The lava at the bottom of the pit is safe to swim in. Also, Rampagers aren't hollow hitting, so protections and impenetrability will help a lot. -- Garfield3d 1/20/2003

location.name: Riptide Channel
location.description: I made it across near this spot twice. It can be done. You just gotta keep turning 90 deg back and forth. However I also got stuck once and had to loggout and back on to get unstuck. I dont advise going this way. -- Dark Man - Sol 11/28/2002

location.name: South Tusker Forest
location.description: South Tusker Forest, the easiest part of Iron Coast, begins here. The easy part lies east of a line south from here through Tusker Lodge (.2N, 98.1E) and southwest to the beach at 3.1S, 95.9E. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: South Tusker Forest, east edge
location.description:
The edge between South and Central Tusker Forest on the west beach. Northwest is bigger monsters, Southeast is smaller monsters. -- Doc Feelgood
Correction: this is the west edge. -- Doc Feelgood 11/28/2002

location.name: Tusker Freehold
location.description: Entrance/exit is hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet. Architecture is lots of flood rooms. The exit is at the bottom. Monsters are Liberators (61), Redeemers (41), and Minions (32). No BDT that I could find -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Central Tusker Forest, west edge
location.description: Location on the beach that divides Central Tusker forest from North Tusker forest. Tougher monsters are west of here, along a line from here northeast to Oolutangas Refuge. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: North edge, North Tusker Forest
location.description: Point on the beach that ends North Tusker Forest. South of here are tough monsters, on a line going from here back to Oolutangas Refuge. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tusker Armory
location.description:
Entrance and exit are very hot with Silver Tuskers and equivalents. Foyer is quiet, but people will lead stuff back into it. No exit near entrance, exit is two levels down. Monoculture dungeon, pure Armored Tusker (Lv 300). Layout is flood rooms and short corridors. The corridors are narrow, many can be blocked by a single player. Looks like it will be a good leveling place. -- Doc Feelgood
Dungeon is medium size, and the BDT is an Armored Tusker Tusk, worth 300K. -- Doc Feelgood 1/3/2003

location.name: The Floating City
location.description: Yes this is a random dungeon, yes there are allready a billion and one entries for it, yes I am apolagising for entering another one, but I tried several times to add to the Floating City (Primary) thread and managed only to put in one line... so here is what I was trying to say, assuming this adds itself. There is far too much speculation and roumour on this thread, so, since I know virtually everything there is to know about the city, let me set a few things straight. Firstly, portals may now be tied and recalled to, they cant be summoned but if you see one on the landscape, tie to it, and camp it for any friends who may want to tie too (random portals only disapear when the landblock resets, so if your watching the portal it wont go anywhere). Secondly, there is no pattern to the portals apearing, they are RANDOM! Thirdly, multiple portals can spawn on the surface, the city is broken up into 8 different landblocks (7 called The Floating City, and one The Golem Sanctum), and I think all of them can be created as random landscape portals. I think the golem sanctum only spawns in the dires but I cant confirm that). Thus all these reports saying when you enter go this way are useless because it all depends on which part of the city you have entered. Now, when you enter the city, your first step is to do a /loc and work out which landblock your in, then before jumping off anything or going through any portals, check ACMaps.com which has maps of the city (done by yours truely). So far Ive only done 6, Im waiting on the random portals to take me back to the final two landblocks. That raises another point, many of the portals between the different parts of the city are random as well, which is why you should tie to the first one you found, as you may not be able to get back to explore more. Inside the city, all exit portals, and lots of the internal portals (all helpfully called just The Floating City) are random, but unlike random portals on the surface, they are allways in the same place, but every month (on patch day) they change their destination. On the maps I have made all portals are identified as either stable or random, stable portals all have a return portal next to them to facilitate two way travel. Lockpicking is not required, but does make a little more of the city accessible, it is I believe posible to get everywhere by random portals but random portals are of course random. The toughest door is resistance 322, and worth picking if you can because it leads on to a stable portal to another section. There are what apears to be two significant points of interest in the city, one is the golem sanctum, an absolute labyrinth of tightly twisting passages and more junctions than I can count, all filled with Iron golems, and at the end one obsidian with a dispell trap and a chest of crap loot. The other point of interest is something everyone should see at least once in their life, a floating advocate tower in the direlands (3.7S / 69.2W), about as high above the ground as the tou-tou lighthouse is tall, and with a bright pink energy fountain inside it. On top is a random portal to the direlands somewhere. At the begining of the Golem Sanctum is a stable portal back to the city, and a random direlands portal, I have seen these portals go to North Direlands Valley Junction, and my old favorite hunting ground North Direlands Land Bridge. During this months patch I also found a portal whos name and location I didnt write down, but the drop was so hot I died before I materialised. Shortly after that they did a server rollback and the portal changed again. Within the city you will find a number of Strained Books, which cannot be picked up but give you some interesting lore about the place, and some interesting insights into the Empyrians past. In all I would say this whole place is priety much a place only to come if you like exploring and lore, the monsters inside are for the most part, low level undead and a few banderlings, there are 2 virindi servants, and 2 revanants, and thats about it for the high level monsters. However, it does make a wonderful alternative to the Abandoned Mines as a subway, because while the portals change every month, there are a lot of exit portals and they drop you in often rare towns like Kara. A few non town portals spawn, but rarely, and all Ive noticed is Heartland which has to be one of the most common random portals (and the most boring). Anyways, Im begining to ramble on without really saying much, so I will just say that the floating city is a great place to visit, and a nice place to tie to and use as a subway (incidentally the exit portals can be tied to and summoned, so when you find a Kara portal, take a copy of it for your guild, its a nice quiet town that sells level 6 scrolls for those rich enough to afford them). Should anyone be interested in learning more, go take a look at ACMaps.coms maps and post a message on this thread, I look at it occasionally, alternatively if your on harvestgain, just tie to the city and use it to get arround, Im sure well bump into each other there (tho its never happened yet, portals in are VERY rare). I> -- Tyr on HG

location.name: Portal to Oolutanga's Refuge
location.description:
The Tusker Shrine that will portal you is located at the back of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood
Exit at 2.3n, 95.5e. -- Doc Feelgood 12/3/2002

location.name: Static Portal to the Tusker Islands
location.description: Exit at 2.3N, 95.5E. The Shrine that will take you to the Tusker Islands is located at the back of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Static Portal to the Tusker Islands
location.description: Exit at 2.3N, 95.5E. The Tusker Shrine that will take you to Tusker Island is located at the back of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Direlands Desert Edge
location.description: Exit at 78.7S, 73.4W Part of the easy route from the Crystal Caves to the Hall of Lost Light. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Spirit Cell
location.description:
Part of the Gift Box Quest.. Need to be flagged to enter the portal by giving a Iolite Gem (Retrieved from a Student in one of the towns) to the NPC Outside (Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb) -- Astalon Decurth
Fast becoming obsolete since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/16/2003

location.name: Access to Crystal Mines
location.description:
Destination: Access to Crystal Mines (70.5N,8.1W) Part of the Gift Box Quest (Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb -- Astalon Decurth
Fast becoming obsolete since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc F

location.name: Holtburg Portal
location.description: Destination: Holtburg Portal (41.6n, 33.7e) Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Crystal Mine Low
location.description:
-- Astalon Decurth
Watch that first step! This is a medium-large, mazy place filled with golems. The top is sandstone, then copper, then granite. Keep heading down. When you run into a room thick with irons youre close to the BDT, which is in a chest. -- Doc Feelgood 12/23/2002

location.name: Crystal Mine New Isparinas
location.description: -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Crystal Mine Mid
location.description:
-- Astalon Decurth
same layout as low. Contains Iron, Granite, Glacial and Obsidian golems. -- Doc Feelgood 12/23/2002

location.name: Crystal Mine Extreem
location.description: -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Crystal Mine High
location.description:
-- Astalon Decurth
Contains Obsidian, Oak and Magma golems. -- Doc Feelgood 12/23/2002

location.name: Access to Crystal Mines
location.description:
Destination: Crystal Mines 70.5N, 8.1W -- Astalon Decurth
Fast becoming obsolete, and inaccessible, since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/16/2003

location.name: Yanshi Namoon
location.description: A nicely equipped village. The merchants are a mage, healer, farmer and weaponsmith. Weaponsmith buys weapons and armor, but does not sell arrows This is an excellent base point for adventures into western Greenmire swamp. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: East end of Zelta's Face
location.description: East end of the Zeltas Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: West end of Zelta's Face
location.description: The west end of Zeltas Face cliff -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Zelta's Face
location.description: A high cliff along the south Farsi Island coast. This divides the beach from the interior. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Precarious Sojourn Valley
location.description: Home of the fantastic floating circles and floating tower. Come here for the wallmap of Dereth, and to fill your Imaging Crystal. Normal way in is by using the Precarious Sojourn Portal, but, the valley can be run into from across Direlands wilderness, and if you have a ferocious jump, you may be able to hop onto one of the circles from a nearby cliff. Spawn at the top of the floating tower is very fast, and the undead loot is good. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Fermi's Face
location.description: A long unclimbable cliff separating beach from the inland areas. This cliff extends from 51S, 47W to 60S, 48W. Fermis Face is the eastern edge of Fermis Pockland. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Spine Ridge, Fermi's Pockland
location.description: A north-south running ridge through the center of Fermis Pockland. The Pockland is a diamond-shaped area from: 50S, 45W on the north, between 55S, 43W and 55S, 50W on the east and west, and 60S, 48W on the south. There are numerous craters in this area ringed by mostly unclimbable cliff walls. The eastern edge is the Fermis Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: South end, Fermi's Face
location.description: The south end of Fermis Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: North end, Fermi's Face
location.description: The north end of Fermis Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Inland Sea Vista
location.description: Northmost point of Fermis Pockland, and a pleasing view of the Inland Sea. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Fangtooth Vista
location.description: A great view of Pockland and the Black Hills. Overlooks Dungeon of Corpses. Get to it by jumping down from the nearby hillside. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: South Direlands to Sho Roadside
location.description: Exits at 27.9S, 68.4E. -- Soo Yung -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Bridge Span (Western Advocate Tower)
location.description: Western Advocate Tower of Bridge span -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Bridge Span (Eastern Advocate Tower)
location.description: Eastern Advocate Tower of Bridge span -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Large Castle
location.description: Nice Castle but its Empty -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Fallen Advocates Spire
location.description: Fallen Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Small Tower
location.description: Small Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Small Tower
location.description: Small Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Small Tower
location.description: Small Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Small Tower
location.description: Small Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Small Tower
location.description: Small Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Small Tower
location.description: Small Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Twisted Advocates Tower
location.description: Twisted Advocates Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Twisted Advocates Tower
location.description: Twisted Advocates Tower -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Meeting Hall Style Building
location.description: Meeting Hall Style Building -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Large BZ Statue Overlooking a Vally
location.description: Large BZ Statue Overlooking a Vally -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Empyrean Power Plant
location.description: Empyrean Power Plant -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Large Castle
location.description: Nice Castle But its Empty -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Large Castle
location.description: Nice Castle But its Empty -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Floating Advocates Spire
location.description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Dark Tree Crystal Mine
location.description:
Cannot be Recalled, Linked, or Summoned. Restricted to characters of Level 40 or greater. For the new Gift Box Quest -- Astalon Decurth
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet. Dugeon is medium-size and mazy. Inhabitants are Granite, Iron and Obsidian Golems. BDT is in two chests on a non-descript corridor at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 3/27/2003

location.name: Caul Asylum
location.description: Singularity Recall Scroll dungeon. This portal cannot be recalled, linked or summoned. Dungeon is large, dendritic and filled with locked and levered doors. If youre after the scroll, bring a good lockpicker and a couple lockpicks, this person will be busy. Inhabitants are many kinds of 100-115 level monsters -- some mage nasty, some melee nasty. The quest takes a long time, bring buff capability. You can log out and log back in here. The eye candy is good, so dont rush your way through. The dungeon consists of several parts, and a map is a big help. You can also obtain one of 3 level 7 quest rings from the key guardians of each section. -- Astalon Decurth -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Bachus Flufens Cottage
location.description: Bachus Flufens Cottage -- Dunc -- Doc Feelgood No longer contains Bachus Fflufen. Now contains a runed chest and Hea Itealuan, Nualuan and Windreave. Also, completely surounded by Hea. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

location.name: Chop Hill
location.description: A perfectly round steep-walled hill with a flat top. Looks like an engraving when viewed from one of the surrounding, slightly higher, hills. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Valley of Death Back Door
location.description: Discovered by Mehmet II, Tazzywon, and Confucius of Frostfell, this is a tiny crabbling pathway up the back mountains into the valley of death. Its hard to find but a good shortcut if youre coming from the north. Prepare to face level 900 tuskers on your descent inward. -- Confucius of FF

location.name: South entrance to Dire Dales
location.description: A portal drop out point and land entrance to the Dire Dales. Jan 03 patch has brought new uber monsters to the area north of this dropout. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tusker Barracks
location.description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance/Exit are hot. Layout is a matrix of small rooms and narrow, blockable, corridors. Spawn is pure Tusker Guard. The BDT is a Tusker guard tusk, found on Tuskers in the flood room in front of the exit hallway. Size is smallish and the spawn is medium rate. -- Doc Feelgood 12/14/2002
Re-entered into AC-Spedia database with correct co-ords. -- Jaz of SC

location.name: Lothar's Rock
location.description: Here lies the spirits and memories of a warrior and friend. -- Yew Wan Sum

location.name: Kleeoh
location.description: To begin the Bobo Quest Kleeoh Speaking with her flags you to enter the Behind the Waterfall portal at 8.7S, 85.7E (Levels 80+). -- Astalon DecurthWatching the local fauna celebrate your visit to Kleeoh is quite a site! -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

location.name: Behind the Waterfall
location.description:
There will be four main dungeon sections: each in sequential order
Tusker Warriors Lair
Tuskers Food Storage
Legend of Tusker King
Throne of the Tusker King
Inside are Assailers, Devestators, Annihilators (a few), Reapers, Obsidian Chittiks and Tusker Sycophants, not to mention dispel traps and Tuskers Gift traps. Many different sections on the way down.
-- Astalon Decurth
This is the realm of the legendary Tusker King, Oolutanga (a.k.a. Bobo). He is located in the Throne of the Tusker King part (the 4th part). Talk to him to get portaled to the prep area for the final battle with Mowen Udaun, a huge level 900 tusker who flattens the unwary without a second thought. Buff in this little room, but dont go thru the next portal until youre ready as the drop is hot. Like Gaerlan, you dont need to kill him to get your reward (just register a hit on him) and once hes dead, take the portal that spawns and youll wind up back at Bobo. Hell give you a monkey paw with one wish (or if you got the kill on Mowen, it has 3 wishes) - take the paw to the treasure room portal and use it on the tusker statues inside. The Item Enchantment one the Recall Aphus Lassel spell directly into your spellbook, and the others give you XP towards an indicated skill. The Greed statues will fill your packs completely with I, X, or M notes. The person with the 3-wish tusker paw can use three statues. The funny thing about Oolutanga is that he appears as an object (white arrows around him when clicked and IDd), could this just be an elaborate ruse...? -- Confucius of FF 2/6/2003

location.name: An Archive
location.description:
An Archive Portal Quest Starts in Eastham when talking to Astara Duskshield Need key from Iron Golem Guardins outside at 62.9S, 36.4E Inside are Lichs, Warlocks of the Blood, champion of the blood, -- Astalon Decurth
Correction: Astara is found in Rithwic, not Eastham... -- Greeneye 2/22/2003

location.name: Tower Base Dungeon
location.description: Part of the Eastham boy quest. Iron, Granite, Glacial, Obsidian Golems, Portal inside to Upper Tower- Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Abandoned Armory Portal
location.description:
Home of the Aegis Shield.
Full of undead. No level restrictions, cannot tie/summon/recall to the portal.
Full of Revenants, Dark Revenants, Dark Maguses and Dark Leeches. -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Geyser
location.description: This is a steam spewing geyser in a pit, in the middle of nowhere. I came across it while looking for Black Claw Raiders. It is guarded by 2 blue phyntos wasps, in the middle of territory full of Diamond Golems and other nasties. -- Toss of FF

location.name: Marescent Gateway
location.description: Lifestone near Marescent Plateau portal -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: New Style Lifestone
location.description: New Style Lifestone -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: New Style Lifestone
location.description: New Style Lifestone -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: Northern Shore Lifestone
location.description: On the beach, in the north, not too far from where Olthoi live. -- Garfield3d

location.name: Olthi North Lifestone
location.description: Olthi North Lifestone on Eastern Coast -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: New Style Lifestone
location.description: New Style Lifestone located SW of the Essence of Enchantment -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: New Style Lifestone
location.description: New Style Lifestone -- Astalon Decurth

location.name: West Entrance to Valley of Death
location.description:
North of OP. New monsters, densely populated. -- Astalon Decurth
This seems to be a main entrance to VoD. Hunting parties often form up here and occasionally the Tremendous Monongua is near by. Mahogony and Oak chests spawn in the area. Critters in the area to the North often measure their health in thousands of HPs. Resistances and regen rates are high. Suggest only the strongest of players or fellowships made up of level ~80+ characters venture into this area. -- Dei Ray -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: East end of Flower Area
location.description: This is the eastern end of the Giant Flower Area. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: East Impassible Pass
location.description: East of here the central passes through the west landbridge area are climable and passable. Here, and west, they are not. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Jump through pass
location.description: Its a tight N-S pass, but you can jump through it, if you have a reasonable jump. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Direlands Northwest Shore Portal
location.description: Exit at 5.8N, 91.0W. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Four way valley
location.description: Entrances to Huey Crater (south) and Dewey Crater (north) interect with the E-W valley between them. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Entrance to Louey Crater
location.description: A big ramp leading into the crater. Scenic views inside all three of these craters. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: South Direlands Landbridge Portal Dropout
location.description: A randomly spawning portal, but the dropout is close to the Abandonned Armory Dungeon. If you want to fight mobs of high level undead, you want a tie to this portal. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Tusker Abode
location.description:
Entrance/Exit are modestly hot. Foyer is hot with two tuskers who then call up a flood room of stuff. Monoculture dungeon, pure Redeemers (41st). Layout is a main hallway lined with statues and U shaped side corridors. Mid-way down the first level hallway is a lava pit. Lava is harmless, but you must jump on to the hard-to-see bridge in the center of that pit to continue, or jump out of the lava on to the bridge. -- Doc Feelgood
After the jump the dungeon splits into two symmetric sides. BDT is Redeemer Tusk worth 50K, found on tuskers near the exit portal at either end. -- Doc Feelgood 12/13/2002
Level cap removed. Now just 20+ -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002
-- Jaz of SC

location.name: Tumerok Fort
location.description: Location of 2nd Key in Overlords Sword quest -- Jaz of SC

location.name: Mask Clan Training Camp
location.description:
Tumerok Mask Clan Training Camp, Assault Weapons Quest -- Astalon Decurth
Entrance and exit are hot
foyer is quiet. Come here for Tumerok Banner parts from the Mask Tribe. -- Doc Feelgood 4/25/2003
This is a head up dungeon. You are going the right way if you go through the room with a Lt. behind a grate. The Controllers, and the back of the dungeon, are after the high bridges. -- Doc Feelgood 4/29/2003

location.name: Falcon Clan Training Camp
location.description:
Entrance and Foyer are quiet. The dungeon is large and mazy, and filled with mid-level Tumeroks from Standard Bearers to Tumerok Commanders. Spawn ranges from medium to very fast.
You seek the three parts of a Tumerok Banner, which you will then assemble and hand in for an Assault Orb. (Apr 03 patch) -- Doc Feelgood
Left hand rule will get you deeper in the dungeon fairly efficiently. -- Doc Feelgood 4/26/2003

location.name: Shreth Training Camp
location.description:
Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Come here for tumerok banner parts from the Shreth tribe. -- Doc Feelgood
Exit from the first room complex is in the SE corner. Jump from the following bridge to shortcut to Commanders/Controllers. -- Doc Feelgood 4/26/2003

location.name: Reedshark Training Camp
location.description:
Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Come here for banner parts from the Reedshark Tumerok tribe. -- Doc Feelgood
Layout is sinuous corridors connecting big, fern-filled rooms -- not too hard to navigate with follow your nose navigation. Final room looks like the floor of a big modern office buidling. -- Doc Feelgood 4/29/2003

location.name: Gromnie Training Camp
location.description:
Entrance and Exit are covered by one distant local fauna spawn point, foyer is quiet. Come here for Tumerok Banner parts from the Gromnie tribe. -- Doc Feelgood
Dungeon is big and mazy, the layout is similar to Serpent Training camp. Tumerok Controllers (for Crests) are way, way in the back of the dungeon. The end is a big, leafy room, with an exit, and fast spawning controllers. Oddly, a large percentage of the tummies here drop insignia. -- Doc Feelgood 4/27/2003

location.name: Ulgrim's Island Portal
location.description: Exit at 94.8S, 9.7W. Bring the Drunken Mage a Wah Chons Winter Lager from Wah Chon, the Nanto Barkeep, and he will open this portal to Ulgrims Island. -- Doc Feelgood The exit coords were removed from this portal in order to prevent map programs from incorectly using it. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Serpent Clan Training Ground
location.description: Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Come here to find Serpent Clan Tumerok banner parts. Layout is big and mazy, and there may be several different bottoms. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Mt. Ulgrim
location.description:
A hill that looks to have been a very small volcano at one time; surrounded by 30-foot tall flowers and a short run from Ulgrim's cottage. No monsters spawn on this island. -- Confucius of FF
This island now features a whole lot of ""small"" golems, ranging from level 95 Small Water Golems to level 135 Small Magma Golems. Cute and extremely slow, but powerful; bring friends. -- Confucius of FF 7/17/2003

location.name: Ulgrim's Basement
location.description:
This dungeon is found in the basement floor of Ulgrims Cottage on Ulgrims Island, which is accessible by either using Ulgrims Recall Spell or giving the Drunken Madman in the tower near Baishi a mug of Winter Lager bought from the barkeep in Nanto.
When approached, Ulgrim will ask you to fetch him a mug of his special Home Brew in his basement. Enter through the portal in his basement and marvel at the amazing array of decorations on the walls and floors, probably the most impressively decorated place in all of AC. Some of the items are recognizeable, some arent, some are unusual (like Ulgrims vast collection of monster heads), and some are just silly (like the Holy Handgrenade of Antioch, specially imbued with the Rabbit Slayer property). This dungeons worth seeing just for the decorations, if nothing else.
There are many items to get in this dungeon, the primary one being the Home Brew. Take the Home Brew to Ulgrim (dont drink it -- 14 day timer!) and hell give you the Casting Stein that has a mana C bonus of 7% and also casts Stam to Mana IV. While killing your way through the dozens of tiny white and brown mice (which respawn like crazy and have extremely high attack skill, even though they do little damage), youll randomly find a Golden Key, which unlocks all the locked chests and doors in the basement. All locked chests and doors are easily pickable, as well, so the key is not necessary for LP characters. They also sometimes drop a block of cheese, which is ironic as its 50 times the size of the mouse carrying it.
The Golden Key can be used on either of Ulgrims storage chests, in which one can find the Hangover Cure, an Ust, Stout, Winter Lager, and Peppermint sticks. Alternately it can be used to unlock the Treasure Room door which is hidden behind a wall of tapestries near the storage chests. Behind the Treasure Room Door is a room full of glittering piles of Treasure (worth 200k and hookable on floor hooks -- 28 day timer), a Golden Gromnie inscribed by Ulgrim (no timer, but unusable for purchasing mansions), and a Lock Box that contains a simple gold ring inscribed by Ulgrim with the message Lo Bnaseuim (28 day timer).
Upon returning to Ulgrim, you can give him almost any item found in his dungeon and hell say funny and witty things, most notably doing his Gollum impersonation when you give him the gold ring. Also, if you give him the Peppermint sticks, hell give you a Peppermint Pumpkin Pie that drains 20 points of stamina when eaten. -- Confucius of FF

location.name: Ulgrim's Island to Madman's Tower
location.description:
Tieable but not summonable, hand sake to Ulgrim and he will summon a portal to the top of the Madmans Tower, where you will fall toward the Madmans head =P
Discovered by:
David ibn Jensen -- David ibnJensen
Drops at:
53S, 61E -- David ibn Jense 5/18/2003

location.name: Ahurenga
location.description: Home to the Hea Tumerok tribe this small town is located at the western most side of Marae Lassel surrounded by swamp land. There a npc that goes by the name of Hea Arantah and he will reward you with the death of a Aun Hunter named Aun Ralirea. -- AR

location.name: Holtburg Fishing Holes
location.description:
Multiple fishing holes where you can catch minnows and guppies all day! -- Khaos
They are also in Rithwic, Cragstone, Nanto, Yaraq and Shoushi. -- Immacolata 5/19/2003

location.name: Holtburg Lawn Chess
location.description: Come play chess. -- Immacolata

location.name: Rithwic Fishing Hole
location.description: Bring yer waders and yer lures! -- Immacolata

location.name: Shoushi Fishing Hole
location.description: Ah the tranquility of fishing on the plank bridge at river Prosper. -- Immacolata

location.name: Yaraq Fishing Hole
location.description: Overlooking the beautiful inner sea, come standing on the pier and fish! -- Immacolata

location.name: Sword of Frozen Fury
location.description: Sword of Frozen Fury Quest -- Jaz of SC

location.name: Cragstone Fishing Hole
location.description: Probably Dereths dampest fishing hole at the time being. Come fish by the sound of the roaring Prosper waterfall. -- Immacolata

location.name: Nanto Fishing Hole
location.description: The only fishing pond of Dereth so far. And the smallest. Probably also Dereths highest elevated fishing hole. And Dereths southernmost Fishing hole! And .... Ok Ill stop here. -- Immacolata

location.name: Virindi Complex
location.description:
Part of the Sword of Frozen Fury quest -- Jaz of SC
Entrance and exit are quiet. Portals are not tieable/summonable, but have no level limit. First part is jumping down levels. Second part is a portal maze. (the ""path book"" story contains clues to the proper sequence.) Third part is mazey, left hand rule works well. Inhabitants are a wide mix, including: Augmented Drudge, Virindi Observers, Slave through Silver Tuskers, and Terebrous Hollow Minions. There are two Virinidi Executors, but they don't have to be fought -- just run by them. BDT is a Signet Ring dropped by any of several Virindi Inquisitors (90th) at the back. Good eye candy through out. -- Doc Feelgood 5/22/2003
You cannot enter this dungeon without speaking to Syltyn Rylyn in Glenden Wood first. -- Immacolata 5/25/2003
There's a timer on how often you can do it. Not even sure if it's repeatable. Mage Syltyn Rillon tells you, ""I hope you make good use of the sword you obtained so recently.""

location.name: Holtburg Swamp Chess
location.description: Conveniently placed chess board in a patch of swamp! Couldnt you have found a better spot, Turbine? -- Immacolata

location.name: North Shore Dires Lifestone
location.description: New style lifestone, never seen it before. Animated with two brackets rotating around a round stone. -- Garrl

location.name: Advocate Plaza Complex
location.description: Home of the Advocate Dungeon in Beta Days -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Dutton's VoD trail
location.description: A small valley that can be used as a north entrance into the VoD. Just SE of Acid propy.

location.name: Ahurenga Portal
location.description: Exit: 46.1n, 89.8w. Ahurenga is the aun tumerok village on the swampy western coast of Marae Lassel. -- Immacolata

location.name: Fallen Shadow Spire
location.description: The charred, arrow poked remains of one of the shadow spires that menaced Derethian cities (and citizens) years ago. It lies in a huge crater, much like the one in Arwic where another Shadow Spire destroyed the old city. This is a spot where you must take your vassals on Sight Seeing. Afterwards you can head up to the watefalls for some fishing. -- Immacolata

location.name: Large school of Niffis
location.description: Permanent spawn of Opor, Sephal, Listris, Parfal and Glisnal Niffis at the Ithaenc Cathedral. Just jump down one waterfall. I found 3 pearls and 2 large shells in 30 minutes of hunting. -- Immacolata

location.name: Respite Ridge
location.description: A respite point near VOD west entrance. The ridge is spawn-free, and the top has a nice view, too. A good place to form up VOD expeditions, or run to if things go awry. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Jojii Shrine (Wai Jhou)
location.description:
Inside a Sho style lighthouse built in the swampy waters of the obsidian rim. Has a Jojii Shrine inside it. You can donate one pyreal to the shrine for a blessing.
You give Jojii Shrine Pyreal.
Run with dragons while your young.
-- Immacolata

location.name: Wai Jhou New Alliance Tent
location.description:
A tonk, an isparian and a lugian have pitched tent in Wai Jhou swamp (now didnt they teach them ANYTHING about picking camping sites back at the Academy?). They ask for donations to construct a new fort in South Direlands.
Give Caelis Renning the human salvaged metal and wood. Give Aun Teverea the tonk cloth and hide. Give Kraveon the Lugian gems and stone. -- Immacolata
As from july 03 the tent is ready to burst with crates and bags of salvage donated by isparians. If you meet the quota of each collector, they will tell you and reward you with a silly hat. You might want to be careful here, visitors has a bat habit of not wiping their feet... ie. they drag along a train of the nearby natives -- Immacolata 7/20/2003

location.name: Artifex Vault Portal
location.description: One way portal to Artifex Vault where you get Stone Tool to remove Atlan Stones. -- AR

location.name: Amperehelion Vault Portal
location.description: One way to Amperehelion Vault where you get Major Lightning Stone to put into Atlans.The exit portal puts you at the hot drop outside the direlands Amperehelion Vault. This is actually a decent way to get to the west Obsidian Plains. The Amperehelion Vault can be reached from Glendon Wood by using Mountain Ridge Abodes Portal at 27.9N 29.5E -- Taarna Blood SC 9/29/2004

location.name: Jahannan Vault Portal
location.description: One way portal to Jahannan Vault where you can get the Major Fire Stone for atlans. -- AR

location.name: Serac Vault Portal
location.description: One way trip to Serac Vault where you can get Major Frost Stone for Atlan weapons. -- AR

location.name: Incunubula Vault Portal
location.description: One way trip to the Incunubula Vault dungeon where you get the Major Acid Stone to put into an Atlan -- AR

location.name: Secret Putiputi Place
location.description: Dungeon has bow parts to make the Panaq bow. You will need to talk to Tekapuapuh west of Ahurenga to begin the quest. -- Zen Tek Ken (Made non-suspect and links enabled by Geomancer. Thanks Lila_MT!)

location.name: Caul Island Portal
location.description: Exit at 93.0S, 95.4W THIS IS LOCATED INSIDE THE DUNGEON. This portal is located next to the drop out point inside the Seat of the New Singularity Dungeon. Dropout is quiet. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Recall to Caul Island Dropout
location.description: This is where the Recall to Caul Island scroll will drop you out at.

location.name: Yanshi
location.description: Only thing here is Burned up Foundations of houses, destroyed statue of a reedshark, and the great boulder that was untouched in middle of what is left of yanshi. -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Dai Ya the Scholar
location.description: collects writings of Jhong Mi, who was a philosopher who wrote his own interpretations of the teachings of Jojii. Dai Ya is also helping the Dereth Exploration Society in their outreach program. -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Collector
location.description: Collects monster trophies from common rats, red phyntos wasps, armoredillos, drudges, mosswarts and banderlings. Doesnt collect hides though. -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Wah Fo-Za the Armorer
location.description: -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Drudge Tower
location.description: Four Drudge Skulkers Spawn inside this sho made tower. Usually there a note on floor inside near a corpse -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Auroch Fire Cows
location.description: There is 6 Auroch Fire cows, 5 Yearlings, and 1 Bull -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Festival Stone of Warmtide
location.description: -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Heart of Innocence
location.description:
You must have completed first half of Jaleh Missing Quest in order to enter this dungeon.
This portal seems to be random spawn in this area. Was right by road then next time I came back was on the hill. This place isnt pretty either lvl vii life vulns and war vii traps, plus human npcs that can cast War VII spells.

location.name: Candeth Keep
location.description: The new town created in unison by the tonk, lugian and isparian races. As of july 03 its still a construction site. You can still help by delivering salvage to the NPCs in Wai Jhou -- Immacolata

location.name: Renegade Camp
location.description: A camp of renegade lugians adn tumeroks, lead by General Garsh, just outside the walls of Tethana. They are besieging us! -- Immacolata

location.name: Asheron's Sanctum
location.description:
Could only glimpse this portal high up on the steep mountain. There is no apparent way up there, my money is on a quest :)
-- Immacolata
Aha! There is a way up! You must complete some quest in order to gain access to this dungeon. Inside lives Asheron. Speak to him and receiv a book about the olthoi menace. The book is hookable.
To get in you must do the Knorr Academy quest first, I think. Everyone I spoke to in the dungeon had completed the Knorr Quest. Those who didnt could not get in. When you speak to Asheron he mentions that he is aware that you have been through his other estate (Knorr). You cannot get out though! Must recall it looks like. -- Immacolata 7/23/2003

location.name: Spiralling path to Asheron's Castle
location.description: This is where you get onto the long, spiralling path leading up to ole unc Ashie. Run counter-clockwise. -- Immacolata

location.name: MOG's View
location.description: This ridgeline offers spectacluar views of both the Black Hills to the south and Valley of Death to the north. Path up is on the west side. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Craigstone Portal
location.description: Exit at 26N, 48.2E Portal is inside the castle. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Hebian-to Portal
location.description: Exit at 38.6S, 82.1E Portal is inside the castle. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Matron Hive East
location.description:
Landing is hot with Swarm Guardians (115), Warriors (125) and Mutilators (135). The spawn is just as thick as lower level hives, but a bit faster. Layout is the same as the other hives
Ths portal is tieable, recallable and summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 8/4/2003

location.name: Precarious Sojourn Portal
location.description: Exit at 38S, 59.5W. This is the portal that takes you to the city of floating circles to get the Arcane Pedestal and Map of Dereth. You MUST visit Slithe Tradittor near Lytelthorpe before using the portal. -- Jaz of SC Inside are ""Champions, Warriors, and

location.name: Wood Chip
location.description: Part of Oswalds Dirk quest. Talk to Aaminah in Ayan Baqur to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Fir Tree
location.description:
This tree can be clicked on. If youve done most of the Lost Husband quest that starts in Ayan Baqur with the NPC named Aaminah, it will portal you into a dungeon with 4 trials. The first is a Lockpick trial which requires you to have LP and have it buffed pretty high (300+) or else it will drain away your health. The 2nd is a room full of rolling balls of death with wood platforms hovering above... you must jump from one to the other without falling or youll die and your corpse will be 100% unrecoverable. The 3rd is a room with a target on one end, you on the other, and a lava pit between. Use a bow, xbow, or wand to strike the target with a critical hit. The last room is a rather difficult logic puzzle, which might possibly be bugged (4 of us did it and our answer we all arrived at separately was wrong). Look it up online and avoid a lot of frustration :) Solving this takes you to a room with the new Oswalds Dirk, possibly in a pickable chest... I didnt make it this far because of the bugged puzzle, so I might be wrong on where it is. No word on where the lost husband really is, though, or why Ulgrims acting so guilty. -- Confucius of FF -- Doc Feelgood
Entrance is mildly hot. Dungeon itself has nothing to fight -- its a jump-and-puzzle dungeon. If you fail the first room puzzle and survive, heal up and try again, theres no timer on trying the puzzle. There are several chests in the final Dirk Room, some are pickable. Just entering this dungeon flags you as ready for the follow-on quest, Heart of Innocence, and there you learn the lost husbands fate. -- Doc Feelgood 8/9/2003

location.name: Path up Dead Grub Hill
location.description: A nice view and respite spot in central VOD. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up Double Razorback Ridge
location.description:
Double Razorback Ridge is side-by-side ridges
the north ridge marks the south edge of VOD. Take this path up, and run north as an alternate route to VOD. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up Double Razorback Ridge
location.description: -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path North out of Precarious Sojourn Valley
location.description: Path out of Precarious Sojourn Valley up to Central Razorback Ridge. From here just a quick hop, literally, into VOD. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: NE edge of VOD
location.description: Southeast be dragons! -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up
location.description: This ridge will take you to east side of VOD. Then you can jump in. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up to Central Razorback
location.description: A path up to Central Razorback ridge, to the west. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: E-W Jump Gully
