location.description: Jump through with 280+ jump. A way into NE VOD. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up to Robert's Ridge
location.description: This ridgeline will take you south and west to Central Razorback Ridge. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Robert's Dike
location.description: Easy to jump over going south, hard time getting back north. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Central Razorback Ridge
location.description: This NE-SW ridge marks the SE edge of VOD. You can travel the high ground here from Double Razorback ridge southwest to Roberts Ridge northeast. Spawn on the ridgeline is light, and dumb -- easy to run them off the edges. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up Loopy Hills
location.description: Path up the north side of Loopy Hills. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Entrance to Three Glens
location.description: Entrance point for three pristine glens surrounded by the steep cliffs of the Loopy Hills -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Path up near dropout
location.description: Path up to Double Razorback Ridge near South VOD dropout. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Magedragon's Leap
location.description: A superb view of the Dire Dales to the east, and a dizzying look down. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Oltho Brood Hive
location.description:
Got new kinsd of Adolescent olthoi. -- Immacolata
Ok, the first parts of the nest has Soldiers and Guards (new variety I havent seen before, level 79). Further down you will meet swarm olthoi but no harder than eviscerators. There are some Adolescent Brood Matrons who drop tibia, feet and tails. They spawn every 5 minutes and the bits are on a 24 day timer. Even further down is a Queen that I didnt get to meet. The bits that are dropped can be given to the olthoi hunter in Arwic for fine armor pieces. -- Immacolata 8/22/2003
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna. There is an exit near the entrance. Foyer is hot with Guards. Layout is large and rambling. The spawn is fast, and in some areas dense, expect jams. -- Doc Feelgood 8/26/2003

location.name: Cave
location.description: Has 6 Wild Monougas guarding it which has portal to Carved Caves inside the cave. -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Carved Cave Portal
location.description:
Inside cave guarded by Wild Monouga -- Zen Tek Ken
This appears to be a duplicate of the Carved Cave west of Stonehold. Entrance is hot with a slow spawn of Wild Monoguas, foyer is quiet, exit takes you back out near entrance. (so this is not an alternate entrance to the Stonehold CC). Two keys are needed to get through the locked doors that are between entrance and bottom where the portals to Dires (near Candeth Keep, +21st level), HOLL dungeon (no level restriction) and Q-bar are located. Both keys are in unlocked chests that are in the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood 8/23/2003
The Carved Cave dungeon portal west of Stonehold doesnt exist anymore so ignore the top part that relates to it. 8/24/2003 Please check out some information about... -- 2/11/2005

location.name: Carved Caves to HotLL
location.description:
Exits 76.5S, 74.91W Cant be summoned. The Portal is at the End of Carved Cave Dungeon. The portal takes you inside Halls of the Lost Light. -- Zen Tek Ken
This portal lands you inside the dungeon foyer which is quiet.

location.name: Carved Caves to Direlands Midland Portal
location.description:
Exits 88.3S, 64.5W -- Zen Tek Ken
This is a short, but hot, run from Candeth Keep. -- Doc Feelgood 8/23/2003

location.name: Tree Portal
location.description: Exits 87.52S, 67.18W Takes you to the top of the tree where 100% buyback npcs are located. You must be flagged as a founder of the city to enter this portal. Which means you had to turn in enough salvage to the allegiance npcs in Wai Jhou to become a founder.

location.name: Olthoi Brood Hive
location.description: Non-random -- GM Entrance is not summonable or recallable. Haliana settlement out of Craigstone is a good choice for a nearby portal dropout. Entrance is hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet. This place is large and rambling with jumps as well as ramps. Spawn is thick and fast in places, and getting jammed is likely in those places. Top is Soldiers and Nobles, deeper in Evis and Swarm Drones are added to the mix. The Matrons and Queens at the bottom are bigger, tougher, and regen very quickly -- very difficult to solo. There are two each. This is the low level version of the Olthoi Armor quest. -- Doc Feelgood

location.name: Cave
location.description: The following monsters are guarding a chest inside the cave, 4 Banderling Antagonists, 5 Banderling Slayers, and 1 Banderling Thrasher. There is also a Runed Chest inside the cave. -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Carved Cave to Qalaba'r Portal
location.description: Exits 75.04S, 19.64E. located att the bottom of the Carved Cave Dungeon where the Shadows are. -- Zen Tek Ken

location.name: Crater Pathway Up
location.description: Exit: 64.8N,13.6E Duplicate in portal form of the Crater Pathway (60.7N,15.7E) dungeon. Needed for Oracle of Dereth and other navigators to realize that this dungeon has two exits. -- Grim Fiddle

location.name: Crater Pathway Down
location.description: Exit: 60.7N,15.7E Duplicate of the Crater Pathway (64.8N,13.6E) dungeon. Needed for navigation programs to realize that the Crater Pathway dungeon has two exits. -- Grim Fiddle

location.name: Mountain Citadel Portal
location.description: Newest Gotrok Encampment -- Halaliel 9/18/2003

location.name: Olthoi Brood Hive (80+)
location.description: -- Zen Tek Ken 9/21/2003

location.name: Olthoi Brood Hive
location.description: -- Zen Tek Ken 9/21/2003

location.name: Desert Citadel Portal
location.description: Sure is nice to go to the Cit and finally hunt Lugs that are more for higher lvls. Floor plan exactly the same as the Lin Cit. -- Balas Last Chance of Leafcull 10/16/2003Added map url. -- Lila_MT 4/3/2005

location.name: Matron Hive West
location.description: This portal replaced the original portal to Asherons Island East in Sept 2003 event patch -- Jaz (SC) 9/26/2003

location.name: Falatacot Ruin
location.description: Falatacot Matriarch (lvl 135), Falatacot Patrician (lvl 125) and Falatacot Consort (lvl 120). -- Jaz of SC 10/30/2003

location.name: Olthoi Brood Hive (20+)
location.description:
Entrance, Exit and Foyer are quiet. Cant be summoned recalled or linked. A big, rambling place filled with Nymphs, Drones and Servants. Spawn is thick -- expect jams -- but spawn rate is moderate. Found one Matron near the bottom (Lvl 70, fast regen)
there are likely more. She dropped a part for Olthoi armor. -- Doc Feelgood 10/31/2003

location.name: Renegade Garrison
location.description: Entrance is lodged in the base of El Badasso Rift -- approach from the south (subway) or northwest, or have a really hefty jump. You must be flagged by picking through the backpack at Lugian Encampment before you can enter. (17.1 N (near Zaikhal) 4.8 W). Bring an M-note for bribing foyer guard. Entrance/Exit is hot with Lugian guards (50-70), Foyer is quiet. Top part of dungeon is medium in size with straightforward layout -- door to Olthoi section is to the right on the first fork. Lugians and Tumeroks (50-80) guard first section, density and spawn rate is modest. Door to Olthoi section can be attacked to open it. Olthoi spawn behind the door is THICK. A good way to fight it is to beat the door down, then run back down the corridor to the first bend. Olthoi will follow, but reluctant to fight that far from their spawn area. -- Doc Feelgood 10/31/2003

location.name: Lugian Encampment
location.description: Starting point for Renegade Garrison dungeon / Renegade Mace Quest. Open the backpack on the ground to get flagged to enter the Renegade Garrison dungeon. (killing the party gathered around the pack is optional.) Renegade Garrison is at 44.3N, 51.9E -- a modest run NNW of Subway. -- Doc Feelgood 10/31/2003

location.name: South Shore Heights
location.description: Restricted to 12+ Portals you out to 86.2, 39.6E which is west of Kara. -- Halaliel aka Unicron of Solclaim 11/4/2003your exit coords lack a N-S designation... they arent showing up correctly. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2003

location.name: Crystal Mine
location.description:
This portan cannot be recalled, linked, or summoned. You also must be flagged to enter.

Part of the Ancient Olthoi Queen quest. -- Ian Stone 11/6/2003

location.name: Gerent's Compound
location.description: Part of Ancient Olthoi Queen event. Not recallable, linkable or summonable. -- Ian Stone 11/6/2003This is the location of the purple Energy Crystal orb (the Blue one is no longer available). At one time this dungeon was part of a Live event that was part of the Ancient Olthoi Queen story arc. It is now a quest dungeon containing Tusker Guards, various Virindi, Drudge Ravners, some higher level shadows and a few Tenebrous Hollow Minions.-- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Ancient Temple
location.description: A fairly straightforward, if not excessively long and boring dungeon, this place gets you the Living Tome, a cool floor-hookable furniture item. Inside are all Falatacot Consorts, Patricians, and Matriarchs, more and more the further you go in. Near the bottom, you know youre going the right way if you go down some spiral staircases. At the end is the Falatacot Abbess, whos level 161 and has 4000 HP. She doesnt drop anything of note, but beyond her is the Living Tome, which you just use to get your own. No camping needed. Respawn is quick, though, and theres a LOT of them, so I recommend bringing a group of at least 4-5 uber players, if not a small army. Their swords and spells do a lot of damage, so bane for all physicals and buff your acid or bludgeon weapons. When this quest first debuted, you could give the living tome to Nuhmudira for a global and a book of lore, but then she leaves. -- Confucius of FF 11/7/2003

location.name: Martinate Holding Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone on Northern Portion Of Marae Lassel -- Astalon Decurth -- Syntrax of Harvestgain 11/23/2003

location.name: Elemental Caverns
location.description: This is the dungeon for the elemental weeping weapon quest... -- Spoiled (Darktide) 11/29/2003The drop is not safe, but there is a handy pillar to perch on right inside that is safe for buffing. Youll see four tunnels downward, each glowing the color of the elemental pool youll find. This place is filled with level 100 tiny gromnies that do elemental damage. They hurt, even through banes. Theyll attack as soon as you are inside. I was able to run through the dungeon and convert four weapons to each element. I didnt bother killing the gromnies, I just healed a lot. The exit portal takes you to the other side of the hill, as if you had passed through. Each tunnel has an exit portal at the bottom. -- Geomancer 12/16/2003

location.name: Sclavus Temple
location.description:
Temple full of all different types of Sclavus Lords...NPC strange Sclavus connected to quest given at Candeth Keep.
-- Gelior Drake of Solclaim 12/2/2003Corrected the map url.
-- Lila_MT -- 3/1/2005Second attempt to update the Map URL field. -- --Lila_MT 3/1/2005

location.name: Campsite
location.description: A pair of sleeping Mats, a lamp near a very tall Tree in the middle of nowhere. -- Gelior Drake of Solclaim 12/14/2003

location.name: Olthoi Brood Hive
location.description: One of the dungeons for the Olthoi Armor -- Blau 12/18/2003

location.name: Xavier, Royal Guard
location.description: Found next to the Olthoi Chasm dungeon. If you find any information inside he will reward you. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003Xaiver accepts ""missives"" (notes) found inside Olthoi Chasm. The untranslated notes are no-drop/no-give, but if you have them translated by the translator in Zaikhal, they can be given, and they are a nice way to get XP to mules. -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

location.name: Olthoi Chasm
location.description:
This dungeon has several levels to it, each with a different level restriction to it. I believe there may be a note to pickup at every portal entrance. The first one had one so far. It goes all way up to lvl 100+ area that at end has a undead npc. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003Entrance is quiet
foyer is quiet. Spawn is a mix of Undead and Olthoi. Dungeon is large and meandering, and divided into sections by portals. The portals are at the back of each section, and in front of each portal is a note that can be turned in to Xavier for XP. Sections are level restricted 20+, 40+... up to 100+. The portal for each section is tieable and summonable, *but there is no going back portal* so you cant get back into a lower level section. Spawn rate and monster level increase as you go from section to section. Its a nice place for leveling and looting if youre tired of pure Olthoi and pure Tusker dungeons. (Note: the note you pick up is no-drop/no-give... until you have it translated by the Zaikhal translator.) -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

location.name: Mount Ingot
location.description: Limestone Golems, Granite Golems, Iron Golems, and Scold a lvl 85 Magma Golem. Kill Scold and get his heart to turn in at snowman village for a ice box. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003

location.name: Frost Haven
location.description:
Snowman Village, get the Ice Box quest here. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003
Added quest URL - Geomancer

location.name: Carved Caves
location.description:
This dungeon seems to have gotten lost from the database when it was moved near Zaikhal. The portal cannot be summoned, and has no level restriction anymore.
The following is copy and pasted from the old entry for Carved Caves. If this is already here, forgive me, it didnt come up with a Search.
Near Stonehold. Last key in quest for the SoLL is found in chest at the bottom. MANY monsters.
Now lvl 17+
has lots of monugas, a few skels and some shadows at the bottom -- Ki Dung Sa Bong 10/18/99
Near the end where you find a key .. green portal to Direlands .. -- Frescobaldi 12/20/99
Main chamber with the SoLL key is guarded by 3 Shadow children up front and 3 Shadows near the chest containing the key. Portals to Qalabar and Midland Direlands in the same chamber. Portal to Direlands sends you to a lifestone near the middle of the southern coast. Portal to Hebian-to is nearby. -- Farouk 1/26/00
Addition: Level 15 for Westward Portal to Carved Caves, Level 17 to get into Carved Caves, Level 21 to take portal at bottom to mid-Direlands. Portal restricting at its finest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/6/00
Does anyone know how to get there? -- Lost & Confused 3/12/2000
You need to get carved keys to get down to the Soll key - once youve found the 2nd surface portal, your virtually on top of the shadows. Theres also a chest, that req a sturdy iron key with the Skeletons in the Monouga Gallery - 30/6/00 -- Typhoid V 6/30/2000
The chest with Sturdy Iron Key spawns level V scrolls. Useless since SplitPea. -- Nekorkhan (MT) 7/9/2000
Note that the portal cannot be tied to nor summoned. Tie to the Murk Warrens, about 8 clicks away, instead. You can reach the surface portal of that dungeon (just take a right) without fighting. At the Carved Caves, be ready for the Shadows in the end. Be careful, or they may draw you into the Qalabar portal. You will definitely want to take the Direlands portal from this dungeon to reach the Halls of Lost Light. -- Wylfghar 12/28/2001 -- Solan Thommad 1/17/2004

location.name: Unicorn's Grace
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii quest introduced in Mirror, Mirror event, Jan 2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004

location.name: Firebird's Splendor
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii quest introduced in Mirror, Mirror event, Jan 2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Portal is summonable and tieable. Spawn is mid-level skeletons, spawn rate is modest. Layout is dendridic with many dead ends. Right hand rule will take you to the end. BDT is Stone of the Firebird in a room with a lava floor (but not burning lava.) -- Doc Feelgood 2/3/2004

location.name: Aerbax's Holding
location.description: Added during the October 2003 ""Reign of Terror"" Patch. Originally restricted to levels 60-90, the upper level restriction was removed with the November 2003 Patch. Dungeon contains Virindi Executors & Profatrix, a variety of Shadows, and some Tuskers. Inside is a altar that gives out the ""Bracelet of Dark Essence"". A quest item that is actually useful! The spells include MAJOR Stamina Gain, MAJOR Health Gain, and Willpower VI. Respawn here is fast but not insane. Should be able to reach altar easily in one buff cycle (much less if you know your way around). This Dungeon is one part of the three-part ""Preparation for the Ritus"" Quest. -- Ally McAlchemist 11/20/2003

location.name: Jojii's Shrine in Sawato
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii quest introduced in Mirror, Mirror event, Jan 2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004

location.name: Shrine
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii quest introduced in Mirror, Mirror event, Jan 2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004

location.name: Jojii Shrine
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii quest introduced in Mirror, Mirror event, Jan 2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004

location.name: Jojii Shrine
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii quest introduced in Mirror, Mirror event, Jan 2004 -- Jaz of SC 1/31/2004Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Dungeon is modest in size. Spawn is mid-level Banderlings, including the now-rare Berserkers (which drop the Ruined Amulet for Bow). BDT (Big Dungeon Treasure) is Crystals of Grace, at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 2/3/2004Portal is summonable and tieable. -- Doc Feelgood 2/3/2004

location.name: Darkened Halls
location.description: Contains a room full of Hollow Minions. One has a key that opens the chest. Take the Human Husk back to Dame Tsaya to advance. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/11/2004

location.name: Dragon's Power
location.description: Part of the Font of Jojii Quest. Inside are Greater and Dark Revenants, Dark Leeches and Dark Magus -- Solan Thommad 2/11/2004

location.name: Decrepit Tower
location.description: Periapt of Endless Sight, Shagraka, Cowl of the Sand. Need to find a token to access the portal. Get the token which spawn randomly with Malus shreth around this place (wait for a special corpse to spawn - called Shreth-Gnawed Corpse -- Astalon Decurth - WE 2/27/2004

location.name: Mountain access
location.description: -- Astalon Decurth - WE 2/27/2004

location.name: Grearrk, Mosswart Emissary
location.description: A new Mosswart NPC.. he speaks of killing Banderlings to help him -- Astral Dominae of TD 3/10/2004

location.name: Temple of Ixir Zi (Blackmire 1)
location.description:
Use the Odd Looking Vine at bottom the temple to teleport you into the dungeon. -- ZTK 3/10/2004
This is the first in a series of Fellowship quests. The level breaks are 40-69, 70-99, and 100+ Puzzles and trials lead to the High Matriarch Ixir Zi. One of your felowship members must be the Victim who uses the 4 Eyes to bring the Matriarch out. The Eyes massively debuff the Victim and continually drain them. I believe the draining only starts when they have 0 stamina. I strongly suggest that the victim logs out for the duration of the battle. They have 15 minutes to rejoin and will be much safer. Make sure to have a couple people wait in the Boss room to refellow and Heal the victim. Send the rest of the people into the reward room to battle the few Burun present. Afterward your Victim may enter, but make sure that they wait out the debuffs before getting their reward. The Sarcophagus casts a drain spell as it gives you the Ancient Armored Vestment. You then have a choice of an Axe, Sword, Mage Staff, Thrown Weapon Brace, Crown, and a Mansion Portal to Kivik Lirs Temple. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/14/2004

location.name: Tumeroks Last Stand
location.description: Ruined chest with 3 dead Tumeroks with a bunch of monsters nearby. I seen Shore armoredillo, stony armoredillo, Sandy Armoredillos, Drudge slinker, Drudge Sneaker, Drudge Skulker, Virtuous Doll all near a -- ZTK 3/10/2004

location.name: Undead Encampment
location.description: There is two Tents, one has a Runed Chest in it. Risen Soldiers, Skeleton Lords by tents with Sand Golems and other spawning monsters nearby. -- ZTK 3/10/2004

location.name: Head Statue
location.description: You can enter its mouth into a underground shrine with a BZ Statue and some other weird looking structure that sparkles -- ZTK 3/11/2004

location.name: Broken BZ Statue
location.description: Bunch of Corpses on ground around him that have misc items. -- ZTK 3/11/2004

location.name: Destination of Portal to Kivik Lir's Temple
location.description: This is the location where the mansion-hookable portal you recieve in the Blackmire temple quest drops you off. -- P i n t o of DT 4/4/2004

location.name: Matron Hive North
location.description: Part of the Asherons Raiment Quest. This is the 40+ Dungeon. -- Martok the Quick 4/10/2004

location.name: Acid Guardian Lair
location.description: Gaerlan's Citadel (High) - Near the Essence of Verdancy. Part of Gman quest -- Blazor 4/11/2004limited to level 60-79 -- 4/11/2004

location.name: Linvak Tukal Lifestone
location.description: This is the first Lugian Lifestone in AC1 created during A New Threat. It lives inside the Linvak Tukal fortress. -- Blau 4/23/2004

location.name: Linvak Tukal
location.description: This is the new portal into Linvak Tukal that bypasses the big Lugian Dungeon. -- Blau 4/23/2004

location.name: Lighthouse in Castle
location.description: A light house within a castle, there is also a floating advocate building here which you can jump into from the lighthouse. -- The Happy Clapper / Gloominus Doom (SC) 4/25/2004

location.name: Broken Castle
location.description: A castle broken in two during the transformation of the caul. -- The Happy Clapper / Gloominus Doom (SC) 4/25/2004

location.name: Burning Lighthouse
location.description: A Lighthouse with two broken floating advocate towers, the whole place is on fire. -- The Happy Clapper / Gloominus Doom (SC) 4/25/2004

location.name: Burun Burrow
location.description: Part 2 of the Renegade Quest: Renegade Insignia Ring -- Syl 5/12/2004

location.name: Renegade Fortress
location.description:
-- Syl 5/12/2004Location 28.5S, 65.5W This is the location of the spy Toberik that Krank in Linvak Tukal sends you to find. There is a door at the front of the fort that can be attacked. It is best to do it from a distance since the lugians dump hot oil on anyone near the walls. Once the door is broken down, rush inside and jump into the center pit area with the buildings. Toward the back there is a head with a portal inside. Toberik is in the basement area of the building to the left of the portal. A room with boxes has a hole in the ceiling and he is hiding up there. Take his note back to Krank in Linvak Tukal to be flagged for the Noble Weapons quest.
The note is aparently givable. I dont know if this is intended or not. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/26/2004

location.name: Arwic Lifestone
location.description: -- Syl -- Coulthard

location.name: Redspire Lifestone
location.description: Moved as of the Mired Hearts patch. -- Syl 5/12/2004

location.name: Zaikhal Lifestone
location.description: Moved as of the Mired Hearts patch. -- Syl 5/12/2004

location.name: A Sycophant's Corpse
location.description: This is the corrected location and spelling of the corpse. Using the corpse will get you flagged for the Staff of the Pain Bringer quest. Corpse is surrounded by big tuskers and reedsharks. -- Seeker 5/26/2004

location.name: Baishi Town Lifestone
location.description: Moved the Lifestone into the town proper. - Zacantos(Illuminati) -- Zacantos 5/24/2004Old lifestone is still there. The new town lifestones dont appear to have replaced old ones. -- Seeker 5/26/2004

location.name: MacNiall's Freehold Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone located in MacNialls Freehold -- Sigwulf 5/31/2004

location.name: Mutilator Tunnels
location.description:
10M xp pincer spawns on the mutilators in the red room -- Seeker 6/9/2004restricted to level 80+ -- Seeker 6/11/2004 Current coords are correct. Quest url added, map url corrected. -- Lila_MT 7/2/2004 If you see this with coords of 0,0 in Oracle of Dereth it means that somehow youve got it in your locations.loc twice. Open locations.loc in notepad, find Mutilator Tunnels and look for the entry with the 0s for coords. Remove that entry.


Changed the name of this dungeon in an attempt to get rid of the Oracle of Dereth bug Don't bother marking this entry suspect, it's meant to be named like it is.

location.name: Olthoi Warrior Nest
location.description: 3M XP Warrior Pincer, Sublime Ring of Piercing Protection -- Seeker 6/9/2004 -- Lila_MT 7/2/2004Corrected the map url I posted a moment ago. -- Lila_MT 7/2/2004

location.name: Crumbling Empyrean Mansion
location.description: Worker Pincer, good for 50K XP -- 6/9/2004

location.name: Desert Oasis
location.description: Out near Fadsahil al-Tashbi, the desert master mage, Burun nearby, laggy, nice eye candy -- Seeker 6/9/2004

location.name: Tumerok Cavern
location.description: Tumeroks. About Level 26. And Silt Lurkers. Didnt get very far down. -- SolanThommad Part 1 of Living Spear Quest initiated by Bachus Flufens. The spear is in a locked vault. Key to vault is found on the Hea Warrior. Vault graphic is new and pretty cool. Return spear to Bachus for additional quest info. -- Dunc -- AllyMcAlchemist -- Solan Thommad

location.name: Candeth Keep Lifestone
location.description: Lifestone within the walls of Candeth Keep. -- Lila_MT 6/11/2004

location.name: Burun Cavern
location.description: Massive amounts of Burun Ruuk Seers and Burun Ruuk Louts. Added in Pillars Made of Sand. -- Neros 6/12/2004Carved Gemstone Lockpick, Renegade Lugian Ring and some lore texts are here also. The Ring is nothing special, but the Gemstone Lockpicks are high powered lockpicks with 100 uses. They are on a 7 day timer. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/25/2004

location.name: Hea Toneawa
location.description:
Hea Toneawa tells you, Greetings! Could you do me a favor, please? I planned to meet my beloved, Aun Mariona, but I am afraid that my Hea brethren have learned of our romance and are watching over me. Could you take her this note? I dare not go meet her myself, lest they slay us together. You will find her in the redwood groves almost directly north from the city your kind calls Bluespire. I have written the directions to our meeting place on the note.

His note claims Aun Mariona is at 41.1N, 74.4W. She is, of course, not there but her brother Aun Bernawa is. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

location.name: East Arwic Lifestone
location.description: This was mistakenly marked as a suspect location, when lifestones were moved closer to towns, but this one is still here up the hill NE of Arwic -- Kitte 6/20/2004

location.name: Gaerlan Portals
location.description: Ziggurat, library portals, etc. moved from Eastham to bunkers here for Pillars Made of Sand event -- Seeker 6/21/2004

location.name: Renegade Stronghold
location.description:
From Pillars Made of Sand patch. Ascendant and Tumerok Champions, Gotrok Tiatus and Fortress Guards. Use the key on the chest at 34.8S 12.1E for a Renegade Bone Charm, Lore and 100 Tumerok Salted Meats!

To find the key go right at the entrance and keeping bearing right until the end. The key spawns on the table. -- Seeker 7/3/2004

location.name: Renegade Chest
location.description: Use the key from Renegade Stronghold on the chest for a Renegade Bone Charm, Lore and 100 Tumerok Salted Meats. From Pillars Made of Sand patch -- Seeker 7/3/2004

location.name: Renegade Stronghold
location.description: Ornate Tumerok Breastplate and Horned Lugian Helm on The bosses, General Fostok and War Chief Amanua -- Seeker 7/3/2004

location.name: Hizk Ri's Temple (Blackmire 3)
location.description:
Third temple in the Blackmire series, from 7/2004 patch, Treaties in Stone.


See Maggie's write-up.-- Seeker 7/15/2004

location.name: Mud Cave
location.description: This is part of The Moars quest added July 2004 -- Laurina 7/16/2004

location.name: Tainted Grotto
location.description: Burun dungeon, added 7-14-2004 -- CapFan 7/18/2004Creatures: Burun Seer, Burun Louts, Burun Soothsayers -- CapFan 7/18/2004

location.name: Floating Bottle
location.description: Floating Bottle, text for the Hermit Quest. -- CapFan 7/18/2004

location.name: Tunnels of the Harbinger
location.description: one of the two Harbinger dungeons (Issk the Sclavus) -- Seeker 7/21/2004

location.name: Tunnels to the Harbinger
location.description: One of two Harbinger dungeons. The Harbinger originally appeared during the Verdict event. During Into the Darkness the quest was updated. -- Seeker 7/21/2004

location.name: Renegade Stronghold
location.description: Another new Renegade Dungeon. Level 100 Tumeroks and Lugians. Portal is inside a building, with lower level Lugians outside. -- Charles 7/24/2004

location.name: Hidden Cavern
location.description: Filled with VoD level banderling and drudge. -- November Raine 8/6/2004

location.name: Wilderness Citadel
location.description: Formerly Lugian Citadel (High Mountain Valley). Contains Lvl 70-105 Lugians. -- November Raine 8/7/2004

location.name: Lair of the Ancient Queen
location.description: No tie, no recall. Filled with VoD level Olthoi Mutilator, Primordial, and Sentinel. -- November Raine 8/7/2004

location.name: Watery Grotto
location.description:
Lots of burun
Mosswart war paint is found at the end. -- Seeker 8/11/2004

location.name: Hidden Entrance
location.description:
The enterance is a big rock called Hidden Entrance. Grab all the different books lying about and return to Yanshi and talk to Ydnew. Multiple dungeons below. -- Seeker 8/11/2004The various dungeons are for different level ranges. Underway - Level 40+
Tunnels - Level 60+
Halls - Levels 80+. More from Maggies once she makes a separate quest page for it. -- Geomancer 8/14/2004

location.name: Umbral Hall
location.description:
Another subway. Tieable, Summonable. Lots of portals, Hot Landing Zone.
NORTH: Al-Arqas, Tou-Tou, Uziz, Stonehold, Kyrst
SOUTH: Sawato, GW, Arwic, Freehold, Khayyaban
EAST: Al-Jalmia, Rith, Lyth, Lin, Kara
WEST: Xarabydun, Nanto, Eastham, Samsur, Plateau
Monsters: Shadow Lieutenants, Idols, Dread Idols, Mosswart Fanatics -- Seeker 8/11/2004 Lila_MT 8/29/2004

location.name: CapFan's Hideaway -or- Dires Hub
location.description:
A Dungeon using new technology for the enterance, similar to Xarabydun. There are two buildings at this location. One of the structures has only one door, but inside there are two. The inside of the structure is larger than the outside. The second door leads to a dungeon.



The dungeon is filled with various high level undead and golems. Near the bottom, guarded by a litch Opressor and a host of undead is an SSK chest and a Runed chest (300 LP).



A short drop from here takes you to a room with 14 portals. A new Hub/Sub! The portals:



Stonehold Valley Portal

Direlands North Landbridge Portal

Direlands South Landbridge Portal

Vesayen Isles Portal

South Shore Heights

Obsidian Span Portal

Obsidian Plains

Direlands Southeast Shore

Darktide Festival Stone Portal

Slaughterhouse

Isle of Tears Portal

Black Hill

Walled Portals

Obsidian Rim Portal



-Cap



-- CapFan 8/11/2004

location.name: Mossy Cave
location.description: Find a Burun that carries A Smelly Key and is used to open a chest further into the dungeon. Further is An Old Chest with a necklace for Bleeargh in Yanshi -- Seeker 8/11/2004restricted to lvl 20 -- 8/13/2004

location.name: Dark Mosswart Halls
location.description: Mid level Mosswarts and Shadows. Here you find Eye of Drageerg. -- CapFan 8/11/2004Levels 30+ -- Seeker 8/15/2004

location.name: Tumerok Spawn
location.description: Small spawn of Tumeroks. Has one War Monger, a few Champions and some Troopers. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Gromnie Spawn
location.description: Small spawn of gromnies in a row. 4 brass gromnies and one copper. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Obsidian Span Portal
location.description: Located in the dires sub which is inside the hut and at the bottom of the dungeon. -- 8/12/2004

location.name: South Shore Heights Portal
location.description: Located in the dires sub which is inside the hut and at the bottom of the dungeon. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Vesayen Isles Portal
location.description: Located in the dires sub which is inside the hut and at the bottom of the dungeon. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Direlands South Landbridge Portal
location.description: Located in the dires sub which is inside the hut and at the bottom of the dungeon. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

location.name: Direlands North Landbridge Portal
location.description: Located in the dires sub which is inside the hut and at the bottom of the dungeon. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

I found that by adding a space to break up the word Festival, ACExplorer suddenly honored the location type again. I can only assume that this is a design decision made by Zugg for AC Explorer, since its present in ACExplorer 2.2 and Pro 3.3. --Geomancer 8/26/2004

location.name: Banderling Hovel
location.description: Various Banderlings (Raiders, Breeders). Also location of Hand of Vagurat. -- CapFan 8/12/2004

location.name: King Toad idol
location.description:
You must be flagged to enter by giving a note from a Burun Ruuk Seer to Aun Laokhe in Arwic tower. Take the hookable portal from blackmire 1.

Lots of level 100+ Burun and Guruk inside. There are 12 unreadable scrolls and one statue inside, for level 4, 5, 6, and 7 of fellowship spells for Magic Defense, Melee Defense, and Missile Defense. To get usable scrolls, hand them to the Aun Translator in Arwic. -- Seeker 8/15/2004

location.name: Dillo Spawn
location.description: Static spawn of 6 Shore Dillos -- Chupon 8/19/2004

location.name: Rock Formation
location.description: Rock Formation with a static spawn of 3 Shallows Sharks and 5 Shallows Slayers -- Chupon 8/19/2004

location.name: Mosswart Chest
location.description:
Not far from Shoushi.
The key that opens the chest drops on a nearby Drudge Prowler and inside is Kreergs Spear. Return it to Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord near Yanshi -- Seeker 8/21/2004

location.name: Coral Tunnels (East)
location.description:
The new dungeon in the new tower on Aerlinthe. -- Tolliver 8/26/2004
This is the Eastern entrance to the Coral Tunnels. This system of tunnels goes under the Aerlinthe Harbor and exits on the Western side just below the Coral Golem spawn there. This is a quick way across the harbor for someone who knows the route. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/12/2004

location.name: Vesayen Isles Portal
location.description: Drops at 72.5S, 81.3E Kryst is to the SouthEast -- Dushman Kush 8/28/2004

location.name: Olthoi Brood Hive (80+)
location.description: The second level 80+ dungeon for the Olthoi Armor quest. Layout is identical to the other. -- Taygar 9/10/2004 OK, there are two level 80+ Olthoi brood hives. One at 57.4N, 67.4E, one at 64.5N, 56.2E -- Seeker 9/16/2004 So, this location is actually correct. Thanks Seeker! -- Geomancer 9/16/2004

location.name: Kivik Lir's Temple (Blackmire 4)
location.description: Another fellowship quest dungeon. Crowds of large unhappy Burun all around it. A ramp on the east side provides access. Inside of the building is a pit with an Odd Looking Vine at the bottom. Use the vine to enter. The rewards for this quest include Ancient Armored Leggings, and choice of jewlery or fellowship magic skill buffs. There are several various level ranges with 100+ being the highest. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/22/2004

location.name: Izji Qo's Temple portal exit point
location.description: This is the exit point of the Mansion portal from the Blackmire 3 quest (Temple of Hizk Ri). There is little in the area currently, yet there is much speculation about a future Blackmire quest nearby. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/25/2004

location.name: Shendolain Vestibule
location.description: The new Shendolain Vestibule is located here. The old one is still in the OP, but this one is in a more sensible location for its level requirements now. This was the location of the 5th soul crystal prison that held BaelZharon. The reward for this quest can be crafted into a bow, sheild or orb. See the great writeup on the Maggie the Jackcats site for more info. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/25/2004

location.name: Coral Tunnels (West)
location.description: This is the Western entrance to the Coral Tunnels. This system of tunnels goes under the Aerlinthe Harbor and exits on the Eastern side just below the Coral Golem spawn and Recall platform. This is a quick way across the harbor for someone who knows the route. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

location.name: East Aerlinthe Lighthouse
location.description: Ancient Empyrean Lighthouse similar to the one in Tou Tou. You can climb to the top. There is an identical Lighthouse on the other side of the Aerlinthe Harbor. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

location.name: Smith Ejan
location.description: Named Undead near a temple. Tortured spirit that brodcasts annoying area messages. He can be killed and looted for The Charred Book, which can be translated at Cragstone Library for the Aerlinthe Record. This is an interesting piece of lore, but has no practical value. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

location.name: Static Ash Gromnie spawn
location.description: Static spawn of 8 Ash Gromnies on the west east coast of the dires. -- Chupon 10/14/2004

location.name: Outside Accursed Halls Portal
location.description: Portal to the walled fort containing the Accursed Halls Portal. Tieable, no Summon. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/17/2004

location.name: Sho Tower (Wai Jhou)
location.description: Contains Weaponsmith, Armorsmith, Healer and a Jojii Shrine. Spawns are nearby outside, be careful here. This tower has a 3rd floor and is rather unique in that respect. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/21/2004

location.name: Pyreal Target Drudge (Candeth Keep)
location.description: A static monster type target. Good for testing attack power. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/29/2004

location.name: Tiny Hive
location.description: Random Spawn Dungeon on the Mare Lassel Plateau. Can not be summoned or recalled. Soldiers and Legionaries. There is a double Olthoi Noble spawn at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble from the NW ring at 50.1N, 80.4W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Tonk Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP. -- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Shallow Hive Exit
location.description: This is the drop point for the Shallow Hive Exit portal. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Small Hive exit
location.description: Drop point for Small Hive exit. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Tiny Hive exit
location.description: Drop point for Tiny Hive exit. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Simple Hive exit
location.description: Drop point for Simple Hive exit -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Fortress Barrier
location.description: Attackable barrier that protects the inside of the Burun Fortress. It can be debuffed and generally requires several people to kill. Resistant to war magic. Part of the slay Morgluuk / Noble Weapons quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Southeast)
location.description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.
Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. Fairly straight forward, just go down. This dungeon contains a Ruuk Shaman Watcher at the bottom. Upon its death you will get a green message, and the Ruuk Shamans with Morgluuk are reduced in number and spawn.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Northwest)
location.description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.
Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. There are some twisting corridors full of damage fumes. Some dead ends and loops also. This dungeon contains a Titan Watcher at the bottom near an exit portal. Upon its death you will get a green message, and the Titans with Morgluuk are reduced in number and spawn.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Vile-Smelling Refuse
location.description: These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Morgluuk)
location.description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.

This is Morgluuks main dungeon. Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. Go here after you have sufficently weakened his forces by completing some of the other dungeons. The Egg slaying dungeon weakens him, and the other 3 subtract from his forces. I recommend that you at least slay his Egg.

Once inside this dungeon, head West and then take the SW fork. Go down until you reach a corridor with passages to the sides and 2 large burun at the very end. Dont go down the corridor, go right at the bottom of that ramp and find another ramp going down. Morgluuk is down the next slanting tunnel you come to. If you did not get rid of some of his guards, they are on a very short spawn. There is a damage fume floor at the base of Morgluuks ramp. It is best to have one person try to lure him onto the ramp for the battle. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Southwest)
location.description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.
Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. This dungeon is short but brutal. Lots of Fume damage floors here. Many Burun eggs are scattered about, but the one you want is way at the bottom in a large room. It is always in the same spot, among a group of 4. Most eggs are easy to kill, but this is a true tough egg. After you kill it a green message appears saying you weakened Morgluuk. This halves his HP and reduces his skills, stats and regen. If you do no other dungeons to weaken him, do this one for sure.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

location.name: Xarabydun Small Creepy Statue
location.description: PKs can enter the special PK dungeon here. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

location.name: Uninhabited Area Portal (Xarabydun)
location.description: Dungeon at the bottom of Xarabydun city sewers. Entry to the sewers and portal is blocked by a locked door with 82 diff. Portal restricted to levels 1-25, but can be Tied and Summoned. At the bottom of Uninhabited Area Portal is a portal to the Lightless Tunnels, also 1-25. In order to get to the Lightless Tunnels portal, you must find a key on a Mite among a room full of mites. This key unlocks one of 2 doors into a room with a locked door alcove. In this alcove is a chest, with a lore text, and a lever. The lever is placed so that you can use it through the door without opening. This lever opens the door in the room with the mites which leads to the Lightless Tunnels. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

location.name: Lightless Tunnels to VOD
location.description: Only accessable to characters 1-25. Reached by going through Uninhabited Area Portal and then into Lightless Tunnels. There is a Mid Direlands Portal at the bottom of a 40 damage pit here(with Bludge pro 7 and 110 jump) It is Tieable and Summonable, restricted to 18+. This exits at 37.1S, 65.9W and is actually the Valley of Death hot drop, which is very hazardous for any lowbie that goes in. This is a good place for your new portal mules to get a VOD portal while they pick Crystal Nodules. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

location.name: Kara Life Stone
location.description: -- Taarna Blood SC 11/9/2004

location.name: Nullified Statue of a Golem
location.description: -- Taarna Blood SC 11/9/2004

location.name: Big Glowing Tree
location.description: Huge Glowing Tree on a stone pedistal with stone arches around roots in the middle of a small lake at the top of the falls over the chapel on the new island. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Fishing Hole
location.description: A remote fishing hole on the new island, no license office to be found nearby. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Obsidian Bridge
location.description: An obsidian span style bridge, part of the path to the Empyrean Lighthouse on the new island. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Large Floating Statues / Floating Empyrean Towers
location.description: Two large floating statues keep a vigil with three floating Academy style Empyrean Towers. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Empyrean Lighthouse
location.description: A new Empyrean Lighthouse overlooks the bay above the floating statues. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Portal Device
location.description: Must be flagged by reading the book in Nuhmudiras Cottage, use the device to be portaled to the new island. Part of the Soul Stone Noble Weapon upgrade quest. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Nuhmudira's Cottage
location.description: Enter the cottage and read Nuhmudiras Journal to be flagged for entry to the Hidden Island, part of the Soul Stone Noble Weapon Upgrade quest. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/12/2004

location.name: Xi Ru's Chapel
location.description: Xi Rus Chapel, appearing much like what the Ithaenc Cathedral might look like if it was restored to its original state. Guarded by Sclavus, backed by a towering waterfall. The entrance to Xi Rus Crypt is on the top level of the building. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/14/2004

location.name: Xi Ru's Crypt
location.description: Within these halls you may earn the Soul Stone (the upgrade from Noble Weapons to Burun Slayer weapons) as well as the Salvaging Self and Other buff spells. -- 11/14/2004

location.name: Empyrean Lighthouse
location.description: Another lighthouse, grants access via a medium jump to the nearby floating Empyrean Spire. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/14/2004

location.name: Guardians Spire
location.description: Floating upon a piller of blue flame, this floating Empyrean Spire is home to the Font Guardian. Font Guardian tells you, You have no purpose at this place, be gone. -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/14/2004

location.name: Steamy Font
location.description: . . . -- Davidge of Solclaim 11/14/2004

location.name: Muggy Font

location.description: New portal in Holtburg that takes you to Shoushi -- Armin 12/8/2004

location.name: Holtburg to Neydisa Castle
location.description: New portal in Holtburg that drops you just outside of Castle Neydisa. -- Armin 12/8/2004

location.name: Holtburg to Dryreach
location.description: This portal drops you outside the town of Dryreach. At least you can see it from the drop point. -- Armin 12/8/2004

location.name: Holtburg to Cragstone
location.description: New portal in Holtburg that takes you to the capital city of Cragstone. -- 12/8/2004wont work in OoD, location coords and exit coords are missing a comma -- 12/11/2004fixed exit coords -- 12/12/2004 Updated to fix location coordinates. -- Geomancer, 12/13/2004

location.name: Shoushi to Kryst
location.description:
exits 74.6S, 84.2E
Added with The Calm patch 12/04 -- Seeker 12/8/2004 -- 12/12/2004

location.description: New portal in Holtburg that takes you to Arwic. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.description: New portal in Yaraq that takes you to Holtburg. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.description: New portal to the Capital town of Zaikhal. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Yaraq to Linvak Tukal
location.description: New portal to Lugian town of Linvak Tukal -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Yaraq to Khayyaban
location.description: New portal to the town of Khayyaban -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Yaraq to Xarabydun
location.description: New portal to the town of Xarabydun -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Yaraq to Bluespire
location.description: New portal to the town of Bluespire -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Black Marrow Reliquary
location.description:
You can find a Black Marrow Reliquary at 89.5S 95.8W on a static spawn.

It's tough to get to and placed in a tower with margul, but it doesn't require a key(7 day timer - no gem required). -- Screamin Squall 03/19/2005 Can also be reached by using Shadow Cursed Totem. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries.-- Taarna Blood SC

location.name: Shoushi to Yaraq
location.description: New portal to the town of Yaraq. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Shoushi to Tou-Tou
location.description: New portal to the town of Tou Tou. -- CapFan 12/9/2004This portal originates from Shoushi, not Yaraq. -- DSanai 12/10/2004 Updated to say Shoushi instead of Yaraq. Re-suspect this if thats not the thing to do.

location.name: Shoushi to Kara
location.description: New portal to the town of Kara. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Shoushi to Hebian-To
location.description: New portal to the Capital town of Hebian-To -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Briad Mansion Ruin
location.description: New low level quest outside of Shoushi. Talk to Lou Ka in the bar in Shoushi. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

location.name: Sign
location.description:
You think, A sign. Theyre everywhere nowadays...from the smile on the grocers face, to the voices that carry on the wind. Id seen a fair share of signs in my day, but this was a day like no other and this was a sign that I couldnt pass by.

using this sign in Zaikhal fills your mind with thoughts, starts you gesturing and entices you to start a quest.... -- Seeker 1/3/2005

location.name: War Room
location.description: Must talk to Aludi al-Jaladh in Ayan before you can enter. This quest is for the Aviator Cap. If you do not have lockpick, you must kill the drudges outside the fort, or in the dungeon for keys to unlock the doors. Inside are Drudge Ballast, Toilers and Laborers. At the end is the Drudge Aviator. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Drudge Flying Machine
location.description: Related to the Drudge Aviator quest. After killing the Drudge Aviator, hand the flying machine the Flying Machine Instructions to be instantly portalled to Ayan. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Vile Sanctuary
location.description: Contains Withered Lugians guarding the Anemic Atlatl. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Banished Assembly
location.description: Full of Withered Drudge Seraphs and Seraph Mystics guarding the Sterile Sword. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Ravaged Cathedral
location.description: Contains Withered Banderlings and Tumeroks guarding the Insensate Axe. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: 3 Empyrean Heads
location.description: 3 Empyrean heads in a row facing NW. They mark the boundary of the Withered Area to the SW. This marker marks the location of the center Head. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: 3 Empyrean Heads
location.description: 3 Empyrean heads in a row facing NW. They mark the boundary of the Withered Area to the SW. This marker marks the location of the center Head. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Withered Banderling Island
location.description: This marks the location of an island in the Withered Area full of Withered Banderlings guarding the book The Withering. In addition, one of the Hierophants near the center drops the Barren Bow. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Static Banderling Spawn
location.description: Static spawn of many banderlings. 6 each of Scalpers, Predators and Savages. Strewn around are bones, corpses, blood and carcases, but nothing else of importance. Would be a good place to camp looking for a Niffis Fight portal gem. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Defiled Temple Middle Wing
location.description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for levels 60-79. End Reward is the Tursh Totem and the Royal Dye. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Defiled Temple Lower Wing
location.description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for level 40-59. End reward is the Tursh Totem and the Royal Paint. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Defiled Temple Upper Wing
location.description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for levels 80-99. End reward is the Tursh Totem and a similar reward to the other dungeons. As I write this I dont know the exact name however. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Defiled Temple Asylum
location.description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for levels 100+. End reward is the Tursh Totem and the Royal Oil. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Tower
location.description: Tower at the center of the 4 Defiled Temple portals. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Banderling Village
location.description: Start of the Banderling Shrine quest. End reward is Cyphus Suldows Half Moon Spear. In the village are Amethyst Gromnies, Banderling Chanters and a Banderling Spirit Dancer. Kill the Spririt Dancer for a Crude Carving. Give the carving to the statue and a portal to the dungeon will summon. The Dungeon is restricted to levels 60 or higher. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

location.name: Gromnietross Aerie Spawn
location.description: A spawn containing a single Adolescent Ash Gromnie. It also contains one Sapphire Gromnie, Amethyst Gromnie, Emerald Gromnie, and Ruby Gromnie. These are level 100 and have no noticable special loot. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/7/2005

location.name: Caulcano Black Marrow Reliquary
location.description: Static spawn, no key required, 7 day Timer. Can be reached by using Burning Veil. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

location.name: Oasis Black Marrow Reliquary
location.description: Static spawn within a floating tower, no key required, 7 day Timer. As far as I know, this place can only be reached by using the Antiquated Compass. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

location.name: Floating Bridge Black Marrow Reliquary
location.description: Static spawn, no key required, 7 day Timer As far as I know, this place can only be reached by using Seething Skull. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

location.name: Entry to Inner Stronghold
location.description:
There is no portal. This is a Xarabydun type landscape dungeon. It is a tunnel leading down, which contains various Shadows, Lugians, and Lugian type shadows. At the bottom is an 80+ portal to Inner Stronghold.
-- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

location.name: Garaena The Emmisary
location.description:
Portal to isle called Aerlinthe. Same as portal from Chalicmere Fortress but you dont need lockpick and there is no need to fight, of course its 40,000 pyreals more.
- Zoran and SilvrDrgn - Chia - Silverion DD - DaOlthoiKiller
Very near Candeth Keep. Give her a D note and she will summon a 40+ portal to Aerlinthe Island. She will accept and give change for an M note. Many annoying monsters will rush you.
- Taarna Blood SC. ACS

location.name: Koga Hideki
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Armor.
I have improved my armor skills, but my craft is not yet perfect. Fortunately, sages have discovered ways to improve my armor during my weakness. Have you read Aliester's Corollary? Bring me fused gems to make armor, and the book will show you how to improve my product.

location.name: Jibril ibn Rashid
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Armor.
I still have not recovered my old skill with armor. But there is hope... Have you heard about the findings of the Aluvian sage? His corollary has some interesting news... Give me your fused gems and I will make you armor as best I can. Perhaps with the sage's techniques, my armor can attain some semblance of its old power.

location.name: Aino Lunnan-Shin, Gem Crafter
location.description:
Quest(s): Gem of Impulse.
Aino Lunnan-Shin is a gem crafter. She is only interested in the geodes that lie in the deepest recesses of Xarabydun, which she is willing to craft into the powerful Impulse gems coveted by mages throughout Dereth.

location.name: Holtburg Collector
location.description: Holtburg's resident collector is always found by the well in Holtburg, willing to buy or trade for the latest in trophies brought forth by adventurers.

location.name: Collector (Samsur)
location.description: This collector accepts all manner of trophies in exchange for coin and other rewards.

location.name: Barnar the Tinker
location.description: Living on the upper level of Stonehold's Archery Shop, this skilled craftsman will fashion Wood Hearts into crossbow stocks and mechanisms for those attempting to construct the composite crossbow.

location.name: Collector (Shoushi)
location.description: Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from many of the monsters that plague Dereth. If you give me such items, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides."

location.name: Olthoi Hunter
location.description:
Quest(s): Olthoi Queen, Olthoi Shield, Asheron's Raiment Quest, Olthoi Armor, Hunter Quests (Olthoi Nettlers, Nymphs, Drones).
Olthoi Hunter tells you, "Track down and slay 10 Olthoi Nettlers and I will reward you appropriately." Olthoi Hunter tells you, "Track down and slay 20 Olthoi Nymphs and I will reward you appropriately." Olthoi Hunter tells you, "Track down and slay 20 Olthoi Drones and I will reward you appropriately."
Will accept Olthoi trophies and make them into weapons and armor. You can also trade in your old Olthoi helms (the purple buckets) for the newer, more menacing style.

location.name: Yi Yo-Jin the Leather Crafter
location.description:
Yi Yo-Jin tells you, Will miracles never cease? The Hoary Mattekar has returned! A beautiful and ferocious creature. And most people looking at it see nothing but a robe. Such a shame.
Give me the hide.
You've earned 10,000 experience.
Yi Yo-Jin gives you Hoary Mattekar Robe.
You give Yi Yo-Jin Hoary Mattekar Hide.
Yi Yo-Jin tells you, Yes, the Hoary Mattekars are now back. Given the strangeness of creature migrations that have occurred over this past year, I would not be surprised were the Hoary to be a more permanent fixture on Dereth.
Here is your robe.
Old Text:
I came here long ago in search of the lengendary Hoary Mattekar. Alas, but I no longer hear its roar in the night. I wonder if it shall ever return to Dereth?
Still, I will tke your creatures' lesser hides and craft them into useful items for you.
If you give Yi Yo-Jin a large mattekar hide or normal mattekar coat, he will re-work it into a lovely fur variation. This lovely coat is highly valued by the Aluvian ladies.

location.name: Alean the Steel Forger
location.description:
Quest(s): Shadow Armor.
Alean the Steel Forger tells you, Nuhmudira has finally restored us to full health! She has also stocked us with some extra supplies that we needed, such that we can provide you with either a version of the original Shadow Armor, or its successor. If you wish to trade on version of your Celdon set for another, simply hand it to me. Please take ou all Atlan Stones from your armor before handing it to me.
Alean the Steel Forger tells you, Also, if you wish to color your new Greater Shadow Armor, you may buy a vat of color from my assistant. If you do not like the color, please give me the armor piece and I will replace it with the standard piece which you may then choose to recolor.

location.name: Dizah ibn Nadqab
location.description:
Quest(s): Impious Staff.
While excavating this site, I inadvertently awakened the undead that rest here. I was able to escape the dungeon with my life, but before doing so I found a large audience chamber with treasure.
Offer me any trade note worth 5000 pyreals and I'll give you access to the dungeon. In return, you can keep anything you find in there. I can use the trade note to further my investigation in this site. From what I was able to uncover so far, I believe this area was once a place used by powerful Gharu'ndim War Mages.
Any relics you find may be difficult or impossible for you to use. Perhaps, if you are skilled in Gharu'ndim War Magic you may be able to understand what I could not. You can't go down there if you're not level 20, in fact I wouldn't go down there if I were you. Just forget the whole thing, you're better off that way.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Kryst)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Faruza ibn Salaq
location.description:
Quest(s): Hollow Weapons, Chorizite Potions.
Creates Refined Chorizite Ore out of Chunks and gives useful spell information for Pyreal Motes, Slivers, Nuggets and Bars.

location.name: Fort Tethana Tumerok Collector
location.description: I am no friend of tumeroks. If you give me the gold insignia you may find among them, I will reward you well.

location.name: Gillian the Poacher
location.description:
Crafts Wisp Hearts and Large Ursin Head with Hide.
Gillian the Poacher tells you, "Hello, my name's Gillian! Do you know of any good places to hunt creatures? I'm looking for standard leather crafter items, plus some wisp hearts, if you find them. Also, if you bring me the hide of an Ursuin Slasher I can make you a comfy Ursuin hide rug."
Gillian the Poacher tells you, "Did you know that some creatures change along with the seasons? It makes for prime hunting all year round!"
Gillian the Poacher tells you, "It seems like Dereth is going downhill pretty rapidly. That's why I'm up here in the Bandit Castle. After its all over, we'll pick up the pieces."

location.name: Cragstone Ivory Crafter
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself. See our trophies and treasures section for more information on these and other monster trophies.

location.name: Cragstone Wing Collector
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Stone Collector (Qalaba'r)
location.description: I will take any number of trophy stones and Jewels, such as Virindi jewels, swamp stones, iron, copper, and granite golem hearts. I'll also take banderling trophies. But what I really specialize in are the rare black rocks and black stones.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Qalaba'r)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Yuan Hanzu
location.description:
Quest(s): Composite Bow, Composite Bow Upgrade.
Yuan Hanzu tells you, "Have you read my work on composite bows?"
Yuan Hanzu gives you Yaun Hanzu's Composite Bow Manual.
Yuan Hanzu tells you, "I can help you by carving pieces of horn to go into the bow's stave. If you are interested in crossbows, talk to my friend, Barnar the Tinker. Later, if your skills have outgrown your Composite Bow I might have a way to upgrade it."
Thanks go to CptDelta.

location.name: Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa will give you a reward of Peerless or Treated Heal Kits in exchange for Mnemosynes.
Hello. Myself and my brothers-in-arms have been assigned to exchange gifts with those that donate undead trophies to the Shagar Zharalim.
The literal translation of my name means daughter of the wind. I adopted it in honor of my mentor, who recently disappeared during a journey to Uziz.
There are healing kits even more potent than the ones dropped mainly by Lugians. The Zharalim have recently uncovered lore that enables them to treat these kits in order to make them more potent. If you trade me a memnosyne [sic] fragment, I will reward you in turn, depending on the quality of the fragment.
You give Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa A Large Mnemosyne.
Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa gives you Treated Healing Kit.

location.name: Anid Al-Fadee
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Anid Al-Fadee will give you Gems of Cleansing, Purity or Stillness in exchange for Mnemosynes.
Hello. Myself and my brothers-in-arms have been assigned to exchange gifts with those that donate undead trophies to the Shagar Zharalim.
I realize that it is dangerous to hunt the more potent Sand Kings without protection. With the proper gift, I have been authorized to grant you a gem that can disperse such maladies.
There have been many strange occurrences in the desert recently. On occasion, there are sudden sandstorms for no reason. It is very odd...
You give Anid Al-Fadee A Large Mnemosyne.
Anid Al-Fadee tells you, "Thank you. Here is your reward."
Anid Al-Fadee gives you Gem of Stillness.

location.name: Renselm
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Hand me the Mnemosyne. You will get your just reward.
Within Mnemosyne Collection Site (Large).

location.name: Hahnain
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Yes? Saelar told me to expect you. Why we need to deal with you...I will accept the Mnemosynes, but Renslem has been tasked with collecting and sorting the largest of the Mnemosynes. He can be found through that portal.
Within Mnemosyne Collection Site (Small).

location.name: Saelar
location.description:
Quest(s): Mnemosynes.
Greetings, outlander. I am Saelar of Menilesh. My master, the great Tennar Portheran perished during the Fourth Sending, along with so many of our people. But before he died, he set in motion a way for our people to preserve our heritage and our memories in the face of the recent catastrophes that have befallen the Dericost. He invented a number of Mnemosynes, devices that allow us to record our stories and lives in these little pyramids.
Tennar commissioned a locksmith from among your kind, whose name I do not know, to make these Mnemosynes lockable and to make keys to the Mnemosynes which only Tennar would possess. Unfortunately, I have no idea what happened to the lockpicker or his keys. The Mnemosynes have been coming in, and I have no way of opening them.
But still, if you come across a Mnemosyne please bring them to me and I will reward you well. The collection for the larger Mnemosynes I have tasked to my assistants whom can be found through the portal.
Within Mnemosyne Collection Site (Tiny).

location.name: Wing Collector (Yanshi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Shoushi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Sawato)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Nanto)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Mayoi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Ercel
location.description:
Quest(s): Ercel's Lost Book, Lost Distillery, Lytelthorpe Starter Quests.
Ercel tells you, "I'm writing a book on the subject of phyntos wasp wings, but alas, I lost it in the ruins east of here. Now I must start all over again! If you ever find my book please bring it to me."
Ercel tells you, "To get to the ruins, follow the pillars going east. Please hurry before the creatures destroy my book."
Ercel tells you, "Oh, once in the ruins, try to find the trail of rocks."

location.name: Wing Collector (Lytelthorpe)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Lin)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Glenden Wood)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Eastham)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Wing Collector (Baishi)
location.description: I collect only phyntos wasp wings. If you happen to have any, I'll pay you for them in pyreals. If you get me a gold wasp wing, I will reward you with a little extra experience.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Arwic)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Larry the Rabbit Master
location.description:
Quest(s): Bunny Master Title.
Larry the Rabbit Master has more than his hands full of bunnies. He might even be willing to reward someone who helped him out with his work. Perhaps you too could one day earn the title of Bunny Master?

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Eastham)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Glenden Wood)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Kryst)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Uziz)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Zaikhal)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Uziz)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Sawato)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Plateau Village)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Kara)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Fort Tethana)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Baishi)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Ivory Crafter (Ayan Baqur)
location.description: I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Danby's Outpost)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Cragstone)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Leather Crafter (Tou-Tou)
location.description: If you give me the hide of an armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar, I can make something with it that you may find useful.

location.name: Stone Collector (Zaikhal)
location.description:
I will take a number of tropy stones and jewels, such as virindi jewels, swamp stones, iron, copper, and granite golem hearts. I`ll also take banderling trophies. But what I really specialize in are the rare black rocks and black stones.
Takes Diamond Golem Hearts and gives 3 Diamond Scarabs for them.

location.name: Eluard the Namer
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth, Gold Hill Ruins.
Welcome to the Aluvian branch of the Bestowers' Guild. We have chartered ourselves to bestow titles upon worthy applicants. My assistant Caranis sells instructions and skill puzzle pieces. On the other side of the room, you can find the base piece for the skill puzzle. But you may only attempt the test once per day, and you may only hold one title at a time.

location.name: Jaizen Tan
location.description:
Quest(s): Bestowers Guild of Dereth.
I am the examiner here at the Sho outpost of the Bestower`s Guild.
Please speak with Naba Ko-Zin if you wish to arrange for an examination.
The base piece of the skill puzzle is available in the other corner of this tent.
Be warned, however, that the test can only be taken once per day, and one may only be called by one title."

location.name: Collector (Lytelthorpe)
location.description: I`m particularly interested in the spine of the sandy armoredillo. Get that to me and I`ll give you a health potion. I`ll also pay the same for swamp stones and the scalps of banderlings.

location.name: Jewel Collector (Baishi)
location.description:
In exchange for certain trophies, Jewel Collectors will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.
Jewel Collector tells you, "I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them."
Jewel Collector tells you, "But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures."

location.name: Jewel Collector (Hebian-To)
location.description:
In exchange for certain trophies, Jewel Collectors will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.
Jewel Collector tells you, "I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them."
Jewel Collector tells you, "But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures."
Thanks to Char'Med, WE

location.name: Jewel Collector (Sawato)
location.description:
In exchange for certain trophies, Jewel Collectors will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.
Jewel Collector tells you, "I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them."
Jewel Collector tells you, "But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures."

location.name: Trophy Smith (Plateau Village)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Trophy Smith (Qalaba'r)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Trophy Smith (Samsur)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Trophy Smith (Sawato)
location.description:
Trophy Smith tells you, "I am interested in armoredillo spines and golem hearts of all kinds. If you give me one I will craft an item from it, or give you something else of value."
In exchange for certain trophies, Trophy Smiths will give rewards such as pyreals, experience points and useful items.

location.name: Tumerok Collector (Dryreach)
location.description:
A collector that specializes only in Tumerok Insignias.
Gold Tumerok Insignia - 500xp - 1000 py.

location.name: Fazyad ibn Raymar
location.description:
Quest(s): Gem of Impulse.
Fazyad ibn Raymar tells you, "Have you come to help us cleanse the lower levels of vermin? As the Bey of Xarabydun, I will reward you greatly for trophies that prove the death of the beasts that prevent our growth."
Fazyad will also collect Rat Tails.

location.name: Wa Shi, Rat Collector
location.description:
Quest(s): Rat Tails.
Wa Shi tells you, "Once upon a time, Dereth was nearly overrun with rats. But through the efforts of many people, most of the rats have been eradicated."
Wa Shi tells you, "They can be hard to kill because one must aim low to hit them. I will take any rat tail trophies you find, but rats are much rarer now."
Wa Shi tells you, "I do know of a small lair of rats southwest of the waterfalls. Do not go if you hate rats."

location.name: Shosa Kiroji Matanui
location.description:
Quest(s): Tumerok Training Camps (Assault Weapons, Tumerok Banners.
Gives Sho Gems of Worth, xp and Assault Weapons in exchange for Tumerok Banners.
Shosa Kiroji Matanui tells you, "Greetings! My name is Kiroji, and I am a Shosa in the Sho Army. We must rally to deal with the renegade Tumerok alliance. We must not allow Hebian-To to fall!" Shosa Kiroji Matanui tells you, "Queen Elysa has called for volunteers to help investigate the Tumerok training camps near Dryreach. You can pick up a news sheet about this menace from the barkeeper."
