- Steve N.

location.name: Holtburg Healer and Peddler
location.description: Along the road from Holtburg to its Western Outpost you will find a small house with a healer and peddler seeing basic supplies.

location.name: Merchant
location.description: This travelling merchant seems to have set up a temporary shop in a small shelter, just off the road from Eastham to Arwic.

location.name: Roadside Merchant, Healer, Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 80%.
Set along the road from Nanto to Mayoi, these merchants sell various wares. Most notable of which are good and excellent quality healing kits.

location.name: Wandering Bowyer (Sawato)
location.description: Sells at 155%, buy at 90%.

location.name: Sho Roadside Weaponsmith and Farmer
location.description: Lou Dou the weaponsmith and the farmer Ri Na share this humble Sho dwelling on the road between Yanshi to Sawato. Many a portal traveller arrives in the area (Sho Roadside Portals).

location.name: South Yanshi Vendors
location.description:
Sells at 135%, buys at 90%.
Archmage Le-Ai Ren, Farmer Ri Na, Lun Dou, and Ru Shaha the Healer have opened a shop together at this rest stop on the road from Yanshi to Sawato.

location.name: Merchant Compound
location.description:
This compound is situated right next to an ancient Empyrean tower and a mysterious forest shrine. The resident blacksmith carries chain and yoroi while the merchant has a small selection of general supplies.
Beware of Mosswarts.

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This old farmer sells various cooking items and foodstuffs. Not much of a selection, but what do you expect so far off the beaten path.

location.name: Peddler
location.description: This strange little man has choosen to live a solitary life selling goods to whomever happens by and caring for his small herd of cattle.

location.name: Peddler
location.description: Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Merchant
location.description: This merchant has pitched his tent and offers his goods to those that happen to come by...

location.name: Healer
location.description: This lonely healer provides exceptional goods and services.

location.name: Peddler
location.description: He's a pleasant fellow. Doesn't have a lot on stock, but we had some nice chats and watched the dilloes playfully rolling down the snowy slopes... - Soulitaire

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This farmer sells various cooking goods and foodstuffs.

location.name: Archmage
location.description: A rather out of the way Archmage with a limited selection of goods.

location.name: Peddler (Sho Roadside)
location.description: Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Healer and Peddler
location.description: A wilderness healer and peddler living in a bunker. Also nearby are a small temple and a lifestone.

location.name: Roaming Bowyer
location.description: This roaming vendor has set up camp near Rithwic where she sells various archery supplies along with her speciality, armor piercing arrows.

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This vendor near Yanshi supplies food and basic cooking items.

location.name: Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage
location.description:
Sells at 110%, buys at 80%. Platinum Scarabs 44,000py.
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "Welcome to my lonely tower."
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "Travel with care in this land...Golems are coming in from the west."
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "Good choice, my friend."
Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage tells you, "This purchase favors you, friend.

location.name: Healer
location.description: Sells at 155%, buys at 90%.

location.name: Farmer
location.description: This farmer, tired of the bustles of city life has decided to settle around a little used lifestone. He will sell food and cooking supplies to those that happen by.

location.name: Merchant
location.description: The small Aluvian home of a merchant that lives along the Southern ridge next to Holtburg. Limited supplies, but a nice view. -GePS

location.name: Desert Archmage
location.description: This traveling archmage doesn't have much in the way of components, but he does posses a great selection of mana stones at fair prices as well as a good stock of alchemical supplies.

location.name: Silencia the Archmage
location.description:
Quest(s): Hollow, Phantom, Atlan, Isparian, Ravenous, Shadowfire, Weeping Weapons.
This mute archmage carries all the regular supplies but also sells something a bit unique: a strange glyph of unknown origin. It's almost as odd as the tame magma golem she keeps with her.

location.name: Statue Circle
location.description: This circle of status sites in the swamp just a bit southeast of Yanshi. There must have been something special about this place as even the toadstools have grown in a circle at its center.

location.name: Pillar Ruins
location.description: Three lone pillars on a hill overlook the road West of Yanshi.

location.name: Yanshi Festival Grounds
location.description: With a peddler and farmer this festival ground provides the ideal location for all sorts of games and gatherings. Perhaps that's why they are so crowded all the times? ;o)

location.name: Home of Devana bint Hamudi
location.description:
Quest(s): Oswald's Dagger.
Its rumored that Devana is the daughter of an Isparian assasin. Fact is that she won`t talk to anyone without an introduction.

location.name: Empyrean Watcher
location.description: Yet another of those strange stone heads that seem fairly common in the southern plains of Osteth.

location.name: Skeleton Bunker
location.description: This underground bunker in the sands west of Tufa is empty except for the animated skeletons which may be all that's left of the original occupants.

location.name: Hedged Platform
location.description:
While we don't know who, someone seems to continue tending the hedges surrounding the base of this Empyrean platform.
Grievver's set up camp here in PY14 during the The Hall of the Tusker King event. They now stand guard over a runed chest which, so they say, contains valuable treasure within.

location.name: Abandoned Tent
location.description: A skeleton has taken up residence in this tent. Beware however as his death with bring all the skeletons from the area down upon you.

location.name: Empyrean Platform
location.description:
Yet another of these platforms. These ruins are scattered around Dereth but their purpose is a complete mystery.
A group of mosswarts guards a runed chest here.

location.name: Skeleton Tower
location.description:
This empyrean ruin is now guarded by the undead remains of the soldiers that once manned it.
If you manage to brave the guardians, you might find some of their treasures in the two chests at this location.
Thanks to Breeanna and crew on Thistledown for reporting this location.

location.name: Battlefield of Ayn Tayan
location.description:
This point of interest consists of a small hill populated mostly by low level skeletons (mostly Warriors). At the base of the hill lies a statue of Bael'Zharon surrounded by many bones. Traveling up the hill you will find to carpeted with bones and some Skeletons. At the top of the hill you will find more bones and skeletons as well as a large Empyrean style head with a green mist surrounding it.
Lore:
This is actually the Battlefield of Ayn Tayan where the various undead factions banded together to fight Bael'Zharon and give the Asheron and the other Yalaini Mages time to construct their crystal array trap for Bael. The battle raged for three days was a victory for the undead because they were able to hold off Bael long enough for the Yaliani to complete their trap but the undead forces were completely devastated by the battle. During this battle the Sand King Anadil managed to destroy one of the original Shadow Spires.
The four Cairns and the green mist mark where the Sand King Nerash was slain by Leikotha who fought on the shadows side in order to get vengeance against Nerash for turning her into an undead. Another lore figure that died at Ayn Tayan was Jaera who was killed by Bael'Zharon himself and who's tomb is now found at the Mage Academy.
Notable lore figures that fought in the battle were:
Aerfalle Anadil Bael'Zharon Geraine IV Isin Dule Jaera (Killed) Leikotha Nerash (Killed) Rytheran
The best source of lore about the battle at Ayn Tayan is from Aerfalle's Letter.

location.name: Riverbend Tower
location.description: An empty tower with a view of the river, some trees and the hills. Scenic.

location.name: Mu-Miyah Temple
location.description: This temple found in the desert north of Tufa is the site of ancient sacrificial rites. It is populated by lesser, greater, and horrible mu-miyahs who guard a locked chest and a fountain of purple mystical energy. A variety of skeletons guard the outer walls.

location.name: Tou-Tou Bathhouse
location.description: Next to the leather crafter, the lifestone and some hot springs is the Tou-Tou Bathhouse. It caters to those cultivated individuals who can appreciate the two steaming tubs provided here.

location.name: Zelina's Cottage
location.description: Away from the hustle and bustle of Holtburg, next to a small bayou and a lifestone lies the plundered cottage of Zelina. It offers some shelter for travelers passing through.

location.name: Incomplete Lifestone
location.description: Inside this old temple stands this broken lifestone. Or was it never completed?

location.name: Tumerok Tower
location.description: Some Tumerok workers, scouts and a warrior or two keep their vigil here in the siege of Dryreach.

location.name: Standing Stone Outlook
location.description: This lovely location just east of Al-Jalima is the perfect spot to just sit and relax while enjoying the sunrise.

location.name: Fallen Suntik Messenger
location.description:
Some know the sad tale of the fall of the Suntik Village. Here is one of the reminders of that sad tragedy. This brave message died attempting to reach Glenden Woods for help. One mystery remains, who shot the arrows? The Monougas aren't normally know for using bows or crossbows. hmm...
Here's the note you can find at this location: Letter of Request
The Naquib of Suntik hereby requests all available mercenaries to assist in the purging our land of the fierce Mnougas. Our stronghold, located 16.2N x 4.4E, is under siege and supplies are low. Monougas are climbing the ridge near 18.5N x 3.6E and following it to our village. We can not hold out for long and our only hope is that this letter is found by a band of mercenaries with the will to help.

location.name: Mosswart Cave
location.description: This cave is now home to a tribe of Mosswarts, led by their chief. Be careful when attacking this location as every mosswart in the surrounding area will come to aid their fellows.

location.name: Mushroom Ring
location.description: A lone Ghost Wisp guards this location.

location.name: Swamp Rat Bunker
location.description: Take great care at this location. A horde of swamp rats have claimed this. Their lightning attack will quickly strip the flesh from the bones of those that disturb them. However the risk might be worth the reward, the standing stones around this location seem to indicate it has a special significance.

location.name: Shadow Spire Geyser
location.description: When the shadow spire appeared in Tou-Tou, this geyser sprang up below it. While the spire has since moved on, the geyser remains, marking where it once stood.

location.name: Planetarium
location.description: Known to many as the observatory, this strange Empyrean planetarium presumably contains a representation of the celestial bodies that make up the galaxy of this world we now call home.

location.name: Paul the Monouga (Babe the Blue Auroch)
location.description: Paul the Monouga and his pal Babe the Blue Auroch stand TALL in the Northern mountains of Dereth. They can not be attacked.

location.name: Watcher Monument
location.description: A group of four watcher stones arranged to be facing North, South, East and West with a Menhir-type stone. Nothing is known about what this monument was built for.

location.name: Caulnalain Menhir Ring (Aun Settlement)
location.description:
Quest(s): Menhir Mana Fields # 18.
Only a menhir ring now remains of the former dungeon.

location.name: Twin Faces
location.description: These twin faces greet travellers entering Samsur on the road from Uziz.

location.name: Nen Ai's House
location.description: Quest(s): Nen Ai's Pet Drudge.

location.name: Drudge Cave
location.description: A cave directly west of the Shoushi west outpost. Formerly the location of Lou Ka's Yaoji and before that, Lou Ka lived in this cave himself. Now all that remains is a chest with low quality treasure.

location.name: Drudge Temple
location.description: A Meeting Hall Style Building where a group drudges have made their home. Previously part of the Shoushi Southeast Outpost Starter Quest, where Bai Den's Gem was located.

location.name: Cathedral Island Bridge
location.description: This bridge leads to the island of Ithaenc which is home to an ancient Empyrean Cathedral.

location.name: Mosswart Temple
location.description: This temple is populated by Mosswart Clingers.

location.name: Anadil's Camp
location.description: This is the camp of the Sand King Anadil, the commander of most of the undead forces opposing the release of Bael'Zharon and the bearer of the Staff of the Nomads. The camp is populated with a variety of undead as well as Anadil himself.

location.name: Cathedral at Ithaenc
location.description: The famous cathedral now lies in ruin on the Isle of Ithaenc. Within its walls is a memorial to Lady Adja, a member of the Council of Five, and the tomb of Kelderam, Lord Atlan's squire and the leader of the Adjanite religious order. Adja's Memorial also doubles as an NPK altar. The Cathedral also housed the final soul stone that held the captive Bael'Zharon.

location.name: Undead Skytower
location.description: A tower manned by undead used in the campaign to protect the soul stone. It is populated by Liches and a Dark Leech. It also contains a portal to Chalicmere Castle.

location.name: Chalicmere Castle
location.description: The home of Faladaha the Emmissary and Gateway to Aerlinthe. Bring a C Note if you wish to use his services to gain access to the island. The Castle is guarded by a variety of undead and Diamond Golems.

location.name: Eternal Flame
location.description:
The Eternal Flame burns in memory of those slain at the Holtburg Redoubt during the Tumerok invasions. A Historical Marker placed nearby reads:
The Old Redoubt:
In the 6th year of our freedom from the Olthoi, the people of Holtburg were besieged and slaughtered here by Tumeroks. Only the children were spared, thanks to the heroism of the mage Celcynd. This eternal flame burns in their memory, and their mortal remains have been left interred here in tribute. Disturb not their rest.
Find out more in the Holtburg Starter quests and the quest for Brogord's Axe.

location.name: Zefir Tower
location.description: This empyrean tower is now simply a decaying husk. Has a Sturdy Steel Chest at top Guarded by 7 Enku Zefirs. Submitted by Zen Tek Ken.

location.name: Stone Platform
location.description: Just a strange platform with four constantly burning braziers.

location.name: Hilltop Drudge Tower
location.description: This hill is surrounded by a large group of Drudge Raveners who seem to be guarding a Runed Chest atop the tower.

location.name: North Road Watchtower
location.description: A lonely old tower beside the road between the Bandit Castle and Neydisa Castle allows you to keep tabs on who comes and goes between these two ancient structures.

location.name: Shard Vigil Monument
location.description: This Monument is located exclusively on the Thistledown server and serves as a monument marking the Defense of the Shard of the Herald by the Vigilant.

location.name: Essence of Strife
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
This strange creature is willing to trade mages for more powerful magical scrolls that will spread the essence of its being: conflict and strife.

location.name: Strange Humming Crystal
location.description:
Quest(s): Hieromancer's Armor.
This Strange Humming Crystal is only accesible through a randomly spawning portal called the Humming Crystal portal. It requires a key to unlock its secrets. It is said that only the most powerful War Mages may suceed in the Trials that it leads to.
Thanks to Kumo Miyamoto for providing co-ordinates for the Crystal.

location.name: Anadil's Tomb
location.description:
Quest(s): Staff Of The Nomads.
The tomb of the Sand King Anadil. A small inscription on the lid reads, "Last of the high desert's mighty, fallen at last. Honor is yours on this world chieftain. Serve the gods with distinction in the next."
This Crypt is heavily guarded by Horrible and Nomad Mu-miyah, at the bottom lies the Tomb of the Sand King Anadil, which holds his most prized possession the Staff of the Nomads.... The Tomb is locked and has a resistance of 350. Warning to those wanting to get the staff. Stamina traps galore. And the nomads arent the 50th level variety, but the 100 + variety. - Fon Win SC 10/20/2001. ACS

location.name: Drudge Camp
location.description: This ring of standing stones has become the home to a small camp of drudges. Have caution when you approach or they may try to add you to their pot.

location.name: Hebian-To Advocate/Sentinel Monument
location.description: A memorial to those who served as Advocates and Sentinels from PY 1-PY 11.

location.name: Zaikhal Advocate/Sentinel Monument
location.description: A monument to those who served as sentinels and advocates from PY 1 - PY 11.

location.name: Cragstone Advocate/Sentinel Monument
location.description: A monument to those who served as sentinels and advocates from PY 1 - PY 11.

location.name: Monty's Den Of Iniquity
location.description:
Monty's Den of Iniquity offers low, medium, and high stakes gambling as well as a shot at the big golden chest.
NPCs
Rare Exchanger Monty the Munificent Boddry the Chancy Pawn Shopkeep Aluvian Low-Stakes Gamemaster Aluvian Mid-Stakes Gamemaster Aluvian High-Stakes Gamemaster

location.name: Arshid's Den Of Iniquity
location.description:
Arshid's Den of Iniquity offers low, medium, and high stakes gambling as well as a shot at the big golden chest.
NPCs
Rare Exchanger Arshid al-Qiyid Ashadi Bint Samaq Pawn Shopkeep Gharu'ndim Low-Stakes Gamemaster Gharu'ndim Mid-Stakes Gamemaster Gharu'ndim High-Stakes Gamemaster

location.name: Gan-Zo's Den Of Iniquity
location.description:
Gan-Zo's Den Of Iniquity offers low, medium, and high stakes gambling as well as a shot at the big golden chest.
NPCs
Rare Exchanger Mi Gan-Zo Haya Su Ka Pawn Shopkeep Sho Low-Stakes Gamemaster Sho Mid-Stakes Gamemaster Sho High-Stakes Gamemaster

location.name: Essence of Enchantment
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
This is the where you exchange your level 6 creature scrolls for level 7 spells.
- Atarax (Leafcull)

location.name: Shimena Keep
location.description:
Shimena Keep was constructed on the northeast islet. Shimena guarded the northern approaches to Ireth Lassel research colony from Pelagian sea-nomads.
Image submitted by Kyn. Thanks!

location.name: Aurlanaa's Aerie
location.description:
The Gromnatross - can you see the little gromnie?
The Blessing of Aerlinthe. A gromnatross makes her aerie on the peaks of Cunara. She is named Aurlanaa by the people of the port.
The rumored nest of a Gromnatross at 89.0N 42.8E on Aerlinthe, overlooking a lava stream. There's a white Empyrean Ruin Meeting Hall Style Building nearby.

location.name: Aerlinthe Souvenir Tent
location.description: A Tent at 84.3N 45.0E on the West Shore of Aerlinthe, with a NPC selling the unique Souvenir T-shirts.

location.name: Relic Town
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle.
Image submitted by Kyn. Thanks!
(This image was taken with NightVision IV cast on the surveyor - the green color is due to a side effect. Thanks for understanding. - Soulitaire).

location.name: Zombie Cave
location.description: So close to Lin, it's ideal for a young adventurer's first zombie practice...

location.name: Essence of Verdancy
location.description:
Quest(s): Harbinger.
Here you can exchange your level 6 life scrolls for their level 7 counterparts.
Location courtesy of Ripshaw from Leafcull

location.name: Singularity Caul
location.description:
The mysterious new island of the Virindi. The Caul may hold the secrets of the Singularity, but its denizens will not easily give them up.
Those wishing to reach the Caul will need to kill the Guardian of the Singularity and then travel through the fixed Singularity Caul portal in the northern halls of the Singularity Bore or locate the randomly spawning Singularity Caul portal around the Direlands.

location.name: Virindi Crafters
location.description: These Virindi Crafters have skills in creating a variety of weapons, but to create these weapons they need a Quiddity Ingot.

location.name: Dwynna's Hut
location.description:
...there are apples around it, and there was a bronze armoredillo trapped inside (I let it out, and then it met with a horrible accident... impaled itself on a greater armor piercing arrow, poor thing)
- Dwynna Wildshot

location.name: Jungle Wasp Tower
location.description: Pretty wings... but nasty spells.

location.name: Pookie (the Rabbit of Caerbannog)
location.description:
Quest(s): Slaying Pooky, Bunny Slippers, Son of Pooky.
Not aggressive unless IDed
VERY hard hitting (possibly hollow)
Casts bunny smite ( a spell that instantly kills anyone if they don't resist)
Very high health regeneration
Run speed is 700: 10-to-1 speeds indicate that this creature runs at 70 MPH.
Nicknamed 'Pooky' by the Turbine Developer Jesse "Devilmouse" Kurlancheek.
Original version was added during the beta of Asheron's Call. It was updated after Maggie Jackcat's Campaign to 'buff the bunny' was a success, the campaign proposed that the rabbit should be updated to become a threat once more to the increasingly powerful playerbase
And the Lord spake saying: First thou shalt take out the Holy Pin Then shalt thou count to Three No more, no less Three shall be the number thou shalt count And the number of the counting shall be Three Four shalt thou not count Neither count thou Two Excepting that thou then proceed to Three Five is right out! Once the number Three, being the third number, be reached Then lobbest thou thy Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch towards thy foe Who, being naughty in my sight Shall snuff it.
Maynard: Amen
All:Amen
Arthur: Right
One, Two, Five!
Three, Sir!
Three!
Choir hymn
BOOM.
- text from, of course, Monty Python's movie

location.name: North Camp
location.description: A shelter from rain and misfortune, this camp is totally deserted.

location.name: Small Banderling Camp
location.description: Here you'll find several Banderlings lead by a Banderling Captain. They are guarding a chest of some sort. - Yhe of Wintersebb

location.name: Tumerok Slaughterhouse
location.description:
Don't know what else is in there besides Tumeroks, but outside are spawns of various virinidi, golems, grievvers, drudges, shadows, and at least one banderling rugby team (enforcers / thrashers / strikers) and of course Tumeroks of all kinds. There is a gate to get inside, not sure if it is locked or not.
- The Ticktock Man
Location and image submitted by the Ticktock Man. Thanks!
Note: The coordinates are those of the portal arrival spot. - Soulitaire, CoD cartographer

location.name: Empyrean Arch
location.description: Location and image submitted by the Ticktock Man. Thanks!

location.name: Sandy Armoredillo Lair
location.description: A bunker with a handful of Sandy Armoredillos above and below ground.

location.name: Tall Trees
location.description:
These mysterious trees look like they've stood for centuries.
Strange voices can be heard while in the presence of these trees.

location.name: Skeleton Tent
location.description: A few skeletons have overrun this desert tent.

location.name: Skeleton Tent
location.description:
Some skeletons have taken over this desert tent and laid waste to the previous occupants.
What secrets might they be hiding?

location.name: Tumerok Fort
location.description:
A direlands fort inhabited by Tumeroks.
A Tumerok Officer inside is known to drop a Tumerok Officer's Key.

location.name: Igloo
location.description: A snowman can be found occupying this frigid igloo.

location.name: Small Cottage
location.description:
A small, snow covered cottage sits alone in the Linvak Mountains.
It appears to be occupied by a rather unfriendly Bronze Armoredillo.

location.name: A Mosswart Ruin
location.description: This ruined temple has been overtaken by a small, but deadly, band of Mosswarts.

location.name: Loom
location.description:
Quest(s): Flags, Fetish of the Dark Idols, Mattekar Robes.
An ornate loom etched with ancient symbols. It seems to be in perfect working order despite its obvious age.
Give the Loom a spool of thread to fashion cloth.

location.name: Granite Golem Camp
location.description:
This bunker filled area in the Direlands is home to a rather large number of angry Granite Golems who would love to make you a permanent part of the landscape.
Thanks to Reska for submitting this location.

location.name: Tumerok Fort
location.description: Another one of the seemingly endless fortified structures controlled by Tumeroks that are found in the Direlands. This one houses many types of Tumeroks, including Priests and High Priests.

location.name: Bunker
location.description: This small underground bunker is the home to a few Greater Mu-miyah's and Gold Wasps.

location.name: Chest of Camping Mastery
location.description:
This chest, found in a small cave, is guarded well by many Tumeroks and Banderlings. Adventurer's frequent this chest after hearing rumors that it is enchanted with a spell which can increase the target's chance of finding phat loot.
Beware of the devilish images that may flood your mind when opening this chest. (The ghostly visage you see is that of Turbine Developer, Jesse Devilmouse Kurlancheek.)

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Guardian of the Temple of Forgetfulness
location.description:
Quest(s): Skill Redistribution.
A very large Empyrean head. It appears to be watching you.

location.name: Guardian of the Temple of Enlightenment
location.description:
Quest(s): Skill Redistribution.
A very large Empyrean head. It appears to be watching you.

location.name: Chess Board
location.description: A chess board where players can challenge each other to a match.

location.name: Lich House
location.description: A Lich guards the treasure located inside this lone house -- a runed chest!

location.name: Bandit Camp
location.description: A group of Bandits have set up camp here. One of them is rumoured to hold a firey quarterstaff of some value...

location.name: Chest of Camping Ineptitude
location.description: A group of liches and a lich lord in a tower are guarding a rather unusual chest...

location.name: Smith Ejan
location.description:
Quest(s): Lady Aerfalle.
This old undead can be found on the island of Aerlinthe muttering many things to himself.
Smith Ejan says, "Ai, Metresa?" In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "Yes, Mistress?"
Smith Ejan says, "Au virinaa! Au... baeaa?" In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "I breathe not! I... am not... slain?"
Smith Ejan says, "Etah si au hisenaa!" In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "Why can I not recall!"
Smith Ejan says, "Hanaurel..." In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "Written thoughts - letter..."
Smith Ejan says, "Kall ama te fen? Reann au..?" In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "Who was it for? Where do I..?"
Smith Ejan says, "Suvani hasode, Metresa, tamaa Dar Hallae." In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "Yes. The Shadows remain below, Mistress, at the Old Ring."
Smith Ejan says, "Zorn... zorn..." In your mind, the dusty voice of Ejan whispers, "All gone, all gone..."
Spawns In Relic Town.

location.name: Skeleton Bunker
location.description:
Quest(s): Silifi of Crimson Stars.
Skeletons in this bunker are guarding a mysterious Weathered Red Key.
This Weathered Red Key unlocks a door in the Sylsfear Dungeon.

location.name: Mysterious Empyrean Tower
location.description:
Quest(s): Spear of the Given Heart Quest.
This mysterious large structure is of Empyrean in design. What is it doing here and how did it go unnoticed for all these years?
Perhaps this is the same tower that a young man in Rithwic was mentioned to be looking for.

location.name: Iron Golem Guardian Camp
location.description:
Quest(S): Spear of the Given Heart.
These Iron Golem Guardians must be guarding something...but what?
Perhaps they are guarding an Archive as suggested by the keys they carry.

location.name: Tumerok Fort
location.description:
Quest(s): Overlord's Sword.
A Tumerok Fort that is locked and heavily guarded.
It is rumored that a Heavy Tumerok Key can open the main gate and that a High Priest's Key can be found on the corpse of a High Priest--assuming you can defeat him first.

location.name: Ulgrim's Island
location.description:
Quest(s): Ulgrim's Casting Stein, Ulgrim's Drinking Contest, Ulgrim's Hatch .
Ulgrim the Unpleasant has long spoken of his home. Well, here it finally is...at long last.
Ulgrim's Island can be reached by giving the Drunken Madman in Baishi a Mug of Winter Lager (purchase in Nanto bar).

location.name: Small Building
location.description: A small building with a lifestone next to it. Whoever built this structure has long since abandoned it.

location.name: Zefir Cave
location.description:
Quest(s): Minor Atlan Stones.
Inside this sunken bunker, guarded by a handful of Sufut Zefirs, is the Minor Sparkling Stone.
've heard tell of a strange purple stone in a cave south of Lin and west of Mayoi. It's guarded by nasty zefirs. There's also a book there, but no one I know has actually braved the zefirs to see what it's all about. If you want to try your luck, head northeast from the West Mayoi Mountain Villas.
-- A Sparking Stone
Minor Sparkling Stone.

location.name: Igloo
location.description:
Quest(s): Minor Atlan Stones.
This igloo in the frozen mountains contains the Minor Shivering Stone, but be warned, it is guarded by several Glacial Golems!
A pair of adventurers recently found a queer stone in the mountains to the north. They were returning from the assaults on the Frore, and became lost in a late blizzard. They took shelter in a small ice hut right on the edge of the Lost Wish Mountains, directly east of Holtburg and north of Cragstone. Inside they discovered a strange blue stone and a book. These seem to be artifacts of some lost form of Empyrean technology. Maybe you should investigate.
-- Unknown
Minor Shivering Stone.

location.name: Auroch Cow Pen
location.description:
A pen containing Auroch Cows found inside Candeth Keep.
Submitted by Zen Tek Ken.

location.name: Direlands Tower
location.description: This tower has and has the following monsters guarding a Steel Chest: Peerless Drudge, Drudge Cabalist, Drudge Mystic, Unconquered Drudge, Drudge Bloodletter.

location.name: Direland Rat Cave
location.description:
A cave full of Direland Rats. Spawns some workmanshipless Sunstone at the top.
Found by Circeus.

location.name: Abandoned Observatory
location.description:
Quest(s): Staff of the Nomads.
A structure overrun by shadows, containing a chest. Inside the chest is a bit of lore for the Staff of the Nomads quest. Is this a depowered power station?
Found by Circeus.

location.name: Small Beachside Farmstead
location.description: A small beachside farmstead with a Roaming Bowyer, near a LS.

location.name: Frank (melted snowman)
location.description: Alas poor Frank, Scold melted him well.

location.name: Sign
location.description: One of three signs for the quest to help determine who tried to kill the Queen.

location.name: Sign
location.description: One of three signs for the quest to help determine who tried to kill the Queen.

location.name: Sign
location.description: One of three signs for the quest to help determine who tried to kill the Queen.

location.name: The Portal Tree
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
This is the tree that you need to use to continue on the quest.

location.name: La Casa Del Noir
location.description:
Quest(s): Noir Assassination Investigation.
A house where you wake up along the way on the quest to determine who tried to kill the queen. There is an interesting journal inside.

location.name: Jojii Shrine and Scrawled Note
location.description:
Quest(s): Font Of Jojii.
A shrine found on the path to enlightenment. This was apparently the first stop made by Honshu Takeda, and he left a note for all to read.

location.name: Jojii Shrine
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
As you sit and pray at the small shrine you see a small note resting on the top. You take the note.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: An unlocked runed chest found in a bunker.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest at the old abandoned Sho outpost near the Eastham portal. There used to be a nearby Lifestone, but it was moved into the center of Shoushi.

location.name: Jojii Shrine
location.description:
Quest(s): Font of Jojii.
As you sit and pray at the small shrine you see a small note resting on the top. You take the note.

location.name: Statue of Bael'Zharon
location.description:
One of the many statues of Bael'Zharon on the Singularity Caul, found at 90.6S, 97.5W.
This statue is rather large, and it has many corpses of its followers/attackers/sacrifices(?) at its feet.

location.name: Razed Tower
location.description:
The tower is similar to the ones found on Marae Lassel except this one has been razed.
Appears to be one of the few safe places to buff, check loot and generally catch your breath on the new Caul Island.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest guarded by Mossward Fanatics and their leader.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest on a platform, guarded by mosswarts.

location.name: Runed Chest
location.description: A runed chest found in Fort Aimaru. It is heavily guarded by Mosswarts. This chest does produce items with minors.

location.name: Singularity Caul Recall / Singularity Bore Drop Point
location.description:
Drop point for both the singularity caul recall spell, and the exit from the Singularity Caul.
Thanks to Xenthic for this info and pic.

location.name: Stone Head Row
location.description: A series of Empyrean figureheads all in a row. One has been toppled over.

location.name: Banderling Camp
location.description: And what are the Banderlings brewing for dinner tonight???

location.name: Mystical Floating Bottle
location.description: A mysterious floating bottle in the middle of Nanto.

location.name: Bridge View
location.description: A vantage point on the Caul where you can view the floating tower bridge.

location.name: Caul Temple
location.description: A temple found on the Caul near a tower.

location.name: Caul Tower
location.description: A tower near a temple on the Caul.

location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Yun-Fat of TD and Bernard the Fox.

location.name: Small Creepy Statue
location.description:
Quest(s): The Forbidden Catacombs.
A small statue that looks just a little too life-like for comfort.
Thanks to Apollo Gael.

location.name: Green Mire Camp
location.description:
Quest(s): Green Mire Grave, Ice Tachi?.
Mosswarts are attracted to the swamps of this region. Near the Green Mire Grave dungeon, which is quite a ways north (and a tiny bit west) all the way over the river, there is a mosswart camp. One of them has a tachi that does ice damage. As you know, ice is useless against undead, but good against some other monsters. Don't go if you're new to the world, though. There are enough other dangers for a newcomer!
-- Green Mire Camp Directions

location.name: Font Guardian
location.description:
Quest(s): Clutch of Kings (Browerk).
Font Guardian tells you, "The heat released from the cavernous depths will power the gateway for twenty moments, then the way will close and power will need to be returned. Reason guide your action. The gate is unveiled, pass through and do what you must, I pray by the Sun, Stars, Earth and Moons that your path is noble."

location.name: Deru Tree Of Xi Ru's Island
location.description:
Quest(s): Knorr Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification.
Introduced in On Bended Knee.
This tree was long believed to be a Deru Tree, which was confirmed in The Beast With Many Heads in the Knorr Quiddity Seed Ingot Purification quest.
This tree grows atop the large cataracts overlooking the Chapel on Xi Ru's Island. To get to the tree, run west from the drop then north along the beach until you get to the Moarsmen Encampment at 60.1S 88.1W. From there, head south up the mountain all the way up to the Great Deru Tree at 89.8S 87.4E. The King's Crown water lily grows at the base of the tree. In The Beast With Many Heads, a dungeon was added that goes underneath the tree, Roots of the Deru Tree.
